story:
With over $150,000 previously raised and 2,500 units shipped - we're back with a new and improved Undercover Version 2.0!

 

 

 

 

 

If you’re still using a towel to change clothes outdoors, listen up!

 

 

There comes a time in every active person's life where they run into this problem: How to change clothes after your workout if you don't have access to a clean, or a private place to change (which happens often, sometimes every workout for some. The struggle is real.)

 

 

Say goodbye to changing in the back seat of your car, awkward towel changing in public, and public restrooms. 

The Undercover Version 2.0 is FASTER, QUICKER, and more convenient - saving you time, hassle, and frustration.

The Undercover V2 was designed to solve the problem of having to do outdoor wardrobe changes. This amazing patent-pending design is not available anywhere else, take a look.

 

 

How it Works (for bottoms): The Undercover V2 is designed to cover you up securely by a drawstring, and with it’s featured patent pending Side Access Openings, it allows you to access anything you need to remove. To redress, reverse the process. Slip out. Bam. That simple. You know you need it.

 

 

It's perfect for the ladies too!

Change into and out of sports bras, shirts, bikinis, and more with ease!

 

 

How it Works (for Tops): Ladies, you can now change your top without any embarrassing slips!

 

 

To start, slide The Undercover over your head and loosen the cord lock.

 

 

Next, slip your head into the strap loop and cinch the cord lock behind your neck to secure.

 

 

Then, you can remove your top or bra from the top or from underneath using the Side Access Openings (best for bikini tops and traditional bras).

 

 

Reverse the process to wear a new top. Bam. Faster and more secure than a towel.

 

 

It also converts to a backpack! (Yes, really!)

When your change is complete, zip it up, attach the clips, adjust to fit, and The Undercover 2.0 becomes a convenient Backpack.

 

 

 

You’ll wonder how you ever “adventured” without it.

 

 

With The Undercover, you're ready for anything! 


New and improved!

NEW technical fabric is even more durable, water repellent and moisture resistant. It’s machine washable. It’s perfect for people of all shapes and sizes. Now weighing in at approximately 4.8 ounces, it’s 1/3 the weight of the original, and half the size - you’ll hardly notice it’s there. Easily tuck The Undercover 2.0 in your luggage, glove compartment, or clip it to your pack and take it with you.    

The Undercover is the world's first mobile "changing room" of it's kind.  Use it for instant privacy, so you can change clothes anywhere with ease.

 

Version 2.0 Includes 9 Brand New Features + Upgrades!

  • NEW ONLY 4.8 OUNCES!  (73% Lighter than Version 1!)
  • NEW Ultra-Lightweight Water Resistant, Quick Drying Fabric
  • NEW Reflective Trim
  • NEW Reflective Logos
  • NEW Internal Pocket
  • NEW External - Self Packing Pocket with Double-Sided Zipper
  • NEW Branded Cord Lock
  • NEW Premium Zipper Pulls
  • NEW Extendable and Improved Microfiber Lens Wipe
  • NEW Backpack Clips
  • UPGRADED Premium Bottom Master Zipper
  • UTILITY: 2 x Hidden Key Loops
  • UTILITY: 2 x Side Pockets

 

 

 

 

Perfect for anyone who is active - runners, yogis, cyclists, triathletes, swimmers and surfers, yogis, hikers, campers, and more!  

The towel is the enemy!

 

 

Change the way you change!

 

 

 

 

Yes, you can even use The Undercover as a Backpack so you can store your gear to and from your destination.  Zip it & Clip it, adjust the straps for fit, and boom- it’s a Backpack.  You know you'll need this!

 

 

 

 

Cross the straps across your chest for added security.  Holds 10 lbs safely!  It's legit!

 

 

Water-Resistant Pocket

The NEW separate Water Resistant Pocket can store your wet or soiled items while keeping your other valuables protected.

 

 

2 Key Loops

 

 

 

New Reflective Details

The new reflective piping and logos give an added level of safety when you're on the go. Convert The Undercover into a backpack and take on the night with ease!

 

 

Stealth Pockets

Store Small Stuff +  Pocket for your Sunglasses. Two top-secret side pockets! Store a water bottle, phone, wallet and more in one pocket.  The second side pocket is designed to store your Sunglasses, and is has a NEW Micro Fiber Lens Wipe fabric so you can keep them clean anytime!

 

 

 

 

Dry/Wet Pack:

Protect Your Stuff: Use the 4th pocket, an Internal Moisture Resistant pocket, to keep your wet shorts, kit, mankini, or bikini away from everything else in the bag. You can also use the pocket to keep the contents drier.

 

 

 

 

Quick & Easy Self-Packing:

PACK IT UP! The Undercover V2 is self-packing and SUPER compact. You can use the same Internal Pocket to fold it into itself! The Undercover V2 only weighs 4.8 ounces (Less than half a can of beer!) and is much smaller and compact than a bulky towel. Keep one in your gear bag, glove compartment so you are ready for anything.

 

 

 

 

Ultra-Lightweight:

NOW 73% LIGHTER, AND MORE COMPACT than the original version!  PERFECT FOR TRAVEL!

 

 

More compact than a bulky Towel:

 

Better than one, too. The Undercover is much smaller than trying to lug your big bulky fluffy beach towel around just to do your clothing changes. Smaller is sometimes better.

 

 

Everyday Carry:

Keep The Undercover in your gear bag, locker, or car at all times - You'll be using The Undercover more than you think, which is a good thing because that means your outdoors, killing it, and not stuck behind a desk.

 

 

 

In conclusion, our Super-Scientific Research has concluded that The Undercover is:

  • 3x faster than a Towel Change
  • 140.6% percent easier
  • 300% more secure than a Towel
  • 1,567% Cleaner than a public restroom
  • 8000% cooler than changing with a Soiled Napkin
  • 75% of all statistics are made up

 

 

The Undercover is perfect for: 

 

Athletes, Adventurers, Team Sports: Use it everywhere (Don't leave home without it)- Imagine: Pack up The Undercover with your gear, change into your gear, and pack up all your stuff and strut home, easy-peasy style.

Runners, Cross-fit, Triathletes, Soccer Players, Swimmers, and more- we all change in odd places!

 

 

Teenagers and School Kids:  Let's face it - NO SCHOOL KID enjoys being forced to change in locker rooms or summer camp.  Do your son/daughter a favor and give them The Undercover so they have an option that gives them better security, and peace of mind.

 

Little Kiddos:  Instead of jamming your little kiddo in a cramped public restroom stall, while trying to squeeze between your stroller and the toilet, you can easily use The Undercover to avoid all of that headache.  Heck, there are literally a billion ways The Undercover can save you pain and suffering of raising a small child!  We know!  The struggle is real!

 

 

 

Sizing: One Size Fits Most!  (Max waist size 45 inches)  It might even be great for your kids! Share it with others. It's a perfect gift.

Colors: Comes in 1 color - Black and gray!

 

 

 

Select Your Perk Now:

With your pledge you are supporting us in a dream of making The Undercover, Version 2 and ending the "post-workout-flashes" forever! With enough pledges we will have enough money to launch this product, produce the orders, design a new website, and more.

We're not new to Indiegogo. With our huge success with our Undercover Version 1, and our women's product called The Undress, we had an overwhelming response to create a new Undercover Version 2. 

We are a company born in crowdfunding and we will continue to develop and launch new ideas with you in this community that we love and believe in.

Thank you for your support!

Be a Founder of The Undercover V2 and contribute today by selecting the perk you wish to receive


 

Built to go the distance:

 

The Fabric fabric used for the body is durable, water resistant, lightweight, and feels high quality to the touch (because it IS high quality).   The fabric is also:

  • Quick-drying
  • Sweat-wicking
  • Water-Resistant
  • Machine Washable

"I've seen my swimming coach's butt enough for a lifetime so he gets one now. " -Diana S.D.L.

"If you don't think you need this, then you don't work out hard enough." - Danny W.

"I can put chamois cream on underneath that thing before putting bibs on?! SOLD!" - Logan H. Bass, CAT 1 Cyclist

"A product this good doesn't need Testimonials. That's my testimonial."- Allan B.

"I will seriously wear this around town with nothing else." - Doug S.

Production Schedule:

 

  • July 2019: Finalize Design of The Undercover V2
  • August 2019: First Test Production of V2 (Cont.)
  • April 2020: Launch Indiegogo
  • June 2020: Ship The Undercover to all Indiegogo contributors
  • And then, WE Celebrate!

 

How we came up with the design of The Undercover:

 

The design of The Undercover was a natural evolution of The Undress, which Dennis invented and developed with April in 2013. (Yes, a dude invented a dress.)

The Undress was the first portable changing room of it's kind for women, and naturally, our community wanted us to design a version with men in mind.  Men don't need the top portion of The Undress, so The Undercover is essentially The Undress "skirt" with a zipper at the bottom hem to close it and allow it to hold items (thus, creating a backpack). So yes, The Undercover has a woman's dress DNA in it, but we know you're man enough to handle that.

The first Undercover was a success, raising over $100,000!

Now, we're finally launching The Undercover V2 as a response to many years of requests for a new design!  We dig it.

 

 

Meet the Founders & Team!

  • Dennis Caco - Co-Founder, Inventor, Runner, Cyclist, Triathlon, Dad
  • April Estrada - Co-Founder, Product Development, Genius
  • Marat Zabelinskiy - Customer Service and Fulfillment Technology
  • Nestor Pecache - Photo
  • Mark & Ricardo - Video and Editing
  • Andew Nguyen - PR & Strategic Alliances
  • Andrew "Freedom" Lane - Design Hacker
  • Jerry & Margerita Estrada - #1 Fans
  • Ben Arena - Mr. Money Bags
  • Mimi - Ms. Money Bags.  And Marc!
  • Test Fit Team and Athletes: Tyler, Stephanie, Ysabel, Raymond
  • Ross Huguet - "The Voice"
  • Cross Promo Partners
  • Special Thanks:
  • Rachelle and Drake Caco - For being an awesome wife (and mom), and amazing son who keeps Dennis inspired to live his dreams!  And my Mom!

 

Hi Everyone! We have units coming very quickly, and our intention is to ship these as soon as possible after the campaign ends. We're very confident about this first shipment that we have added a guarantee we have never seen before 

 

SHIPPING:  Some perks qualify for FREE USA Shipping.  For the lower perks that do not include free USA shipping, they will be charged after the campaign is over to take advantage of bulk shipping rates to benefit everyone.  Expect the average shipping fee in the USA to be $5 per unit which is reasonable, and your cost may be lower or higher depending on your address.  However, we still suggest you get a higher tier reward level so you get free USA shipping anyway! :)

INTERNATIONAL SHIPPING PRICES - Is EXPENSIVE!  We don't make money on shipping, and yes, we hate it too!  We suggest buying 3 or more units to cover the initial cost of shipping (Bulk shipping is more cost effective)

 

Prototypes shown - design, spec, weight, colors, etc. subject to change without notice.  Est. Total MSRP is calculated with $5 Shipping per unit calculated. The Undercover™ and The Undress™ 2016-2020 ©Copyright The Undress, Inc.  Patent Pending.

  The Undercover is perfect for:  Athletes, Adventurers, Team Sports: Use it everywhere (Don't leave home without it)- Imagine: Pack up The Undercover with your gear, change into your gear, and pack up all your stuff and strut home, easy-peasy style.Runners, Cross-fit, Triathletes, Soccer Players, Swimmers, and more- we all change in odd places!  Teenagers and School Kids:  Let's face it - NO SCHOOL KID enjoys being forced to change in locker rooms or summer camp.  Do your son/daughter a favor and give them The Undercover so they have an option that gives them better security, and peace of mind. Little Kiddos:  Instead of jamming your little kiddo in a cramped public restroom stall, while trying to squeeze between your stroller and the toilet, you can easily use The Undercover to avoid all of that headache.  Heck, there are literally a billion ways The Undercover can save you pain and suffering of raising a small child!  We know!  The struggle is real!   Sizing: One Size Fits Most!  (Max waist size 45 inches)  It might even be great for your kids! Share it with others. It's a perfect gift.Colors: Comes in 1 color - Black and gray!   Select Your Perk Now:With your pledge you are supporting us in a dream of making The Undercover, Version 2 and ending the "post-workout-flashes" forever! With enough pledges we will have enough money to launch this product, produce the orders, design a new website, and more.We're not new to Indiegogo. With our huge success with our Undercover Version 1, and our women's product called The Undress, we had an overwhelming response to create a new Undercover Version 2. We are a company born in crowdfunding and we will continue to develop and launch new ideas with you in this community that we love and believe in.Thank you for your support!Be a Founder of The Undercover V2 and contribute today by selecting the perk you wish to receive Built to go the distance: The Fabric fabric used for the body is durable, water resistant, lightweight, and feels high quality to the touch (because it IS high quality).   The fabric is also:
Quick-drying
Sweat-wicking
Water-Resistant
Machine Washable
"I've seen my swimming coach's butt enough for a lifetime so he gets one now. " -Diana S.D.L."If you don't think you need this, then you don't work out hard enough." - Danny W."I can put chamois cream on underneath that thing before putting bibs on?! SOLD!" - Logan H. Bass, CAT 1 Cyclist"A product this good doesn't need Testimonials. That's my testimonial."- Allan B."I will seriously wear this around town with nothing else." - Doug S.Production Schedule: 

July 2019: Finalize Design of The Undercover V2

August 2019: First Test Production of V2 (Cont.)

April 2020: Launch Indiegogo

June 2020: Ship The Undercover to all Indiegogo contributors
And then, WE Celebrate!
 How we came up with the design of The Undercover: The design of The Undercover was a natural evolution of The Undress, which Dennis invented and developed with April in 2013. (Yes, a dude invented a dress.)The Undress was the first portable changing room of it's kind for women, and naturally, our community wanted us to design a version with men in mind.  Men don't need the top portion of The Undress, so The Undercover is essentially The Undress "skirt" with a zipper at the bottom hem to close it and allow it to hold items (thus, creating a backpack). So yes, The Undercover has a woman's dress DNA in it, but we know you're man enough to handle that.The first Undercover was a success, raising over $100,000!Now, we're finally launching The Undercover V2 as a response to many years of requests for a new design!  We dig it.  Meet the Founders & Team!
Dennis Caco - Co-Founder, Inventor, Runner, Cyclist, Triathlon, Dad
April Estrada - Co-Founder, Product Development, Genius
Marat Zabelinskiy - Customer Service and Fulfillment Technology
Nestor Pecache - Photo
Mark & Ricardo - Video and Editing
Andew Nguyen - PR & Strategic Alliances
Andrew "Freedom" Lane - Design Hacker
Jerry & Margerita Estrada - #1 Fans
Ben Arena - Mr. Money Bags
Mimi - Ms. Money Bags.  And Marc!
Test Fit Team and Athletes: Tyler, Stephanie, Ysabel, Raymond
Ross Huguet - "The Voice"
Cross Promo Partners
Special Thanks:
Rachelle and Drake Caco - For being an awesome wife (and mom), and amazing son who keeps Dennis inspired to live his dreams!  And my Mom!
 Hi Everyone! We have units coming very quickly, and our intention is to ship these as soon as possible after the campaign ends. We're very confident about this first shipment that we have added a guarantee we have never seen before  SHIPPING:  Some perks qualify for FREE USA Shipping.  For the lower perks that do not include free USA shipping, they will be charged after the campaign is over to take advantage of bulk shipping rates to benefit everyone.  Expect the average shipping fee in the USA to be $5 per unit which is reasonable, and your cost may be lower or higher depending on your address.  However, we still suggest you get a higher tier reward level so you get free USA shipping anyway! :)INTERNATIONAL SHIPPING PRICES - Is EXPENSIVE!  We don't make money on shipping, and yes, we hate it too!  We suggest buying 3 or more units to cover the initial cost of shipping (Bulk shipping is more cost effective) Prototypes shown - design, spec, weight, colors, etc. subject to change without notice.  Est. Total MSRP is calculated with $5 Shipping per unit calculated. The Undercover™ and The Undress™ 2016-2020 ©Copyright The Undress, Inc.  Patent Pending.

story:
Summary

Hello! We are Kansas Quidditch and at the Midwest Regionals, we qualified to move on to the next stage of competition, the World Cup! The World Cup is the premier tournament for quidditch and the end goal for all teams! Last year we finished in 5th place with a 6-1 record falling only to World Cup runner-up UCLA in the Elite Eight. Getting to this level however has been extremely taxing on our resources, we played in many tournaments around the Midwest and have the bruises and injuries to prove it, all the practice and preparation in tournaments leading up to our Regionals placed a great deal of stress on our treasury. We have one final push to fundraise in getting to the World Cup VII and any help would be greatly appreciated! We hope to get to the World Cup and continue the winning tradition of Kansas and make an impact on the game of quidditch at a national level.

Goal

We set a goal of $800 which would supplement the travel to and from South Carolina and would simplify all travel and monetary constraints of the club. Any remaining funds would be placed in our account with the University of Kansas and kept safe for the future in the following year.

Individual Donation

If you know a certain player on the team you'd like to help raise funds for, we'd be more than happy to ensure that a VERY LARGE portion of that donation goes to that player! Send us a message or leave a comment with who and we'll see that the donation goes to that player!

The Impact

The impact of your donation would be enormous. Any donation is appreciated and will help the club tremendously. All donations can be guaranteed to go directly to the club and into our club's account at the bursar's office at KU.

Other Ways You Can Help

Sharing this campaign with friends, family, or anyone helps greatly! Getting our campaign out there is the first step to helping us realize our goal!

story:
Help Pass Amendment 2:

Safe and Legal Medical Marijuana in Florida

On November 4, 2014 the residents in the State of Florida will vote on Amendment 2 which will make medical marijuana legal state-wide. The Villages Collective is a nonprofit organization located in Lady Lake, Florida dedicated to raise money in order to:

  • Raise awareness about the new laws around medical marijuana in Amendment 2
  • Bring forth information on how the average person can use medicinal marijuana to treat illness
  • Give people info on how they can vote, talk to their representatives and get the word out to others in order to pass the law

How You Can Help:

  • If you are a registered voter in Florida, then Vote Yes on Amendment 2 this November.
  • Tell others about the benefits of safe and legal medical marijuana and encourage them to vote Yes on Amendment 2.
  • Make a contribution of any amount here to help us continue to get the word out

Why Is Medical Marijuana So Important?

The Villages Collective’s goal is to be able to provide safe and legal medical marijuana to the terminally ill and seniors where traditional pharmaceutical treatments are not helping them. There are many cases where patients with epilepsy, who are over medicated and terminally ill patients who need some comfort have greatly benefited from the use of medical marijuana.

For Which Symptoms or Conditions Might Marijuana Provide Relief?

The US Government Accountability Office (GAO) noted the following symptoms or conditions under Appendix IV of their Nov. 2002 report titled "Descriptions of Allowable Conditions under State Medical Marijuana Laws":

  1. Alzheimer's Disease
  2. Anorexia
  3. AIDS
  4. Arthritis
  5. Cachexia
  6. Cancer
  7. Crohn's Disease
  8. Epilepsy
  9. Glaucoma
  10. HIV
  11. Migraine
  12. Multiple Sclerosis
  13. Nausea
  14. Pain
  15. Spasticity
  16. Wasting Syndrome"

"It's my HEALTH my CHOICE"

    What is Villages Collective:

    In reality a collective, in its simplest form is a place where those who provide medical marijuana can help those who currently do not grow or have their own. A collective allows both “types” of patient the ability to participate as long as they have a valid medical marijuana recommendation or card AND they are a member of the collective itself.  If you were to ask 10 medical marijuana patients, “what is a medical marijuana collective?”, odds are you would  get 10 different answers simply because a collective plays a unique role in each and every patients life. For many patients, it is where they get their daily, weekly or monthly medication or ritual.

    So setting up a medical marijuana collective can actually be more expensive than you might think. Many cities have their own tax system in place where collectives pay a % ON TOP OF the current city and state taxes. This “hidden cost” of setting up a collective is something that many potential new collectives have not considered.

    Other costs associated with setting up and running a successful collective include many things such as security, rent, insurance, shop manager, receptionists and the actual mmj products themselves. There are also other costs called “safety net” purchases such as attorney and accounting fees. You need professionals who understand mmj laws and how they pertain to collectives specifically while adapting to any new and or changing laws.

    In general the average collective start-up costs are in the $50k to $100k range. There are many collectives that appear to have launched for what seems like next to nothing, however even those smaller “hole in the wall” types of collectives had plenty of costs associated especially when just getting started.

    The actual term “profit” is somewhat vague especially when we are talking about a non-profit mmj collective. Many outside the industry take the term non-profit quite literally in which they think that everyone who works at the collective is not getting paid and simply volunteering their time. While this would be admirable, that in reality is NOT what is actually happening.

    Each and every “volunteer” is getting meds, donations or something in exchange and that along with all other costs must be figured into the “donation prices” for the various medical marijuana products and services offered.

    As you can see the costs in starting up and launching a successful collective has many variables especially when calculating costs. The pay off however if done correctly can be huge especially when being able to benefit fellow medical marijuana patients with quality medicine and service.

story:
Moved to Give Forward!

What is this?

I am now trying to save up money to get top surgery*!

I experience extreme dysphoria (discomfort) in regards to my chest. From getting dressed in the morning to being awkwardly stared at in town, my chest prevents me from having 1 day without anxiety.

It may seem like I don't care so much about not having a flat chest, but I can almost guarantee that for every time you think about the appearance of your hair, your clothes, your make-up--I've thought about my chest at least 20 times more. This is a daily struggle for me, and top surgery is the absolute best solution. It is also my #1 priority when it comes to my transition and saving money.

* "Top surgery" means that I'll be getting a sort of bilateral mastectomy--but the kind that will make my chest look like a typical male chest. Many female-to-male transgender people get this surgery done so that they can feel comfortable when they do every day tasks--take a shower, get dressed, go swimming, get undressed, or just walk around without having to feel extremely uncomfortable about having a female chest.

Okay, so what do you want?

It may seem like a lot to ask for $6,500 (42.000kr), but I'll explain why it's so expensive.

  • Double Incision top surgery performed by Dr. Charles Garramone in Sunrise, Florida, costs $6,500 for surgery alone. (http://drgarramone.com/blog/costs/)
  • Any money I save on the side will go to travel (getting from Sweden to Florida and back. (approx. $800 or 5.000kr)
  • I also have to pay to live in Florida for a little over a week so that I can see the surgeon for post-op check ups. Hotel prices vary, but regardless, I have to pay for food and housing for over a week.

If I don't reach my goal of $6,500, any donations I receive will be put into a bank account specifically set up for surgery savings. I will be putting money into that bank account every month as well. If I receive more than $6,500 (if that could ever happen...) the extra money will go to travel and living costs while I'm in Florida.

Why are you doing this...

I've been out as transgender for almost 3 years now, and I've been taking testosterone for 8 months. I've come very far in the past few years regarding my gender transition, both mentally and physically! But I seem to be held back by my chest. As dramatic as it may sound to you, I still feel like I'm trapped in a cage of discomfort that I have to walk around with all day, every day. I've learned to ignore that specific part of my body--a very unhealthy way to go about your daily life, obviously. Now I've had enough of the discomfort.

Top surgery for me is more than just looking better or being "attractive." It's about getting by from day to day. It's about being able to accept and love my own body.

Any size donation will be infinitely appreciated. Just the idea of being accepted and supported for who I really am is huge to me. 

I'd love to help, but I have no money!

I just got my first job and I haven't gotten a pay check yet, so the feeling of $0 in the bank is familiar to me. If you can't afford to donate any money:

  • Share with someone who maybe can! Use Facebook, Twitter, or any social networking site. Or maybe an LGBT group that you know organizes fundraising for this kind of thing? 

  • Ask a parent for maybe $5, or billionaire relative for $5,000! Who knows...

  • If you're not capable of giving money for any other reason, you can just leave me a message wishing me luck, and that'll be more than enough!

Thanks for reading! Now, let's go!

story:
We are Angélica Ramos and Akemi Akachi, and we want to tell you a little bit about our dear friend Blanca Camacho.

Blanca is a 33 year-old talented graphic designer from Mexico City who studied and worked in Toronto and London (UK). She has a magnetic personality that makes her stand out in a crowd and a smile that can light up a room. She is a generous, caring friend with a beautiful heart. Once you meet her you never forget her.

A year ago while living in London her life was suddenly put on hold when she was diagnosed with throat cancer. She moved back to Mexico with her family where she received treatment. After months of enduring painful chemotherapy and radiation the cancer was eradicated from her throat. However, a month ago, still very weak and emotionally exhausted, Blanca found out the cancer had spread to several bones.  Now she is facing chemotherapy once again.

Blanca and her family are going through very difficult times; this fundraiser is to help them cover some of the medical expenses.

Our goal is set for $5000*, but there's no limit, every donation counts. Please also help us spread the word.

Thank You!!

*UPDATE: 

Congratulations on having reached and passed the $5,000 mark in less than 5 days! We are very grateful for everyone of you!

If you haven’t had a chance to donate yet, don’t worry, the campaign is not over until Sunday May 19 2013.

So lets keep it up, the sky is the limit!

story:
Who I am

I am Jamie.  I am a wife, a mother of 4 and a critical care nurse.  I have a rare genetic disease called Ehlers-Danlos Syndrome (EDS).  EDS is a connective tissue disease, meaning that it can affect anything in my body made of connective tissue.  For me, this has been my joints and my gastrointestinal system.  I also have several associated disorders.  I have a chiari malformation, which means that the very bottom of the back of my brain has slipped into my spinal column and is putting pressure on my brainstem and causing many neurological symptoms.  I also have tethered cord syndrome.  This means that my spinal cord does not freely float at the bottom of my spine.  Instead, it is attached or tethered to the bones by tissue.  This means that when I bend or move my spinal cord stretches. 

All of the above has caused symptoms such as severe headaches, vertigo and dizziness, hand and leg weakness, loss of sensation in my arms/legs, speech problems, swallowing difficulties, very high pressure in my head (blocked spinal fluid), loss of function in hands/legs, neck pain, back pain, shoulder pain, tremors, and vision problems.  It can lead to more severe problems including paralysis and death.

What I need

Since these are such rare conditions, they require extensive travel to treat.  Local physicians generally do not treat these conditions.  I travel to Cincinnati OH to see the geneticist who helps with the EDS.  My chiari and tethered cord are treated by a neurosurgeon, Dr Henderson, in Maryland, nearly 600 miles away.  There are no neuro's closer who understand and treat chiari and TC while keeping in mind the complications of EDS. 

This fall, Dr Henderson will be performing at least 2 surgeries to help slow and maybe even reverse some of the symptoms that I have.  The first will be a "detethering" surgery.  This is to detach the spinal cord from my bones.  The second will be a "decompression".  This is brain surgery to make room around the base of my head and relieve pressure. 

The cost will be tremendous.  The first surgery requires a deposit of $3900.  The second surgery requires a deposit of $9000.  That is a total of $12,900.  I do not have that.  There will also be the cost of driving the 1200 mile round trip each time, the follow up visits, the week long motel stays after surgery, before I am able to make the trip home, food and necessitities. 

 

 

Your contributions will help me have the surgeries that I need so that I can maintain my current functioning.  It will help me continue to be a good mother and it will help me continue to be a nurse.  Without these surgeries, I'm just not sure what will happen.

No one wants to ask for help.  Sometimes, we have to, though.

No one wants to ask for help.  Sometimes, we have to, though.

story:
Hi I am one of the many voices at L&M that are on strike. 800 healthcare worker have been locked out of their jobs because of labor dispute based on not money like many people have been led to believe but on patient care principles.  Lawrence and Memorial has been out sourcing jobs to save health care dollar, not to another corporation but to themselves. Yes  that right they are laying off workers at one establishment and rehiring people with a 20-30% pay cut, no union protection, limited benefits and no sick or pto time that the worker had previous to their layoff.  This tactic is planned to continue unless the healthcare workers stand up for what they know is right for the community.  All the workers want is to be able to transfer the most qualified staff to where the jobs are going not be replaced by less qualified staff.  The staff has been on strike for 9 days and locked out since. We want to cooperate and negotiate but the hospital administration refuses, often times walking away from the table and never coming back.  There is no end in sight for this health care tragedy.These 800 people are without health insurance or a way to pay for their expenses. There is no income coming in for most families. People are filing for employment, going to food panties, there are no guarantees for anyone in this.  There are roughly 250 scab workers doing the job of 800 in a fully functioning hospital, jeopardizing the communities well-being and how medical care is given to them.

  The only way this union can stay together in solidarity is for support from the community.  While we are strong now we need to remain this way but support financially. The hospital needs to know that we can survive on our own without their help. This is done by providing for our own in a time of need. Each person needs to feel the support the community has to offer.

 I am asking for donation not to support myself but to support the lives of those that are now without insurance, money and jobs.  Those families that have single parents supporting children with no income coming in.  If we can provide for those with the least support now we will remain strong in the future.  The money will be used to help those who need money for groceries, medical expenses and more depending on what we can raise.  This is a time to pay it forward and show people there is humanity and community still out there in the United States. Together we will make health care history by not bending to what the hospital wants us to believe!!! I am asking everyone to donate $1, especially those in unions where I know workers have felt bullied by forces outside of their own control.  Let's take back control and provide for each other so we remain strong!!!

Please send this link to anyone that you feel can be of any help.  What happens with this strike sets the bar for future battles in the State of Connecticut as well as the nation. We are not asking for a lot from Lawrence and Memorial other than to respect and support the staff that they employee but treating them like competent and valued employees instead of replaceable.

story:
Fred Walsh of the Rotary Club of Kentville has been the driving force behind 30 years of support for Operation Eyesight (OE).

  Recently, Jennifer Diggens, manager of Fund Development for Operation Eyesight, sent a thank-you to the club to express appreciation for the generous support given over the years.

  Several years ago, a club president decided to create a Fred Walsh Fund in honour of Walsh, a long-time member. Walsh, a well-respected farmer in the Valley, lost the sight in one eye many years ago in a farming accident. As a result, he became a big supporter of the CNIB and Operation Eyesight. He and his wife, Mary, are involved in many community causes. 

In 2008, Walsh was awarded the Order of Canada for his extensive volunteer work by then-Lieutenant Governor Michaelle Jean. 

  To support the Fred W Fund, Kentville Rotarians are given an opportunity at each week to contribute to the fund and share a story or occasion that is of a positive nature.  The funds collected are matched by the club and currently by CIDA, says Heather Tupper, so that by the time it reaches Operation Eyesight, it has more than tripled. Over the past three and a half years, over $6,500 has been contributed.

  Operation Eyesight is an international organization whose mandate is to assist local eye doctors, educators and community leaders in their efforts to combat blindness in countries throughout Africa and South Asia. Diggens, in consultation with the club, identifies which programs are most in need and can best benefit from assistance. Fred Walsh funds have gone to support special surgical equipment, eye clinics, water purification and prevention education.

Please help us spread the word to help those less fortunate. 

Thank you

The Rotary Club of Kentville, NS
District 7820

story:
As an Emergency Nurse, I have seen many children come to the Emergency department needing diagnostics, lab work & treatments.  All of which are necessary but cause significant stress, anxiety and pain to children.  
     My campaign is to create an age and gender specific gift give-away program aiming to reduce the negative impact of emergency interventions and subsequent hospitalizations. 
     Your contribution will make a huge difference in many children's emergency experience, leaving them with a positive notion of what a trip to the hospital entails.


What We Need & What You Get

     At Tofino General Hospital, there is statistically 500 paediatric patients that present to the Emergency department each year.  Albeit, not every child that presents to the hospital requires intensive diagnostics and treatment but that doesn't mean that every child wouldn't benefit from some degree of distraction from their hospital visit.

     I have worked in a large Emergency department where there has been a very successful Paeds gift-giveaway program.  Consulting with the program coordinator, a price of $5 per gift bag was the average cost.   With this price in mind,  I hope to create 450 gift bags at $5 per bag totaling $2250.  I would also like to procure a portable DVD player and begin to build a library of age appropriate videos with the remaining $250.  If the full donation goal is not achieve, I will create as many $5 gift bags as possible.

     The perks for donating to this cause are limitless....no I don't have any Dave Matthews tickets to give away or any autographed Toopy and Binoo posters, but there is reward of positive karma.  You decide how much to give and how much you get!  Surely, any donation will absolutely make a difference in a child's ability to cope with the stress of a hospital encounter.  Whether it be a sparkle baton or crayons and colouring paper,  the impact that these small gestures provide are profound.


Other Ways You Can Help

No Money...No Problem....you can fill your boots with a boat load of karma by sharing this campaign with your friends, family and community. 

Thank you.

story:
WHAT ARE WE TRYING TO DO HERE?

Business CONCEPT: Adopt a Greek Olive Tree

  • The web visitor will be offered the opportunity to adopt an olive tree located in Southern Greece for 1 year.
  • For an annual fee + shipping, the customer will receive premium extra virgin olive oil that come from harvesting that specific tree.  Cool!

The option to buy extra virgin olive oil and products without having to adopt a tree would be available.

On the surface, there may be something silly about adopting an olive tree, but this idea has some serious real-world consequences. It will offer small-scale farmers access to international markets! 

With this wonderful new trend to farm-to-table dining on the rise and consumers stressing the importance of sustainable, fair-trade agriculture, this adoption program hits the right note.

Sadly, with the current economic crisis, young adults are  woefully unemployed.  This future business will help create jobs on all levels...picking, pressing and packing...and shipping!   And, of course, we would like to create an authentic, extra virgin olive oil that will ultimatley come from "junior", your adopted tree...From Your Tree, to Your Table!

Greece is at crossroads.  The economic crisis is hardly over.  The country and its citizens are taking an international beating and what better time to remind the world that Greece is beautiful, exceptional, resilient and hardworking. Nobel Prize Poet Elytis had once said, "If you deconstruct Greece, at the end you will see that you are left with an olive tree, a vineyard and a boat. Which means that you can rebuild it." So let's do it, one olive tree at a time!

WHO THE HELL DO WE THINK WE ARE?

Peter Boufeas and Jacqueline Syrett  have teamed up!  What does a mechanical engineer from Athens and a radio/tv producer from Toronto have in common?  Other than a penchant for late night taverna crawls and an obession with their bucket lists?  A wild imagination, intense entrepreneurial spirit and a great love for olive oil! Oh, and a little country called Greece.

WHAT DO WE NEED & WHAT DO YOU GET?

The 2012-2013 Olive Harvest is in full swing!  Raising $20,000 dollars is essential to getting this business off the ground. As a matter of fact it’s the absolute minimum needed!  

We call it the three P's...or 3P or better yet P cubed (for the engineering mind) Picked, Pressed and Packed!!  And of course this is done all in the country of origin, ELLAS, aka Greece.  

From hiring local people to maintain the groves, harvest, pack, transport, press and bottle the oil.  As well as paying all the fees, duties, lab tests and associated licensing needed.  Website and graphic design as well as marketing, which is all in motion.   

We want to make sure that the product is exactly as stated and that it passes all regulations for bottling and distribution. 

The incentives and perks to the right have been set up with a lot of TLC.  They are hopefully self-explanitory and designed to make the giving fun and worthwhile. Enjoy!  A note about the travel perks/incentives.  If you'd still like to particapte at this perk/incentive level, but travel to Greece isn't possible, then it will be replaced with an generous supply of our Premium EVOO and shipped to your door.

THE REAL THING, FROM ELLAS...AT LAST!

With your help we’ll be able to launch the website  for "Adopt a Greek Olive Tree" as well as produce limited edition production run of the fall 2012-2013 harvest of this incredibly flavourful and healthy olive oil.

The olives groves are on our private lands in the Peloponnese region of Messinia, Kalamata, Greece.  The olive trees are situated on plum hill and mountain sides and they reep the benefit of the best climate this region has to offer. Together you can help us PICK, PACK and PRESS this execptional olive oil. The olives used to produce the oil are the ‘Koroneiki’ variety. The result is a bright green olive oil rich in phenolic content, antioxidants and other nutrients with a rich olive smell with hints of grass.  It has a medium intensity on the tongue with smooth olive taste, accented with slight tomato leaf and mint. Please check out the gallery page to see a pic of the ultra fresh olive juice pour out!

And we are privledged to have guiding us a Mr Petros Boufeas. Interestingly, Peter is a descendent of a local prominent  family of chemists. His grandfather had founded a local spirits and soap factory and a specialized lab. This lab analyzed all the spirits and olive oil samples of the region for quality control.  As the sons of Peter’s grandfather decided on other lines of work the lab was continued through the cousin, Mr Petros Boufeas. This lab still analyzes all the olive oil of the Messinian County. It is this knowledge which is helping us bring you the best olive oil from this region. Outstanding! Please visit us our Facebook Page for further details and video of Petros Boufeas and Nikos Koutsoukos.

Unfortunately in North America, most of the oil from major manufacturers and importers is of an inferior quality and does not adhere to any standards set forth by Health Canada, USDA or even the IOC (International Olive Council) which among other things ‘defines quality standards and monitors authenticity.’

Many consumers are paying a premium price for a product that is misrepresenting itself. Sources: New Yorker Magazine - Olive Oil Times - Los Angeles Times

thank you  ευχαριστώ  merci  danke  tak  grazie  спасибо  hvala 

We'd like to thank you for taking the time to check out our Indiegogo page!  We encourage you to please share this link on Facebook, Twitter, Google Plus or any other social media outlet you prefer.  Feel free to send over any questions or comments and we’ll do our best to answer you as quick as possible. We greatly appreciate any contributions towards helping us produce this delicious Greek olive oil. And most importantly, we look forward to helping the local community by connecting with you on this very personal level...let's do this, one olive tree at a time! 

We look forward to sharing this journey with you!

story:
A warrior is a multifaceted individual that is dedicated to a life of service. To be in total balance a warrior must not only be trained in the ways of battle, but also in the art of healing. "Two sides of the same coin," I've heard it called. I am Araris Dresden, and I am such a warrior. I am asking for your help so that I may continue my Work in bringing integrated physical and mental wellness to my local and global communities.

The Druid, or Healer is an aspect of warriorship that is often over looked. I am developing that aspect of my practice and need assistance in creating an apothecary where I may continue to develop my skills as an herbologist and help those in my community that are in need of low cost assistance.


My intention is to create a sustainable practice that keeps all around costs low for everyone, and can be duplicated as to reach the most people. I am also interested in the integration of said practice into cooperative living situations and ecovillages, so that one day, no one is without a community healer.

I thank you for your time, attention, and (hopefully) donations and would ask one last favor...please spread the word.

story:
Our Story

Oops, one too many zeros in the goal amount...and I can't change it...sorry:(
My name is Christina (Kiki) Hilario and Iâ€™m the stay home mother of a little girl, Genevieve Hilario.  10 years ago, my husband David and I, were blessed with our first of two girls. As with all new families, we knew our lives would change, however it was not until her birth did we understand to what gravity our lives would be altered. Moments after her birth, the doctor notified us that our daughter was born with Spina Bifida. There was a hole in her back which allowed her spinal column to be exposed. During the first 30 days in utero, the spinal column did not fuse together properly and therefore no vertebrae or skin had formed in this area. It is called a Myelomeningocele. Due to the severity of this medical deformation, she had to be transfered immediately into Nebraskra and have her first of over 80 surgeries and procedures.

Within hours her neurosurgeon and repaired her back, but that would only cause Hydrocephalus to then take engage. Gen's brain cannot reabsorb the CSF (Cerebral Spinal Fluid) like others. Without a Ventricular Shunt her brain would swell and eventually end her life (this took place with my uncle - he died at the age of two from Hydrocephalus caused by Spina Bifida).  Shortly after a shunt was placed into the middle of her brain and burrowed down her neck where roughly two feet of tubing coils in her abdomen. 

Not only was Genevieve subject to these issues, the Spina Bifida brought a host of other medical conditions that have ruled our lives. Arnold Chiari II Malformation of the Brain (ACM II) is also indigenous to this birth defect. This is when the Cerebrum (large top portion of the brain) tilts backwards. In conjuction with this, the Cerebellum is then shifted back so far that a portion of the brain actually sits tucked in the spinal column within her neck. In Gen's Case, the ACM II portion of the brain became damaged. In doing so, her fourth ventricle in her brain was colapsed and pressure was put against her Brain Stem. The Brain Stem not only controls swallowing but many other vital functions within the body. The Cerebellar Tonsils were removed from within her neck when she was 3 1/2 and a portion of her skull was removed to allow for reoccuring swelling of the brain.

Since Genevieve's birth, Neurogenic Bladder & Bowels have proven to be (in addition to the other health concerns) a constant battle. She has never had the function to potty or poop so I have spent the first 5 plus years catheterizing Gen's potty and digitally removing her stool. Vesicourital Reflux (when the bladder refluxes urine back into the kidneys), infection, medical supplies, medications and the alike are a daily challenge for our household. 

In addition to the above challenges, Hypothalamic Dysfunction (inability to control her body temperature), Physical Therapy (she uses leg braces), accupuncture, chirophractic care, and massage and pain management guide our everyday schedule.

As I mentioned, Genevieve at the age of 10 has had over 80 plus surgeries and procedures. Children's Hospital has been home away from home. She lives in constant chronic pain of migrains coupled with "Ice Pick" headaches and "Cluster" headaches on top of the migraines. Both her neurosurgeon and neurologist believe this is from, "people being in her brain so much." and don't feel there is much that Children's Hospital can do for her any longer. We have gone to Minnesota, Iowa City, and Kansas City for ideas and treatment. We were scheduled and refered on to The Cleveland Clinic where pediatric head pain is a specialty. Our appointment was for Feb. 7th, however our insurance has declined payment therefore the clinic as declined our visit.

Even though we continue to get declined at different facilities, we are forever trying to find alternative ways to help our little girl live a life of quality. Our family will stop at nothing to find other locations that are willing and capable of providing treatment, care, and a way for her to live pain free. Please help us find treatment outside of the Midwest and continue on with the countless therapies that are no longer covered in our changing medical system.

The Impact

We are asking you to join with our tiny community in helping us give Gen the best care we possibly can. Since we live in a tiny town, David has to take the best paying job he can that will allow him grace periods for the frequent emergency trips and stays to Children's Hospital. I stay home to ensure the best care for both my girls. Because Gen's medical issues dictate so much of our lives, it is a blessing to be able to homeschool my 9 year old daughter as well. This allows me the opportunity to have close time with her also. With a household gross income less than 20,000 a year. It is difficult to attain our medical goals, never mind the regular bills. Ha! Ha! We live according to our means in a nice little home, but every extra cent goes to supply Gen with medications and therapies. Unfortunately, with our income, she doesn't get all that she needs as much as she needs it. This is why we have decided to open our lives up, humbly receiving assistance, and providing the world a glimpse into a world that most people will never understand or know personally.

What We Need & What You Get

For anyone interested, I will provide my e-mail address. By doing so, you can contact me for 8 pages of an Excel Spreadsheet that I have pulled from Gen's main workbook that I utilize to track her medical care over the years. On the first page you will find Genâ€™s diagnosis along with family contact information. The next two pages include many of Genâ€™s specialists and their contact information, as well. The remaining 5 pages show the 80 plus surgeries and procedures, the dates, location, and attending physician. Feel free to contact the specialists (from the previous pages) to verify the validity of the material. Everything should be clearly recorded for clarity.

My E-Mail:  acts1631@metc.net 

Other Ways You Can Help

We are hosting a local Fundraiser with a Silent Auction and Raffle on January 31st, 2012. Feel free to contact me if you want any information on that:) An PLEASE PASS THIS ON! :) Thank you! XOXO

story_txt:
Our Story
Oops, one too many zeros in the goal amount...and I can't change it...sorry:(My name is Christina (Kiki) Hilario and Iâ€™m the stay home
mother of a little girl, Genevieve Hilario.  10 years ago, my husband David and I, were blessed with our first of two girls. As with all new families, we knew our lives would change, however it was not until her birth did we understand to what gravity our lives would be altered. Moments after her birth, the doctor notified us that our daughter was born with Spina Bifida. There was a hole in her back which allowed her spinal column to be exposed. During the first 30 days in utero, the spinal column did not fuse together properly and therefore no vertebrae or skin had formed in this area. It is called a Myelomeningocele. Due to the severity of this medical deformation, she had to be transfered immediately into Nebraskra and have her first of over 80 surgeries and procedures. 
Within hours her neurosurgeon and repaired her back, but that would only cause
Hydrocephalus to then take engage. Gen's brain cannot reabsorb the CSF (Cerebral Spinal Fluid) like others. Without a Ventricular Shunt her brain would swell and eventually end her life (this took place with my uncle - he died at the age of two from Hydrocephalus caused by Spina Bifida).  Shortly after a shunt was placed into the middle of her brain and burrowed down her neck where roughly two feet of tubing coils in her abdomen. 
Not only was Genevieve subject to these issues, the Spina Bifida brought a host of other medical conditions that have ruled our lives. Arnold Chiari II Malformation of the Brain (ACM II) is also indigenous to this birth defect. This is when the Cerebrum (large top portion of the brain) tilts backwards. In conjuction with this, the Cerebellum is then shifted back so far that a portion of the brain actually sits tucked in the spinal column within her neck. In Gen's Case, the ACM II portion of the brain became damaged. In doing so, her fourth ventricle in her brain was colapsed and pressure was put against her Brain Stem. The Brain Stem not only controls swallowing but many other vital functions within the body. The Cerebellar Tonsils were removed from within her neck when she was 3 1/2 and a portion of her skull was removed to allow for reoccuring swelling of the brain. 
Since Genevieve's birth, Neurogenic Bladder
& Bowels have proven to be (in addition to the other health concerns) a constant battle. She has never had the function to potty or poop so I have spent the first 5 plus years catheterizing Gen's potty and digitally removing her stool. Vesicourital Reflux (when the bladder refluxes urine back into the kidneys), infection, medical supplies, medications and the alike are a daily challenge for our household. 
In addition to the above challenges, Hypothalamic Dysfunction (inability to control her body temperature), Physical Therapy (she uses leg braces), accupuncture, chirophractic care, and massage and pain management guide our everyday schedule. 
As I mentioned, Genevieve at the age of 10 has had over 80 plus surgeries and procedures. Children's Hospital has been home away from home. She lives in constant chronic pain of migrains coupled with "Ice Pick" headaches and "Cluster" headaches on top of the migraines. Both her neurosurgeon and neurologist believe this is from, "people being in her brain so much." and don't feel there is much that Children's Hospital can do for her any longer. We have gone to Minnesota, Iowa City, and Kansas City for ideas and treatment. We were scheduled and refered on to The Cleveland Clinic where pediatric head pain is a specialty. Our appointment was for Feb. 7th, however our insurance has declined payment therefore the clinic as declined our visit. 
Even though we continue to get declined at different facilities, we are forever trying to find alternative ways to help our little girl live a life of quality. Our family will stop at nothing to find other locations that are willing and capable of providing treatment, care, and a way for her to live pain free. Please help us find treatment outside of the Midwest and continue on with the countless therapies that are no longer covered in our changing medical system. 

The Impact
We are asking you to join with our tiny community in helping us give Gen the best care we possibly can. Since we live in a tiny town, David has to take the best paying job he can that will allow him grace periods for the frequent emergency trips and stays to Children's Hospital. I stay home to ensure the best care for both my girls. Because Gen's medical issues dictate so much of our lives, it is a blessing to be able to homeschool my 9 year old daughter as well. This allows me the opportunity to have close time with her also. With a household gross income less than 20,000 a year. It is difficult to attain our medical goals, never mind the regular bills. Ha! Ha! We live according to our means in a nice little home, but every extra cent goes to supply Gen with medications and therapies. Unfortunately, with our income, she doesn't get all that she needs as much as she needs it. This is why we have decided to open our lives up, humbly receiving assistance, and providing the world a glimpse into a world that most people will never understand or know personally. 



What We Need & What You Get
For anyone interested, I will provide my e-mail address. By doing so, you can contact me for 8 pages of an Excel Spreadsheet that I have pulled from Gen's main workbook that I utilize to track her medical care over the years. On the first page you will find Genâ€™s diagnosis along with family contact information. The next two pages include many of Genâ€™s specialists and their contact information, as well. The remaining 5 pages show the 80 plus surgeries and procedures, the dates, location, and attending physician. Feel free to contact the specialists (from the previous pages) to verify the validity of the material. Everything should be clearly recorded for clarity. 
My E-Mail:  acts1631@metc.net 

Other Ways You Can Help
We are hosting a local Fundraiser with a Silent Auction and Raffle on January 31st, 2012. Feel free to contact me if you want any information on that:) An PLEASE PASS THIS ON! :) Thank you! XOXO

story:
One seed can start a garden

One candle can light a room

One person can make all the difference...

THAT ONE PERSON IS YOU!!

___________________________________________________________________________________

Help Save Alejandro’s Life

  • Alejandro fled to Canada in 2006.
  • His request for refugee protection in Canada was denied. He then applied on humanitarian and compassionate grounds, which was also denied.  He is seeking judicial review of that decision.
  • As a result of Alejandro's status, his government-assisted health care has been cut off with the passing of Bill C-31. 
  • He needs life-saving surgery performed to re-arrange main internal organs.
  • Alejandro’s stomach shut down in January.  He has only been on liquids since then.  His liver is functioning at only 25% and could fail at any time.
  • This surgery will save his life.
  • One can make a difference...THAT ONE PERSON IS YOU!!!

Read more about Alejandro's story as reported in the Toronto Star Newspaper:

http://www.thestar.com/news/article/1212705--fi...

More Facts about Alejandro:

  • Alejandro was healthy when he first came to Canada in October of 2006; he became ill a few years ago.    
  • He had been working and paying taxes in Canada.  He only recently stopped working, as his illness has made him very weak.
  • Cutting him off of government-assisted health care midway through treatment is extremely cruel and inhumane.
  • Alejandro has three children whom he has not seen in six years.  Being their sole caregiver, he made arrangements for their safety before he fled...fleeing with them was not possible. He hopes to finally get status to be able to reunite with them.  This has always been his focus.

What We Need and What You Can Do

The anticipated cost of Alejandro’s surgery is well above the goal for this campaign.  We hope to of course raise enough money to cover all of his surgical and medical expenses.  In addition, we hope to help pay for his daily needs as he is not able to work now. 

The Impact

You give an amazing human being a fighting chance at life and the hope that he may one day be reunited with his children.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean they can’t help:

Use the Indiegogo share tools to SPREAD THE WORD! PLEASE!  Facebook!  Twitter!  Email!

Help Save Alejandro’s Life!
Our deepest and sincerest thank you.

story:
Falls of Clyde, a National Historic Landmark ship in Honolulu Harbor, is in need of a drydock to clean, repair, and paint her hull, which is the foundation that will assure her preservation and ultimate restoration. The drydock work is the major project for the preservation of this 1878, iron-hulled, four-masted sailing oil tanker, built in Port Glasgow, Scotland , and now the last of her kind in the world. 

Although the drydock is the most important project, we do have several restoration projects that will be initiated both before and after the drydock. The mission of Friends of Falls of Clyde, a 501(c)(3) volunteer organization is to preserve and restore the National Historic Landmark vessel for the benefit of the citizens of Hawaii and all visitors. 

We have identified eight (8) projects to be funded that will all move our mission forward. Any of these projects will enhance the ship as a visitor destination and learning platform for maritime  sailing history. 

http://www.friendsoffallsofclyde.org/save-our-s...

story:
I want to extend a huge thanks to everyone who helped fund my campaign. The two target teeth were indeed saved. After several years without dental coverage, I finally have it again. I've put a few thousand out of pocket into my dental work, and nearly all of my needed re-work has been completed in just the last two years.

I donated 17-inches of my hair to Wigs for Kids, as promised. Thanks again!

story:
Hello everyone,


This campaign has been on my mind for the better part of 5 years now. I have explored ways to achieve it, but after examining local fund raising options, I feel this website will be the perfect way for us to realize our goal.

 

My parents names are Drew and Judy Hamann. They were married October 8th, 1970 in Monroe, MI. They were very young and could not get married in the State of Ohio. They loved each other very much and wanted to be together so they eloped. Being a young and naive couple they eventually had to live with my Grandparents, my mother's family, while they got on their feet.


After a while they were able to move out on their own and began the wonderful world of rental living.


My parents, like many young couples, wanted to start a family. They tried for many years naturally with no results. They eventually sought help from doctors and birthing specialists but again had no luck. Then...


In the summer of 1977 my parents were blessed with the discovery that my sister Jennifer was coming. This was nothing short of a miracle based on what the doctors had told them. They were beyond happy. They were getting the gift that all young families hope for but thought impossible. After 7 years of waiting they would have a child.


Then on April 24th, 1978 my sister Jennifer was born. Everyone in the family was over joyed because they understood the struggle my parents went through. Even though my mother came from a large family with many young nieces and nephews around she wanted a child of her own. My father was an only child and knew how important it was to be there for his children.

 

They realized after my sister was born they needed a better place to live. So they purchased a home on a quiet street in West Toledo. Modest but very much a home that they came to love and appreciate.

 

I came along later on August 31st, 1981. This story isn't about me so I'll just leave it at that, HA!

My parents over the years did everything they could to make sure that my sister and I had a good life. They went without so they could give us what we needed. They ignored their own needs to see that we had clothes, food, and a safe home in a safe neighborhood. My mother taught us at home through a homeschooling program to make sure we got the education and attention she hoped we would get. My father worked long hours on his feet in a Union print shop and would usually leave the house around 6am.


Now here is where it gets rough.

My mother has had more medical issues than I sometimes care to think about. To be more specific she lives with the following:

Chronic Migraines

Vertigo

Fibromyalgia

Neuropathy

Degenerative issues in her jaw

Type 2 diabetes

Hip and back displacement issues

My father has had his bought with the surgeon as well as after all the years of standing at work he developed vascular issues with his leg which resulted in major surgery. With the threat of an amputation he reluctantly went through years of pain and healing to be able to function normally. This in turn has debilitated him and forced him into early retirement.  He also has type two diabetes.

Both of my parents are the most selfless and caring individuals I know. They have went out of their way more times than I can recall to help friends, family, neighbors and strangers alike. My mother is like everyone's mother. She always makes sure to cook you a meal or give you a hug if you look like you need one.

 

Here is the reason you have just read this story...

 

My parents had to leave their home behind in 2008 after many years of struggling financially. They were forced to file for Bankruptcy after mounting medical bills, prescription costs and the overall financial strain they felt  maintaining a house on a fixed income.

They were fortunate enough to find a safe and affordable apartment to live in that allows them just enough to pay the bills. There they have remained and probably will stay.

Their needs are many but most importantly their car. They own a 1997 ford Windstar. The car has had everything replaced it seems but the seats. My father takes care of it the best he can but he knows the car is going to die and they have no means to replace it. I desperately want to help them but know that I do not have the means to buy or even help finance a car for them. No one in the family has the means including my sister and brother in law with 3 children to raise.

The money we could net after fees would insure my parents could afford to purchase a new car that would be dependable and last them the remaining years they will be driving it. The amount could afford them insurance, fuel, extended warranty and upkeep costs so that giving them this gift would not become a new burden.

They would never ask this themselves and do not know I am setting up this fund.

I know that you will identify with their story and see why so many people like them need the kindness of strangers. The same help they have given so many times over.

Please consider any donation you can manage. A dollar here and there can make a difference and even if the goal is not reached they will have some money to help with car repairs in the coming years.


Thank you all,

 

Nate Hamann

story:
About US!!!

Southcoast Zodiacs are a Community based Cheerleading Team based in the Adur and Worthing District. We have over 90 Athletes aged 3 - 28 who compete at National and Regional Level.

Southcoast Zodiacs also volunter their time to get involved in projects to help the local Community as well as local and Worldwide Charities. For example last year 2 of our lads in aid of a local hospice dressed in drag and took part in a theatre show of Priscilla Queen of the Dessert.

The Senior girls cheered at a local football match between our local football players and the boys from the British Soap Opera Hollyoaks, to help raise funds for the local Childrens Hospice.

The Coaches have absailed down 90ft Cliffs in aid of Macmillan Cancer Research, and many of the female athletes have ran the 'Race for Life' all for Breast Cancer UK.

This year the Athletes have thought it would be a great idea to do something a little different.

The Southcoast Zodiacs will be running & cycling a total of 85 miles, thats 145km in aid of a Local Childrens charity and to help raise funds for a once in a lifetime event.

Each Athlete will run a total of 21km (Brighton Pier to Goring Gap), they will then the following week complete a 124km cycle ride along Southdowns way to Guildford and back.

The Southcoast Zodiacs will be raising money for the NSPCC and also their local Childrens Hospice Chesnut Tree House. They will also be raising the funds for a once in a lifetime event, a trip to compete at one of the Worlds Largest National Competitions 'Cheersport Nationals' in Atlanta Georgia.

We are aiming to raise a total of £6000.00 (if we raise more even better) 25% of which will go to Charity, the other 75% will go towards taking the 40 athletes to America for the very first time. It is even some of the Athletes first ever vacation away from the UK.

By donating not only will you be helping Children and Young adults who have dedicated most of their Cheerleading Career to helping others and their local community; reach their dream in travelling to America, you will also be helping towards stopping child abuse and giving children and families with critical illnesses the respite care they need.

Thank you for Listening.
