story:
www.jellyskateboards.com

&

www.blockrisers.com

 

 

 

 

 


Click here to learn more about our work with Life Rolls On.

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 


 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

www.LifeRollsOn.org

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

Sven-Anders Alwerud President/Co-founder Jelly Skateboards Inc.
 

"Jelly Skateboards originated from two Southern California locals with a passion for speed, surfing and skating. At just 15 years old, high school buddies Sven Alwerud and Cody Leuck began to design their ideal carving machine-hacking away at crude prototypes made of bulletproof glass, in a side garage nonetheless. 

But the big "AH-HA" moment didn't come until some years later, when Sven was attending college at Cal State San Marcos and had been using the old high school prototype to cruise from class to class. The clear deck was a hit-other students loved the original take on a classic concept. So Alwerud and Leuck were back in the board game once again. They began crafting prototypes in Cal State Chico's machine shop where Cody had been attending school. By combining vintage shapes and modern cutting edge materials Alwerud and Leuck were able to create a bulletproof, clear, flexible skateboard that captured the essence of surfing and snowboarding. In March of 2012, the company was officially incorporated and Jelly Skateboards was born."

 

 

 

 

Kevin J. Seele Founder & Chief Technical Innovations Officer

BLOCK Risers Innovation

Kevin graduated from Kansas State University in 2009 with his bachelors degree in Construction Science and Business Management. He continued on to Southern California where he accepted a position with Hensel Phelps, one of the largest general contractors and construction managers in the United States. Hensel Phelps is ranked consistently among ENR's (Engineering News-Record) top 20 Contractors with an annual revenue of over $3 billion dollars.  For over six years, Kevin has played a vital engineering role for Hensel Phelps, managing high profile commercial projects including the Renovation of LAX Terminal 6 for Alaska Airlines and the Reconfiguration of San Ysidro Land Port of Entry Border Crossing into Mexico--the largest land port entry in the World.  Currently, Kevin is working with Hensel Phelps as a Design-Build Contractor for GSA planning, and coordinating the renovation and modernization of the downtown San Diego Federal building.

In 2012 an idea was born to create a more functional skateboard riser.  So B+ Ideas LLC was founded on this passion for skateboarding and building.  Since then Kevin has spent spent  his nights and weekends over the last three years prototyping and 3D printing risers that think outside the box.  In 2013 the StashBLOCK was born and not until 2014 did we realized we had something truly special with the BettyBOX riser system.  We were able to create any insert we wanted with only the deck and trucks the limit.  Now it is my responsibility to bring the skateboard community the best and most innovative BLOCKs you could imagine. 
 

 

Ari Hoffman Owner & Chief Operating Officer

BLOCK Risers Innovation 

Mr. Hoffman's companies have secured a deal on the nationally acclaimed, hit television show, 'Shark Tank,' won the Nationally held FedEx Small Business Grant Contest, won the Dream Big America Challenge, the San Diego, "Lean, Mean, Green Start Up," Earthday's Sun Catcher Award, and have been awarded the Cool Company of 2013 by the SDVentureGroup.  Mr. Hoffman himself has spoken at Universities, Public Schools, Private Schools, the US Chamber of Commerce, ESPN radio, iHeartRadio, Green Is Good Radio, and 33Voices.  His talks range from Patent Performance to Start Up Business Logistics, to Motivating through the Power Of Positivity.  

Mr. Hoffman was asked to join the board of advisers for Vet Tech and to become one of the lead organizers for 1 Million Cups, San Diego, furthering his ability to facilitate the Start Up community's growth in the Southern California region, while embedding his philosophy of equilateral collaboration.      

Hoffman is also an owner/creator for several other companies in the U.S. including MatGames, DarnGoodWorld, and GOBIE h2o.  



 

 

Q: What is the board made out of?

A: Bulletproof glass

 

Q: Is that really glass?

A: No, silly! It’s a thermoplastic polymer (plastic) that was invented in 1898 by a German scientist working at University of Munich. Polycarbonate can be found in the F-22 Raptor cockpit canopy, Humvee windows, bank windows, International Space Station, the list goes on and on! 

 

Q: Is there grip?

A: We currently don’t offer grip, but the way we like to describe the grip is the same grippyness one feels when they are playing basketball on an indoor wood court. The squeaky sensation that you get between your shoes and the gym floor is the same feeling you get when riding a Jelly. Also, the new Man O’ War Longboard has concave that help lock in your feet.

 

Q: Is it durable or will it break?

A: Polycarbonate is extremely durable and possesses high-impact strength all while being 100% recyclable under classification “7”. We offer a six-month warranty and will send another board if structural damage arises whether by a manufacturer’s defect or by personal use, no questions asked. 

 

Q: Does it scratch easy?

A: Yes, yes it does. Just like any skateboard out there, they will get scratched up. That’s just the nature of the sport.

 

BLOCK

 

Q: What is a riser BLOCK? 

A: A riser BLOCK is the most convenient way to add some innovation and style to your skateboard while also preventing wheel bite.

 

 

 

Q: What is wheel bite? 

A: Wheel bite is when the skateboard wheel makes contact with the bottom of the deck while turning sharply.  This contact causes the wheel to stop rolling and likely sends you to make contact with the pavement! 

 

Q: BLOCK risers are angled, what does that do? 

A: An angled BLOCK allows you to “wedge” or “de-wedge” your trucks; therefore changing the geometry of your trucks.

 

Q: Changing the geometry, what does that mean? 

A: When the geometry of the truck changes, it changes your turning radius.  If you wedge your trucks, you can increase the amount of rotation on the truck.  Therefore, you can turn in a smaller circle.

If you dewedge your trucks, it will give the board a less reactive feel.  Your turning will be less so it will take a larger area to turn in the same circle, and the skateboard will be more stable at higher speeds.

 

Q: What is a Standard-Kingpin or Reverse-Kingpin?

A: First off, the Kingpin is the center bolt that allows the axle to pivot side to side.

Standard-Kingpin Trucks are often found on beach cruisers, and street skateboards that have either one or two kick tails.  The center bolts on the trucks are on the inside of the skateboard.  Reference the Jelly KingSlayer.

Reverse-Kingpin Trucks are often seen on longboards and allow for greater turning ability and a lower profile setup.  The center bolt would be on the outside of skateboard.  Reference the Jelly Man O’ War.

 

 

Q: How is the Jelly Man O’War setup?

A: The Jelly Man O’War will come set-up dewedged to allow for the most stable ride possible.  This also provides a true front and rear view with your GoBLOCK.

 

 

Q: What is the difference between wedging and dewedging?

A: Wedging and dewedging are the same, no matter whether you have a Standard-Kingpin and Reverse-Kingpin truck(s): the fat side toward the center of the skateboard will “wedge” and make that truck turn more; the fat side toward the ends of the skateboard will “de-wedge” and make that truck turn less.

 

Q: Can you wedge and dewedge at the same time? 

A: Several wedging characteristics can be experimented with.  Just steer clear of dewedging the front and wedging the rear: you don't want the back of your board to turn more than the front. We call that “forklift steering” and it never ends well...

 

 Q: Should I wedge or dewedge? 

A: That will mostly depend on the style of riding you are doing as well as your personal preference. 

 

Q: Can’t I just tighten the kingpin? 

A: Tightening the kingpin only restricts the range of motion by slowing the turning action down and making it harder or easier to lean the board. Wedging (de-wedging) changes how much your board turns when you do lean it.   Use your wrench to adjust kingpin tension for fine-tuning after you've decided on wedging (or none) and the proper bushing is chosen.

 

Q: Proper bushing, is there going to be a test?

A: There will not be a test, but changing the hardness (durometer) of your bushing increases or decreases the turning response.  This is based on rider weight and personal preference.

 

Q: Do I have to wedge or dewedge? 

A: The short answer is no, the high tech skateboard trucks available today allow for some great turning abilities but sometimes they still cause wheel bite.  In this case BLOCK will soon offer both the BettyBOX and StandardBLOCK as a standard flat risers so you can still take advantage of the most innovative #*?# ever.

 

Q: Can I eliminate wheel bite without this complicated wedging or riser sizing? 

A: Yes, but this involves changing your wheel size or skateboard deck all together. Risers and/or wedging is way less complicated than that!  So, add a set of BLOCK risers and eliminate the hassle of buying the more expensive components.

 

Q: BLOCK doesn’t have the size riser that I think I need, what gives? 

A: Soon my friend, soon we will have risers of all sizes for your skateboard needs.  Right now, we've got the sizes most skaters are going to use.

 

Q: I have the BettyBOX but the opening doesn’t face the direction I want my camera pointed? 

A: The more money we raise, the more BLOCK riser innovations you will see.  Hang tight.

 

Q: So my current skateboard doesn’t have wheel bite and I love my skateboard the way it is, why do I need BLOCK risers? 

A: Because it is the most innovative #*?# ever.  Give your skateboard its own set of eyes with a GoBLOCK or store your house key and a few dollars and a stick of gum in the StashBLOCK.  Plus, you will want to have a BettyBOX to take advantage of all of the other cool things we have in store for you!

 

Q: I have a drop through skateboard deck, what about me? 

A: Relax compadre, pair the BettyBOX with a TopBLOCK and you will be GoBLOCKing and StashBLOCKing in no time.  You’ve also just bought yourself one fancy toe-stop!

With today’s high tech line-up of skateboard trucks and the vast array of wheel sizes, customization is endless.  If the set-up you choose allows the wheels to touch the bottom of the skateboard while turning, your wheel will likely stop in its tracks and send you to the pavement.  Add in a set of BLOCK risers and you can experience those sharp turns safely without having wheel bite.

BLOCK risers fit all Old School & New School mounting patterns.

BLOCK risers go hand-in-hand with the high tech skateboard trucks on today’s market.

BLOCK risers are a skateboard performance enhancement to keep your wheels from hitting the bottom of your board and locking up while turning from side to side. 

 

Q: What is next for the BettyBOX?

A: While we have several products in the line-up we will do customer polling to see what you want next!



 
 
© 2015 BLOCK Risers                       © 2015 Jelly Skateboards. 
All Rights Reserved.

Sven-Anders Alwerud President/Co-founder Jelly Skateboards Inc. 
"Jelly Skateboards originated from two Southern California locals with a passion for speed, surfing and skating. At just 15 years old, high school buddies Sven Alwerud and Cody Leuck began to design their ideal carving machine-hacking away at crude prototypes made of bulletproof glass, in a side garage nonetheless. 
But the big "AH-HA" moment didn't come until some years later, when Sven was attending college at Cal State San Marcos and had been using the old high school prototype to cruise from class to class. The clear deck was a hit-other students loved the original take on a classic concept. So Alwerud and Leuck were back in the board game once again. They began crafting prototypes in Cal State Chico's machine shop where Cody had been attending school. By combining vintage shapes and modern cutting edge materials Alwerud and Leuck were able to create a bulletproof, clear, flexible skateboard that captured the essence of surfing and snowboarding. In March of 2012, the company was officially incorporated and Jelly Skateboards was born."  
 

 
Kevin J. Seele Founder & Chief Technical Innovations Officer
BLOCK Risers Innovation
Kevin graduated from Kansas State University in 2009 with his bachelors degree in Construction Science and Business Management. He continued on to Southern California where he accepted a position with Hensel Phelps, one of the largest general contractors and construction managers in the United States. Hensel Phelps is ranked consistently among ENR's (Engineering News-Record) top 20 Contractors with an annual revenue of over $3 billion dollars.  For over six years, Kevin has played a vital engineering role for Hensel Phelps, managing high profile commercial projects including the Renovation of LAX Terminal 6 for Alaska Airlines and the Reconfiguration of San Ysidro Land Port of Entry Border Crossing into Mexico--the largest land port entry in the World.  Currently, Kevin is working with Hensel Phelps as a Design-Build Contractor for GSA planning, and coordinating the renovation and modernization of the downtown San Diego Federal building.In 2012 an idea was born to create a more functional skateboard riser.  So B+ Ideas LLC was founded on this passion for skateboarding and building.  Since then Kevin has spent spent  his nights and weekends over the last three years prototyping and 3D printing risers that think outside the box.  In 2013 the StashBLOCK was born and not until 2014 did we realized we had something truly special with the BettyBOX riser system.  We were able to create any insert we wanted with only the deck and trucks the limit.  Now it is my responsibility to bring the skateboard community the best and most innovative BLOCKs you could imagine.   

Ari Hoffman Owner & Chief Operating Officer
BLOCK Risers Innovation 
Mr. Hoffman's companies have secured a deal on the nationally acclaimed, hit television show, 'Shark Tank,' won the Nationally held FedEx Small Business Grant Contest, won the Dream Big America Challenge, the San Diego, "Lean, Mean, Green Start Up," Earthday's Sun Catcher Award, and have been awarded the Cool Company of 2013 by the SDVentureGroup.  Mr. Hoffman himself has spoken at Universities, Public Schools, Private Schools, the US Chamber of Commerce, ESPN radio, iHeartRadio, Green Is Good Radio, and 33Voices.  His talks range from Patent Performance to Start Up Business Logistics, to Motivating through the Power Of Positivity.  
Mr. Hoffman was asked to join the board of advisers for Vet Tech and to become one of the lead organizers for 1 Million Cups, San Diego, furthering his ability to facilitate the Start Up community's growth in the Southern California region, while embedding his philosophy of equilateral collaboration.      
Hoffman is also an owner/creator for several other companies in the U.S. including MatGames, DarnGoodWorld, and GOBIE h2o.

story:
THE MOST ADVANCED POGO STICK EVER CREATED

The V4 is the most advanced pogo stick ever created. We took the traditional spring and threw it in the garbage years ago. Springs are cool and all, but they can’t be adjusted on the fly, and they're just too heavy to propel someone really high.

In order to get more air, we needed to add air.


V4 SPECS



The V4 is by far the most advanced pogo stick on the market. We've put a lot of attention into every single detail to make sure that it feels incredible right out of the box. 

ADD AIR TO CREATE A STIFFER SPRING

REMOVE AIR TO CREATE A SOFTER SPRING


It really is pretty simple. Start out at a low, comfortable pressure - gauges in the US always use psi to measure pressure. Start with 1/4 of what you weigh in pounds for your psi. After you get used to the air spring, you can pump more air into the V4. The more air you put into the V4 the stiffer the spring becomes. If you put too much, it'll become too stiff. At that point, you just press the button on top to release some air.



One of the best things about the V4 is that you can choose however you want to use it. Pump the V4 up with low pressure, and it will have a soft spring that limits your jump. If you pump it up a lot, the spring will stiffen and you can go higher. Pump it up with too much air, and the spring will become so hard it won’t budge until you let some air out. Try different air pressures to find your preferred setting!

Any model can jump 1’ high, and any model can jump 8’ feet high.

The V4 Pro can jump 10’ high and is much more comfortable at altitude. 

The V4 is a good all around stick that can be geared for going high or just bouncing a foot or two. 

The V4 Fit is geared toward the fitness aspect only. While it can still bounce 8' high, it's not nearly as comfortable when doing so.

You have to see these incredible athletes - you won't believe the tricks they're able to do on pogo sticks!       - Michael Strahan  |  Good Morning America

You are new, you are exciting, you are fresh, you are dangerous, and you were great!     - Howie Mandell  |  America's Got Talent

I can't even talk I'm so excited!      - Queen Latifah  |  The Queen Latifah Show


EXERCISE

The V4 provides one of the most fun forms of full body exercise you’ll ever have. One of the coolest things about it is that it doesn't feel like exercise. You just hop on and bounce away - and before you know it, your heart is pounding and the sweat is pouring. According to neurosurgeon Dr. Kim Manwaring, the G forces experienced when bouncing on our pogo sticks help with “...lower circulating cholesterol and triglyceride levels, assist in the rehabilitation of a heart problem, promote tissue repair, improve balance, increase capacity for respiration and improve muscle-to-fat ratio."

The V4 Fit is a great for exercise. The shorter shaft makes it easier to step up onto, faster to learn, & simpler control. As a low impact, high intensity exercise device, it’s suitable for HIIT (high intensity interval training), Crossfit and circuit training, and any other sort of training in which you are looking for a high heart rate and short bursts of energy expenditure.

MUSCLES WORKED: lower back, glutes, guads, hamstrings, calves, and triceps.   


EASILY RETRACTABLE FOR TRANSPORTATION

The V4 uses an air spring to launch you into the air. If it isn’t cool enough that air alone can provide enough power to toss you 10’ high, then what about the fact that when you’re done using it you can just release the air and collapse the air spring?

When you let the air out, the shaft compresses inside of the stick for travel mode. Freaking awesome!

The medium V4 goes from 55" in height during bounce mode to 34: in height during travel mode.


REVIEWS & TESTIMONIALS


Biff Hutchison holds the world record for jumping up and over a bar on a pogo stick...at 10 feet! He's one of the best in the entire world and holds multiple world records and championships. If you need an outside opinion, just listen to what he's got to say.

New Indiegogo Customer Reviews (Check Our Comments Section)

What a fantastic device. The high quality of materials and craftsmanship are obvious as soon as you open the box. I watched the tutorial, got it out of the box and took it outside. It’s been nearly 30 years since I have been on a pogo stick. Bouncing on the V4 Pro was amazing. It was just like being a kid again…onlyBIGGER and BETTTER! If you’ve ever pogoed before, you’ll be getting some solid bounces on your Vurtego in no time.       - Brookes Bacon

Connor LOVES his V4 Pro. Here is his progress after only two days. http://youtu.be/W9N_5yHcvXA          - Shawn Humphreys




WHO'S IT FOR?

The V4 is for anyone over 75 pounds. You’d think that our only customers are younguns’ between 12 & 20, but you’d be pretty surprised. A lot of our customers are actually full-grown adults in the mid-life crisis era of their lives who are trying to prove to themselves that they’re not that old. They say 60 is the new 40, right? :)

Really, our V4 can easily be used by pretty much anyone over 75 pounds that can jump on a trampoline. The V4 is a bit more difficult than a trampoline because you'll need to use more core strength and balance, but once you get used to it, the feeling is very similar...except it goes wherever you want it to.  

The V4 is for you if:

  • You’re looking for a really fun, killer workout
  • You’re a crazy kid who wants to push the limits
  • You like extreme sports
  • You like dogs
  • You've always dreamed of flying
  • You think the hoverboard from Back to the Future should be here already
  • You like cats…cuz cats are better than dogs
  • Just kidding, dogs are better
  • You've always want to be able to dunk a basketball
  • You think parkour is pretty cool and want to try it for yourself
  • Psyche! Cats are totally better


SAFETY

Safety is an area of huge concern for us. Our V4 is a lot safer than you might first believe. Many extreme sports are dangerous because of one element: speed. When moving at high rates of speed, it’s easy to get hurt. The V4 is actually deceptively safe because there’s no speed involved. Yes, you can jump really high on it…like really freaking high. BUT, it takes a lot of practice to get to that point - and even then you’re not attached to the pogo stick. If you ever feel uncomfortable, you can simply throw the pogo stick aside and land on your feet. We beefed up the V4 like a Belgian Blue Super Bull for that very reason - it's designed to take a beating so your body doesn't have to. 

As is the case with any potentially dangerous activity, however, you should take this seriously. Wear a helmet and any other safety gear you feel might be necessary at all times. Don’t bounce in wet conditions. Don’t bounce indoors or under low objects. Don’t bounce next to traffic. Don’t bounce with people standing right next to you, blah, blah, blah. Use some common sense, and you’ll be fine.




USE IT (almost) ANYWHERE

Just like you, the V4 loves to be taken to new places. While most people will start out bouncing in front of their house, the real fun with the V4 comes when you start playing around with obstacles. Cities, schools, walls, rails, parks, tables, stairs, ledges - you’ll never look at the world the same way once you start bouncing around on obstacles. Jump off of things. Jump over things. Jump onto and then off of and then over things. Stalls and grinds and walls and lines. Every architectural feature around you has the potential to be jumped on or off of. 

Places we don’t recommend are: hills or uneven surfaces, places that are wet or slippery, and environments that dusty and sandy (the dust will get sucked into the stick and cause the lubricant to get all dirty).





WATCH THE V4 PUSH THE LIMITS


REWARDS

WHO ARE WE?

We’re just a good ole’ fashioned American made company trying to provide the best quality product and highest level of customer service imaginable. We have 0 full-time employees and work on pogo stick stuff on nights and weekends.

We do this because we love it, and we want to see a little bit more enjoyment in this crazy world. 




FAQ

PRODUCT QUESTIONS

What is the difference between the V4 and the V4 Pro?

The V4 is the pogo stick that most people will probably benefit from. It is designed to deliver a soft, smooth bounce that resembles a portable trampoline. The major difference between our old V3 and the new V4 is that we’ve added 14 additional cubic inches of air to the cylinder. This additional air changes everything. With the V4, you can bounce higher with lower air pressure. This makes it easier to control, faster to learn, and easier to jump high & do tricks. Aside from that, we’ve updated nearly every part on the pogo stick to fix nagging issues that have been troublesome in the past. The result is that the V4 is our newest and most amazing pogo stick. Just like Apple always says - this is the best “insert product here” we’ve ever made. In this case, however, the V4 really is by far the best pogo stick we’ve ever made.

The V4 Pro takes all of the designs put into the V4 and then adds two new benefits. The V4 Pro has a slide shaft with a stroke that is 2” longer than the V4. This longer slide shaft provides extra boost for jumping even higher or landing from greater heights - like when you jump off of something tall. The V4 Pro also has a bushing with about 78% less surface area for less friction. On top of that, the bushing has pockets drilled into it that enable you to add your own lubricant. Once lubricant is added, the bushing will then self-lubricate the shaft while you bounce, providing an even smoother bounce. This bushing coupled with the longer slide shaft make the V4 ideal for serious riders or those looking to get the best we have to give. 

The V4 Fit is geared specifically for people interested in exercise and performance training. The V4 Fit has a 2" shorter slide shaft stroke, which limits how high you can go. A fairly large number of our customers are people who grew up with a pogo stick and want to re-live their childhood glory days with a new age exercise tool. The V4 is a great fit for this because the shorter shaft makes it easier to step up onto, faster to learn, & simpler control. As a low impact, high intensity exercise device, it’s suitable for HIIT training, Crossfit and circuit training, and any other sort of training in which you are looking for a high heart rate and short bursts of energy expenditure. 

What are the color options?

The V4 comes in two different colors and three different sizes. The V4 is white. The V4 Pro will come in green. 

What parts are most likely to break and need replacing?
The two parts that are most likely to wear down and break are the Grip Tip and the Handlebars. The Grip Tip takes a tremendous beating over its life and wears down like tread on tires. Over time you will need to replace it. The handlebars are designed to bend or break for safety reasons. In the event that you drop the pogo stick and it happens to land just right, the handlebars may bend, or after bending enough times, break. This is a safety feature designed into the pogo stick. You can purchase a new Grip Tip for $20 or Handlebars for $15. All other parts are covered under our warranty. 
  
Are the parts replaceable? Where can I get replacement parts?
Replacement parts are available on our website www.vurtego.com. All parts on the V4 can be quickly replaced at home without the need for sending the pogo stick in for repair.  

Is there an altimeter?
No altimeter on planet Earth can measure the ridiculous altitude's that the V4 is capable of reaching!

What is the temperature range that the V4 can be used it?
The V4 is made from materials that can handle a wide range of temperatures. We have used the V4 in sub-zero temperatures, and it holds up just fine. Conversely, you can use the V4 when it is 100 degrees Fahrenheit or more outside. Our V4 can handle ranges from -50° to 225° Fahrenheit (-45° to 107° Celsius). If you happen to leave your pogo stick in the back of a car that's sitting in the middle of the Sahara Desert on a hot day, you might have some issues with some of the urethane parts beginning to distort. 

How high can I jump on the V4?

How high you can jump really depends on your own athletic ability. Can you dunk a basketball? If so, you'll probably be able to get on the V4 and fly...although it'll take practice before you're able to or even ready to jump high. If you're not very coordinated or athletic, you will have a much harder time jumping high than someone who is. With enough practice, just about everyone should be able to jump 5' or higher. The best of the best will be able to go 9'-10' once they get really, really good on it.

Does it come with streamers?

Only for the most serious riders.


SIZES

What are the dimensions and weight of each size?


What size should I get?

Small - 4'8" - 5'3" (147cm - 161cm)

Medium - 5'4" - 5'11" (162cm - 181cm)

Large - 6' - 6'6" (182cm - 198cm)

There are oftentimes cases where a youngster is a little too short to get the medium but will probably grow to be 5'4" within six months. In those cases, it would be best to get the larger size and grow into it - but only if you will grow into it quickly. Jumping on a size that is too tall for you is more difficult than jumping on a pogo stick that is too short. If you are in between sizes, it's usually better to go smaller.

I'm still growing. Should I get the next larger size if I'm going to be tall enough soon?

If you're still growing and are close to the next size up, we recommend getting the larger size and growing into it. Bouncing on a pogo stick that is too tall is a bit difficult, but nobody wants to shell out $400 and grow out of it in 6 months. If you're more than 3-4" away from the next size up, you should probably get the size that fits you now because the larger size will be too difficult to jump with.
I’m right on the line between a small/medium or medium/large. Which size should I get?
If you're done growing, it's generally better to go with the smaller size when you're right in between two sizes. If you are still growing, you will probably want to get a larger size. 

Small - 4'8" - 5'3" (147cm - 161cm)

Medium - 5'4" - 5'11" (162cm - 181cm)

Large - 6' - 6'6" (182cm - 198cm)

There are oftentimes cases where a youngster is a little too short to get the medium but will probably grow to be 5'6" within six months. In those cases, it would be best to get the larger size and grow into it - but only if you will grow into it quickly. Jumping on a size that is too tall for you is more difficult than jumping on a pogo stick that is too short. If you are in between sizes, it's usually better to go smaller. If you're uncertain, we'll help you figure out which size to get.

Can I jump higher on a bigger size?

No. The size of the pogo stick does not determine the height that you can jump. The world record for height over a bar (10') was set on a Medium. Bigger sizes will not help you jump higher because you will have more difficulty centering your weight on top of the pogo stick. It's very important to be able to bend your upper body over the pogo stick so that you can not only achieve a balanced center of gravity but also push your weight into the bounce to create more lift. Get the size that fits your body best, and you'll be able to jump higher. 

I'm still growing. Should I get the next larger size if I'm going to be tall enough soon?

If you're still growing and are close to the next size up, we recommend getting the larger size and growing into it...but only if you're close. Bouncing on a pogo stick that is too tall is a bit difficult, but nobody wants to shell out $400 and grow out of it in 6 months. If you're more than 3-4" away from the next size up, you should probably get the size that fits you now because the larger size will be too difficult to jump with.

I'm planning on sharing this with my kids. What size should I get?

If you're 6'3" and your kids are 4'6" you will have a very difficult time sharing sizes. Someone who is very tall can easily bounce on a medium but will have issues bouncing on a small. Similarly, kids that are 4'6" will be able to bounce on a small but won't be able to use a medium. About 55% of all pogo sticks we've sold in the past are mediums, so that size is generally the best choice for sharing. It's usually a better idea to get the smaller size than the larger one when groups of people will be sharing. 

I’m under your 75 pound weight requirement. Is there any way I can still use it?

We typically say that there’s a 75 pound limit because we are certain that at that weight anyone really is capable of bouncing. People under 75 pounds will need to have some athleticism and an understanding of timing to be able to use the V4. Someone who weighs 150 pounds doesn't feel much friction in the stick, but someone who weighs 60 pounds will. Because of that, they will need to really be able to time their bounces and jump at the right time in order to use it. Some people get this concept and others just don’t. Being able to jump on the V4 at less than 75 pounds is a case by case basis. We do not recommend people under 60 pounds using it because the pogo stick will be too heavy for them.


USAGE

Do you need a helmet?

Yes. We recommend practicing safe bouncing at all times. 

How do you pump it up?
You can use a standard Schrader valve bike pump or air compressor to pump it up.

How long will the V4 hold air for?
Our V4 can hold air for several days to weeks at a time depending on how you use it.

How much air should I pump the V4 up to?

We don't recommend using less than 30 psi because the lower the air pressure the easier it is for air to escape, meaning you may have to pump it up more often.

How do you adjust the air spring for different people?

The air spring is based on the psi that the V4 is pumped up to.  More air (higher psi) creates a stiffer spring. Less air (lower psi) creates a softer spring.

We recommend starting with 1/4 of your body weight in pounds (1/2 in kilograms). If you weight 200 pounds, for example, you would want to start with around 50 psi in the V4. As you get  better and more comfortable, you can pump more air into the V4, which will stiffen the spring and let you jump higher.

Does the V4 come with a pump?

Not currently. Standard pumps can be purchased for as little as $15 from a Target or Amazon.

What are the weight requirements?

We recommend a 75 pound weight limit on the lower end. There is no maximum weight limit. The V4 has a burst capacity of over 2,000 psi. This means that someone would need to pump 650 psi into the cylinder and then be able to fully compress it to put the cylinder in jeopardy...doing so would mean being able to jump onto buildings and just isn't possible with any human weight or strength - instead we recommend that customers gauge their own abilities. If you weigh 400 pounds the V4 can handle you...but can you handle it?

What is the lowest psi you recommend using? What is the max psi?

We don't recommend using less than 30 psi because the lower the air pressure the easier it is for air to escape, meaning you may have to pump it up more often if you only plan on using it at 25 psi.

How does it collapse for transport mode?

When you release the air from the V4, the shaft and Grip Tip collapse into the cylinder for easy transport. When you pump it up again, they pop right back out.


WHERE TO USE THE V4

What different kinds of places can I bounce on the V4?

You can use the V4 in a variety of places, but we recommend hard, dry surfaces like concrete. Our customers oftentimes take their pogo sticks to schools or similar places that skateboarders like to skate.

How does it handle different types of terrain?

Where we're going, we don't need roads. The V4 can be used a different types of surfaces so long as they are hard and dry. Grass feels nice and soft to bounce in, but you risk the chance of putting holes all over the place...and if you hit a spot with wet dirt or mud you're going to put a hole in the ground. Many people who use our pogo sticks in their backyards like to jump on a sheet of plywood. Aside from concrete and grass you can bounce on wood floors, laminate, cement, asphalt and other surfaces that won't break or cause you to slip. You SHOULD NOT jump on anything that is wet or soft. Stay away from gravel, mud, sand, and really dirty environments. 

Can I use the V4 at a skate park?

Skate parks can be really fun on a V4, but you need to be aware of landing on angled surfaces like ramps. Doing so can result in slipping out and can be dangerous. If you do take the V4 to a skate park, do not jump onto any of the sttep ramps...instead, jump over them! Some skate parks allow pogo sticks, and some do not. It usually depends on who is monitoring the park.

Can I bounce on hills?

We don't recommend bouncing on hills. Steep hills are a definite no no. Very, VERY mild hills are probably ok, but make sure you're very confident in your skills before trying to attempt bouncing on a hill.

Can I use the V4 for a commute?

The V4 is a pretty difficult workout. Bouncing for more than a minute will have your heart beating like Dave Grohl on the drums. Because of that, the V4 is not an ideal commuting device. By the time you get to work or school you'd need to take a nap.


MAINTENANCE & CARE

How often do I need to do maintenance?

As you bounce on the V4 dirt and debris will get sucked into the cylinder, eventually gumming up the seal and slowing down the bounce. You might not notice the change as it gradually takes place, but after several thousand bounces it will become more difficult to jump. We have two types of maintenance that we perform. Adding lubricant will make the V4 nice and slippery again, but it won't clean up the dirt and debris in the cylinder. After adding lube a few times, it's best to clean the dirt up with a full oil change.

ADDING LUBE: We recommend adding lubricant to your V4 about every 3,000-5,000 bounces. Doing so takes about 2 minutes and is really simple. 

OIL CHANGES: We recommend doing a full oil change every 4-5 times that you add lubricant or about every 15,000-20,000 bounces. Performing a full oil change takes approximately 10-15 minutes.


PAYMENT & SHIPPING

Can I pick mine up locally?

Yep. Our shop is located in Mission Viejo, CA. If you happen to live nearby and want to pick it up instead of paying for shipping, we'd love to meet you and help you get accustomed to your new V4!

Can I come by and check it out before I decide to buy?

Yep, but we don’t have anyone who works full-time. You’ll probably have to come by on a weekend or on weeknights after work.

Are there any countries you don’t ship to?

We can ship anywhere in the world. 

What are the shipping times within the US?

Shipping times in the US are anywhere from 1-2 days on the west coast to 5 days on the east coast.

How long are international shipping times?

International shipping times vary from country to country. Depending on your local customs inspection process, the shipping time can take anywhere from 7-14 days. Some countries have more slow customs processes and can even take up to 21 days. This is completely out of our control, as we cannot contact the customs office and ask them to speed it up - even though we'd love to do so!

How much are import taxes and how will they be paid?

Import taxes are charged on a country by country basis. Once your V4 clears customs, you will be contacted by your local postal carrier to pay for the customs fees prior to final delivery.


COST & MANUFACTURING

How is the V4 manufactured?

Every single V4 we sell goes through a rigorous build, inspection, and testing process. Once the parts are manufactured in Southern California we ship them back to the warehouse where they are assembled by hand. We have more than 20 suppliers who we work closely with to manufacture or purchase parts from. Each of these manufacturers does a terrific job, which is why we are able to offer a 1-year warranty on the V4. Some of our parts (like the handlebar grips or bolts) are purchases from other companies. However, most of the parts we purchase are made specifically for us and then are welded, cut & drilled, or chamfered before being delivered.

Who assembles them?
We assemble every pogo stick ourselves. If we are not able to do so, we beg for help from friends and family. When we're really lucky, we're able to get a small group of local high school kids to help out for a few days, in which case we can build quite a few.


 

WARRANTY & SUPPORT

What is the warranty?

The V3 comes with a 1-year warranty on parts. The handlebars are excluded from the warranty because they are designed to give way in order to help prevent potential injuries. From time to time, people do break the handlebars, for which we sell a 3-pack replacement on our website for $20. We really do build our pogo sticks to a high standard. Every single stick is built by hand in our Southern California shop. We then inspect and bounce test each one prior to boxing and shipping them out. Because of that, our rejects are exceptionally low. Most issues that do occur in the lifetime of our sticks are pretty easily fixed with a phone call and maybe a small replacement part (o-ring). From time to time, we do have sticks out there that people can't repair on their own, which we'll repair for free within the warranty period.

Can I get a refund?

According to Indiegogo, contributions are non-refundable in their Terms of Use. However, upon the completion of the campaign, we will confirm your shipping address and your order to perform refunds on a case by case basis. We get it, sometimes life happens. Keep in mind that we can't perform refunds until the campaign is complete.

Will there be a network of retailers carrying the V4?

As of right now, there is no network of retailers carrying the V4. This will likely change over the next couple years.
story_txt:
THE MOST ADVANCED POGO STICK EVER CREATED

The V4 is the most advanced pogo stick ever created. We took the traditional spring and threw it in the garbage years ago. Springs are cool and all, but they can’t be adjusted on the fly, and they're just too heavy to propel someone really high.
In order to get more air, we needed to add air.V4 SPECS

The V4 is by far the most advanced pogo stick on the market. We've put a lot of attention into every single detail to make sure that it feels incredible right out of the box. 
ADD AIR TO CREATE A STIFFER SPRING
REMOVE AIR TO CREATE A SOFTER SPRING


It really is pretty simple. Start out at a low, comfortable pressure - gauges in the US always use psi to measure pressure. Start with 1/4 of what you weigh in pounds for your psi. After you get used to the air spring, you can pump more air into the V4. The more air you put into the V4 the stiffer the spring becomes. If you put too much, it'll become too stiff. At that point, you just press the button on top to release some air.




One of the best things about the V4 is that you can choose however you want to use it. Pump the V4 up with low pressure, and it will have a soft spring that limits your jump. If you pump it up a lot, the spring will stiffen and you can go higher. Pump it up with too much air, and the spring will become so hard it won’t budge until you let some air out. Try different air pressures to find your preferred setting!
Any model can jump 1’ high, and any model can jump 8’ feet high.
The V4 Pro can jump 10’ high and is much more comfortable at altitude. 
The V4 is a good all around stick that can be geared for going high or just bouncing a foot or two. 
The V4 Fit is geared toward the fitness aspect only. While it can still bounce 8' high, it's not nearly as comfortable when doing so.

You have to see these incredible athletes - you won't believe the tricks they're able to do on pogo sticks!       - Michael Strahan  |  Good Morning America

You are new, you are exciting, you are fresh, you are dangerous, and you were great!     - Howie Mandell  |  America's Got Talent
I can't even talk I'm so excited!      - Queen Latifah  |  The Queen Latifah Show




EXERCISE


The V4 provides one of the most fun forms of full body exercise you’ll ever have. One of the coolest things about it is that it doesn't feel like exercise. You just hop on and bounce away - and before you know it, your heart is pounding and the sweat is pouring. According to neurosurgeon Dr. Kim Manwaring, the G forces experienced when bouncing on our pogo sticks help with “...lower circulating cholesterol and triglyceride levels, assist in the rehabilitation of a heart problem, promote tissue repair, improve balance, increase capacity for respiration and improve muscle-to-fat ratio."

The V4 Fit is a great for exercise. The shorter shaft makes it easier to step up onto, faster to learn, & simpler control. As a low impact, high intensity exercise device, it’s suitable for HIIT (high intensity interval training), Crossfit and circuit training, and any other sort of training in which you are looking for a high heart rate and short bursts of energy expenditure.
MUSCLES WORKED: lower back, glutes, guads, hamstrings, calves, and triceps.   


EASILY RETRACTABLE FOR TRANSPORTATION


The V4 uses an air spring to launch you into the air. If it isn’t cool enough that air alone can provide enough power to toss you 10’ high, then what about the fact that when you’re done using it you can just release the air and collapse the air spring?

When you let the air out, the shaft compresses inside of the stick for travel mode. Freaking awesome!
The medium V4 goes from 55" in height during bounce mode to 34: in height during travel mode.

REVIEWS & TESTIMONIALS



Biff Hutchison holds the world record for jumping up and over a bar on a pogo stick...at 10 feet! He's one of the best in the entire world and holds multiple world records and championships. If you need an outside opinion, just listen to what he's got to say.
New Indiegogo Customer Reviews (Check Our Comments Section)

What a fantastic device. The high quality of materials and craftsmanship are obvious as soon as you open the box. I watched the tutorial, got it out of the box and took it outside. It’s been nearly 30 years since I have been on a pogo stick. Bouncing on the V4 Pro was amazing. It was just like being a kid again…onlyBIGGER and BETTTER! If you’ve ever pogoed before, you’ll be getting some solid bounces on your Vurtego in no time.       - Brookes Bacon
Connor LOVES his V4 Pro. Here is his progress after only two days. http://youtu.be/W9N_5yHcvXA          - Shawn Humphreys







WHO'S IT FOR?


The V4 is for anyone over 75 pounds. You’d think that our only customers are younguns’ between 12 & 20, but you’d be pretty surprised. A lot of our customers are actually full-grown adults in the mid-life crisis era of their lives who are trying to prove to themselves that they’re not that old. They say 60 is the new 40, right? :)
Really, our V4 can easily be used by pretty much anyone over 75 pounds that can jump on a trampoline. The V4 is a bit more difficult than a trampoline because you'll need to use more core strength and balance, but once you get used to it, the feeling is very similar...except it goes wherever you want it to.  

The V4 is for you if:

You’re looking for a really fun, killer workout
You’re a crazy kid who wants to push the limits
You like extreme sports
You like dogs
You've always dreamed of flying
You think the hoverboard from Back to the Future should be here already
You like cats…cuz cats are better than dogs
Just kidding, dogs are better
You've always want to be able to dunk a basketball
You think parkour is pretty cool and want to try it for yourself
Psyche! Cats are totally better

SAFETY






Safety is an area of huge concern for us. Our V4 is a lot safer than you might first believe. Many extreme sports are dangerous because of one element: speed. When moving at high rates of speed, it’s easy to get hurt. The V4 is actually deceptively safe because there’s no speed involved. Yes, you can jump really high on it…like really freaking high. BUT, it takes a lot of practice to get to that point - and even then you’re not attached to the pogo stick. If you ever feel uncomfortable, you can simply throw the pogo stick aside and land on your feet. We beefed up the V4 like a Belgian Blue Super Bull for that very reason - it's designed to take a beating so your body doesn't have to. 
As is the case with any potentially dangerous activity, however, you should take this seriously. Wear a helmet and any other safety gear you feel might be necessary at all times. Don’t bounce in wet conditions. Don’t bounce indoors or under low objects. Don’t bounce next to traffic. Don’t bounce with people standing right next to you, blah, blah, blah. Use some common sense, and you’ll be fine.




USE IT (almost) ANYWHERE
Just like you, the V4 loves to be taken to new places. While most people will start out bouncing in front of their house, the real fun with the V4 comes when you start playing around with obstacles. Cities, schools, walls, rails, parks, tables, stairs, ledges - you’ll never look at the world the same way once you start bouncing around on obstacles. Jump off of things. Jump over things. Jump onto and then off of and then over things. Stalls and grinds and walls and lines. Every architectural feature around you has the potential to be jumped on or off of. 
Places we don’t recommend are: hills or uneven surfaces, places that are wet or slippery, and environments that dusty and sandy (the dust will get sucked into the stick and cause the lubricant to get all dirty).







WATCH THE V4 PUSH THE LIMITS





REWARDS









WHO ARE WE?
We’re just a good ole’ fashioned American made company trying to provide the best quality product and highest level of customer service imaginable. We have 0 full-time employees and work on pogo stick stuff on nights and weekends.
We do this because we love it, and we want to see a little bit more enjoyment in this crazy world. 










FAQ

PRODUCT QUESTIONS
What is the difference between the V4 and the V4 Pro?

The V4 is the pogo stick that most people will probably benefit from. It is designed to deliver a soft, smooth bounce that resembles a portable trampoline. The major difference between our old V3 and the new V4 is that we’ve added 14 additional cubic inches of air to the cylinder. This additional air changes everything. With the V4, you can bounce higher with lower air pressure. This makes it easier to control, faster to learn, and easier to jump high & do tricks. Aside from that, we’ve updated nearly every part on the pogo stick to fix nagging issues that have been troublesome in the past. The result is that the V4 is our newest and most amazing pogo stick. Just like Apple always says - this is the best “insert product here” we’ve ever made. In this case, however, the V4 really is by far the best pogo stick we’ve ever made.

The V4 Pro takes all of the designs put into the V4 and then adds two new benefits. The V4 Pro has a slide shaft with a stroke that is 2” longer than the V4. This longer slide shaft provides extra boost for jumping even higher or landing from greater heights - like when you jump off of something tall. The V4 Pro also has a bushing with about 78% less surface area for less friction. On top of that, the bushing has pockets drilled into it that enable you to add your own lubricant. Once lubricant is added, the bushing will then self-lubricate the shaft while you bounce, providing an even smoother bounce. This bushing coupled with the longer slide shaft make the V4 ideal for serious riders or those looking to get the best we have to give. 
The V4 Fit is geared specifically for people interested in exercise and performance training. The V4 Fit has a 2" shorter slide shaft stroke, which limits how high you can go. A fairly large number of our customers are people who grew up with a pogo stick and want to re-live their childhood glory days with a new age exercise tool. The V4 is a great fit for this because the shorter shaft makes it easier to step up onto, faster to learn, & simpler control. As a low impact, high intensity exercise device, it’s suitable for HIIT training, Crossfit and circuit training, and any other sort of training in which you are looking for a high heart rate and short bursts of energy expenditure. 
What are the color options?
The V4 comes in two different colors and three different sizes. The V4 is white. The V4 Pro will come in green. 

What parts are most likely to break and need replacing?The two parts that are most likely to wear down and break are the Grip Tip and the Handlebars. The Grip Tip takes a tremendous beating over its life and wears down like tread on tires. Over time you will need to replace it. The handlebars are designed to bend or break for safety reasons. In the event that you drop the pogo stick and it happens to land just right, the handlebars may bend, or after bending enough times, break. This is a safety feature designed into the pogo stick. You can purchase a new Grip Tip for $20 or Handlebars for $15. All other parts are covered under our warranty.   Are the parts replaceable? Where can I get replacement parts?Replacement parts are available on our website www.vurtego.com. All parts on the V4 can be quickly replaced at home without the need for sending the pogo stick in for repair.  
Is there an altimeter?No altimeter on planet Earth can measure the ridiculous altitude's that the V4 is capable of reaching!
What is the temperature range that the V4 can be used it?The V4 is made from materials that can handle a wide range of temperatures. We have used the V4 in sub-zero temperatures, and it holds up just fine. Conversely, you can use the V4 when it is 100 degrees Fahrenheit or more outside. Our V4 can handle ranges from -50° to 225° Fahrenheit (-45° to 107° Celsius). If you happen to leave your pogo stick in the back of a car that's sitting in the middle of the Sahara Desert on a hot day, you might have some issues with some of the urethane parts beginning to distort. 
How high can I jump on the V4?






How high you can jump really depends on your own athletic ability. Can you dunk a basketball? If so, you'll probably be able to get on the V4 and fly...although it'll take practice before you're able to or even ready to jump high. If you're not very coordinated or athletic, you will have a much harder time jumping high than someone who is. With enough practice, just about everyone should be able to jump 5' or higher. The best of the best will be able to go 9'-10' once they get really, really good on it.



Does it come with streamers?

Only for the most serious riders.

How long will the V4 hold air for?Our V4 can hold air for several days to weeks at a time depending on how you use it.
How much air should I pump the V4 up to?
We don't recommend using less than 30 psi because the lower the air pressure the easier it is for air to escape, meaning you may have to pump it up more often.



How do you adjust the air spring for different people?
The air spring is based on the psi that the V4 is pumped up to.  More air (higher psi) creates a stiffer spring. Less air (lower psi) creates a softer spring.


We recommend starting with 1/4 of your body weight in pounds (1/2 in kilograms). If you weight 200 pounds, for example, you would want to start with around 50 psi in the V4. As you get  better and more comfortable, you can pump more air into the V4, which will stiffen the spring and let you jump higher.
Does the V4 come with a pump?

Not currently. Standard pumps can be purchased for as little as $15 from a Target or Amazon.
What are the weight requirements?
We recommend a 75 pound weight limit on the lower end. There is no maximum weight limit. The V4 has a burst capacity of over 2,000 psi. This means that someone would need to pump 650 psi into the cylinder and then be able to fully compress it to put the cylinder in jeopardy...doing so would mean being able to jump onto buildings and just isn't possible with any human weight or strength - instead we recommend that customers gauge their own abilities. If you weigh 400 pounds the V4 can handle you...but can you handle it?

What is the lowest psi you recommend using? What is the max psi?
We don't recommend using less than 30 psi because the lower the air pressure the easier it is for air to escape, meaning you may have to pump it up more often if you only plan on using it at 25 psi.

How does it collapse for transport mode?
When you release the air from the V4, the shaft and Grip Tip collapse into the cylinder for easy transport. When you pump it up again, they pop right back out.


WHERE TO USE THE V4
What different kinds of places can I bounce on the V4?
You can use the V4 in a variety of places, but we recommend hard, dry surfaces like concrete. Our customers oftentimes take their pogo sticks to schools or similar places that skateboarders like to skate.
How does it handle different types of terrain?
Where we're going, we don't need roads. The V4 can be used a different types of surfaces so long as they are hard and dry. Grass feels nice and soft to bounce in, but you risk the chance of putting holes all over the place...and if you hit a spot with wet dirt or mud you're going to put a hole in the ground. Many people who use our pogo sticks in their backyards like to jump on a sheet of plywood. Aside from concrete and grass you can bounce on wood floors, laminate, cement, asphalt and other surfaces that won't break or cause you to slip. You SHOULD NOT jump on anything that is wet or soft. Stay away from gravel, mud, sand, and really dirty environments. 
Can I use the V4 at a skate park?


Skate parks can be really fun on a V4, but you need to be aware of landing on angled surfaces like ramps. Doing so can result in slipping out and can be dangerous. If you do take the V4 to a skate park, do not jump onto any of the sttep ramps...instead, jump over them! Some skate parks allow pogo sticks, and some do not. It usually depends on who is monitoring the park.
Can I bounce on hills?

We don't recommend bouncing on hills. Steep hills are a definite no no. Very, VERY mild hills are probably ok, but make sure you're very confident in your skills before trying to attempt bouncing on a hill.


Can I use the V4 for a commute?

The V4 is a pretty difficult workout. Bouncing for more than a minute will have your heart beating like Dave Grohl on the drums. Because of that, the V4 is not an ideal commuting device. By the time you get to work or school you'd need to take a nap.




MAINTENANCE & CARE
How often do I need to do maintenance?
As you bounce on the V4 dirt and debris will get sucked into the cylinder, eventually gumming up the seal and slowing down the bounce. You might not notice the change as it gradually takes place, but after several thousand bounces it will become more difficult to jump. We have two types of maintenance that we perform. Adding lubricant will make the V4 nice and slippery again, but it won't clean up the dirt and debris in the cylinder. After adding lube a few times, it's best to clean the dirt up with a full oil change.
ADDING LUBE: We recommend adding lubricant to your V4 about every 3,000-5,000 bounces. Doing so takes about 2 minutes and is really simple. 
OIL CHANGES: We recommend doing a full oil change every 4-5 times that you add lubricant or about every 15,000-20,000 bounces. Performing a full oil change takes approximately 10-15 minutes.


PAYMENT & SHIPPING
Can I pick mine up locally?
Yep. Our shop is located in Mission Viejo, CA. If you happen to live nearby and want to pick it up instead of paying for shipping, we'd love to meet you and help you get accustomed to your new V4!




Can I come by and check it out before I decide to buy?
Yep, but we don’t have anyone who works full-time. You’ll probably have to come by on a weekend or on weeknights after work.

Are there any countries you don’t ship to?
We can ship anywhere in the world. 




What are the shipping times within the US?
Shipping times in the US are anywhere from 1-2 days on the west coast to 5 days on the east coast.
How long are international shipping times?
International shipping times vary from country to country. Depending on your local customs inspection process, the shipping time can take anywhere from 7-14 days. Some countries have more slow customs processes and can even take up to 21 days. This is completely out of our control, as we cannot contact the customs office and ask them to speed it up - even though we'd love to do so!
How much are import taxes and how will they be paid?
Import taxes are charged on a country by country basis. Once your V4 clears customs, you will be contacted by your local postal carrier to pay for the customs fees prior to final delivery.




COST & MANUFACTURING
How is the V4 manufactured?
Every single V4 we sell goes through a rigorous build, inspection, and testing process. Once the parts are manufactured in Southern California we ship them back to the warehouse where they are assembled by hand. We have more than 20 suppliers who we work closely with to manufacture or purchase parts from. Each of these manufacturers does a terrific job, which is why we are able to offer a 1-year warranty on the V4. Some of our parts (like the handlebar grips or bolts) are purchases from other companies. However, most of the parts we purchase are made specifically for us and then are welded, cut & drilled, or chamfered before being delivered.
Who assembles them?We assemble every pogo stick ourselves. If we are not able to do so, we beg for help from friends and family. When we're really lucky, we're able to get a small group of local high school kids to help out for a few days, in which case we can build quite a few.


 




WARRANTY & SUPPORT
What is the warranty?
The V3 comes with a 1-year warranty on parts. The handlebars are excluded from the warranty because they are designed to give way in order to help prevent potential injuries. From time to time, people do break the handlebars, for which we sell a 3-pack replacement on our website for $20. We really do build our pogo sticks to a high standard. Every single stick is built by hand in our Southern California shop. We then inspect and bounce test each one prior to boxing and shipping them out. Because of that, our rejects are exceptionally low. Most issues that do occur in the lifetime of our sticks are pretty easily fixed with a phone call and maybe a small replacement part (o-ring). From time to time, we do have sticks out there that people can't repair on their own, which we'll repair for free within the warranty period.
Can I get a refund?
According to Indiegogo, contributions are non-refundable in their Terms of Use. However, upon the completion of the campaign, we will confirm your shipping address and your order to perform refunds on a case by case basis. We get it, sometimes life happens. Keep in mind that we can't perform refunds until the campaign is complete.

Will there be a network of retailers carrying the V4?
As of right now, there is no network of retailers carrying the V4. This will likely change over the next couple years.

story:
THE HOPE LINE is an around-the-clock multiple service for elderly people and for people with disabilities, which includes medical alarm services, information and medical call-center, network of a social care workers and psychological services. 

The Hope Line service will be available all over Ukraine. Our company provides the services and care elderly people and at-risk groups need and can rely on to live more fulfilled lives all over Ukraine.

HOW IT WORKS?

Each of our users will have an emergency wireless transmitter (pendant or wristband with SOS button) and a base station, which has a very sensitive microphone and a loudspeaker. With just one press of a special SOS button our system will guarantee access to essential aid and support, providing vital care to those who need it most. Elderly people will be able to call for help, obtain the necessary information from the call center operator and consult a physician with one press of their personal SOS button. When we receive a distress call, a social worker will be sent immediately to deliver any necessary medication or goods, open the door for emergency services or give first aid if necessary. 

WHY DO WE DO THIS?

There are over thirteen million elderly citizens in Ukraine and more than eight million people with disabilities. Some have no immediate family or their relatives live far away. So there is no one who can help them in their daily life or in a case of emergency. The state healthcare and social welfare systems in Ukraine cannot provide proper care for such people yet.

There are often no medical centers in villages and small cities of Ukraine where elderly people could consult a doctor and get medical help. Elderly people have a lot of questions that they do not know who to ask. So they just stay alone with their problems.

The Hope Line will solve those problems. 


OUR GOAL.

To fully realise the true potential of The Hope Line, we need to raise further investment. Our basic $10,000 goal will allow us to create the medical call-center. The funds will be used to organise a call centre staffed by trained medical workers, create a database of our clients' case histories, get a medical license, update our call-center software. Any money raised above the target $10,000 will be used to improve our The Hope Line service. We take part in the Chivas Regal "The Venture" competition, so the rest of the funds we hope to get from "The Venture" project.


TIMELINE. Medical call-center.


OUR TEAM.

We were established by the brother and sister Dmitrii and Valeriia Nazarchuk in 2012. They have, if combined, nearly 30 years ofmanagement experience.Our founders are joined by IlonaKotova, our Commercial Director, who has over six years of experience in finance . 



All members of our team have elderly close ones, but unfortunately sometimes they have no time to visit them. That’s why The Hope Line project is really important  to us. Young people can be sure their loved ones are cared for 24/7.


OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP.

If you can't contribute, can you help spread the word?  Share in your social networks, make some noise for us and help us help the elderly people!

  • Use the Indiegogo share tools and be sure to visit our website Line24 of Facebook page;
  • We take part in the Chivas Regal "The Venture" competition, we would love you to vote for TheHopeLine. With your help we can get the share of $250,000  from "The Venture" by Chivas Regal. 

THANK YOU for helping us!

PERKS!

story:
Acuswedemat - the acupressure mat that eases pain and gets you relaxed.

Most people are affected daily by common ailments such as neck pain, stress, lack of sleep, fatigue, sore muscles or headaches. Thankfully there is a proven, effective, simple, safe therapeutic tool to get sustained relief - the Acuswedemat. 

 

Acuswedemat increases blood circulation

The simple process of lying down and relaxing on an Acuswedemat will naturally reenergize and stimulate the release of endorphins and oxytocin, the body’s own pain relief hormones.  These "happy" hormones, which are released during exercise, touch and excitement;  relieve pain, give you a natural high, give comfort to aching, tired muscles, provide stress relief and help to promote an overall sense of physical and mental well being.

The Acuswedemat can also provide a deeper more restorative sleep, increased energy levels, relief from migraine headaches, immune system activation, relief from colds, flu and asthma, and improved metabolism and digestion. 


HIGHLIGHTS

Cost effective -- compared to acupuncture 

Easy to use -- just lie down and relax

Convenient -- use it any time you need it

Safe -- no needles, no chemicals, no risk

Private -- use it at home, with no assistance 

Effective -- 97% user satisfaction 

Acupressure points -- almost 14,000 points/mat

Clinically tested -- proven to reduce pain

Big size -- Covers your body from the neck to the bottom



Clinical studies

Several clinical studies have been done in Sweden, the United States and Russia; scientifically proving that participants experienced a significant and measurable reduction in the intensity pain with no harmful side effects. 
Our own heat camera test done in the US shows that effect comes within minutes and the red parts in the images below,  shows how the blood circulation increases. 

Before

After

Innovative design

Together with one of the Swedish top Design agencies, we have developed a product that is desirably designed without taken away the functionality. Each set includes one acupressure mat and one practical bag.

The three E's

Acuswedemat is Ergonomically designed, Easy to clean and Environmentally friendly as it's made of a eco-friendly neoprene material which is unique for acupressure mats.

Testimonials

¨Acuswedemat is fantastic! It covers not just the back but also the neck and bottom and it’s much more intense than the other acupressure mats I’ve used. It’s actually rather addictive and it make’s me wind down and relax before going to sleep”, says Jeanna Högberg rides for the Swedish Dressage National Team.

"I love the Acuswedemat! I've been using the Acuswedemat for several days now and I love it. After a short while you can really feel how the blood circulation starts and how your muscles become relaxed. For me, that are not so keen on traditional massage, this is really the thing for me”, says Marie Munters, Professional & International Dressage rider and member of Knytkalaset in Sweden.

”I love the Auswedemat! I get relaxed and warm when I use it. I also get less stiff. Thanks a lot J”, says Nicola Phillippaerts, International Show Jumping rider, Belgium

”Due to my high work rate, I often have difficulty in winding down before going to sleep. The Acuswedemat helps me relax and my sleeping problems have vanished”, says Jessica Löwencrantz, Business Strategist & Editor, Sweden

”Yesterday I started running again after two months. Today stiff back muscles (nothing to see with age J). The ideal moment to test the Acuswede acupressure mat! Result after 20 min: warm back muscles and stiffness has completely gone ... a first very positive test”, says Peter Vanherck, Belgium.

Facts:



Length: 95 cm, 37,8 inches
Width: 60,5 cm, 24 inches
Acupressure roses: 513 
Points on each rose: 27 
Acupressure points: 13 851
Material -- eco-friendly neoprene (diving suit material)
Strap with velcro fitting keeps the mat folded



 Why become an Acuswedemat backer?

Our mission is to help people be their best selves and unlock their full potential. Without health, that is impossible; it's the foundation for everything else. 

We have spent the last few years learning about acupressure and all the good benefits that comes from it. This resulted in the Acuswedemat. 

We need your help to reach our goal here on Indiegogo to be able to launch the Acuswedemat worldwide. We like to place the first order at our factory, make advertising, spread it on social media, visit relevant trade fairs and do all there has to be done to get this amazing product out on the market. We also want to make a more thorough heat camera study. 

We want everyone, all over the world, to get the chance to have an Acuswedemat to improve their well-being. 

For more information www.acuswedemat.com



Shipping
When you back this project, you’ll see shipping prices for your home country. We are based in Sweden, but will be fulfilling orders from the US and the EU. Please note that if you live outside of the US or EU, you may be responsible for local duties, fees and taxes.


Who are we?

Three years ago we developed and designed an acupressure blanket for horses. The blanket is used by elite riders all over the world. It actually worked so well on horses that the riders started asking us if there isn't a similar product for humans. 

So we started to think about how we could meet up these demands to develop an acupressure mat for humans. We set up a test team of elite riders  (that are known to have a very high demand of high quality products). This resulted in the Acuswedemat. 

Read more about Accuhorsemat on http://www.accuhorsemat.com

story:
Short Summary

At Evergreen Child Care we strive to educate the whole child. We believe that nurturing independence, eating wholesome foods, learning emotional literacy, and interacting with nature creates an amazing foundation for children to grow from. 

The success of this Indiegogo project will allow us to open a larger center, while maintaining our holistic model of care, by the fall of 2016.

Evergreen Child Care provides organic meals, a cloth diaper service, and a family-based model of care. Our unique qualities have made our services in such high demand, that we need to expand to better serve our community.

No other child care center in the area offers what we provide, and with the lack of quality child care in the La Crosse area, we cannot accommodate the demand for our services at our current capacity.  


What We Need & What You Get

We need $11,600 to make our group center happen!

The funding for this project will be used to secure the financing of our group center near the downtown La Crosse area. We need to make building renovations, create a natural play space, purchase appliances, furnish a new space, and train quality child care providers in our unique style of care. All of this is very expensive, but this Indiegogo project will allow us to secure the financing that we're already pre-approved for. 

We know that quality child care is hard to find these days, and our waitlist is really long! We're offering people the opportunity to pay for their first month of care, and secure a spot at our new group center, by helping us to fund the expansion!

We're also offering Evergreen Child Care T-Shirts, custom Baltic Amber necklaces, and the opportunity to customize one of our garden pathway stones.

The Impact

This project is truly a community-funded endeavor! We're so excited to be able to crowdfund holistic childcare, which is in such high demand. 

Children are our future! Supporting this expansion will help us to provide an early-childhood foundation of social and emotional literacy, and an unparalleled understanding of the world.

Upon expansion, we plan to forge relationships with local organic farmers. This will allow us to supply the freshest organic produce, and support our local farming communities.


Risks & Challenges

The process of opening a licensed child care center in Wisconsin is a difficult task, no matter how large or small the center.

After being successfully funded we will need to obtain, update, and repurpose an existing building near the downtown La Crosse area for use as a commercial child care facility. This process involves working with city building inspectors, architects, and state child care licensing technical consultants.

Other Ways You Can Help

We totally understand that financial contribution isn't possible for some people.

If you're unable to contribute financially, please share our project!

Get the word out to people who love children, need child care, or just think that what we're doing is cool.

story:
This is a Choose Your Own Adventure titled:

Cover me, Im going In: a fundraiser made with cliches by a dude who barely understands them.

 

I. Preface

No hesitations about funding this business?

a. No, None. I was born ready:  Take the fast tack to Chapter 4: Lose your head, lose your temper & the almighty dollar.

b. None, but I want an adventure & possibly a "perk": continue to Chapter 1: I eat Guys like you for breakfast

c. Actually, maybe, but I didn't watch the video: watch the video & restart your quest 

d. I am hesitant. I watched the video: continue your quest to Chapter 1

 

chapter 1. ​

I eat guys like you for breakfast

 

TRUE or FALSE:

Transgender autistics should build & lead businesses

 

True: continue

False: fire in the hole!

 

I'd rather see more transgender autistic people:

a. Running a business

B. Working their way up in a business

 

a. Continue

b. Swipe Left

 

One or more is of interest to me:

  • Positive food communication
  • A food routine unique to each individual
  •  impacts of vitamins & suppliments (including herbs) 
  • Meditating however feels right
  • Shifting from wanting & hoping to having. 
  • Smashing the patriarchy

 

Yes: Continue

No nor do I want anyone else to have any of these: (emjoi that shrugs)

 

Chapter 2:

nothing ventured, nothing gained

With a degree in Science Nutrition and Health, I am starting a unique nutritionist business. I am applying to Dietician programs and will grow my business while continuing my education. 

I am an actually autistic, neurodivergent, transgender nutritionist who believes in empowering our communities through taking control of our bodies, sharing knowledge and leading businesses. Nutrition, meditation, supplimentatiom and a unique and positive relationship with food changed my life. Support on my journey was and is essential.

I'm here to remind you there's no wrong way to eat, there's no wrong way to meditate and nutrition & life coaching is for all brains & bodies

Make sense?

Yes: Continue.

Sound like a bad idea? 

Yes, terrible: I don't know what to tell you.

Chapter 3:

take one for the team cuz it's raining cats & dogs

goal: $6,000

this only takes six $30 donors a day for 30 days!

But campaigns have highs and lows, so what is your personal maximum? For some people, it's $250 and for others it's $10. Together, we come together to make a real vision a reality. And that, my friends, is the power of community and the beauty of grassroots fundraising. We all play an essential role.

Into it?: Continue

Chapter 4:

until the cows come home

what are you literally giving funds to?

Stage 1:

  • Launching & sustaining my complete website 
  • Promotions, marketing and branding 
  • Creating client in take forms
  • Launch slliding scale program
  • Expand current research
  • Expanding client base

Stage 2:

  • In person & online networking to:
  • build business partners 
  • share research and trainings with individuals, organizations, medical professionals

Ultimately, your support will:

  •  Allow me to focus part time on nutrition consultations and full-time on growing the business. 
  • This is changing our communities

I have led businesses and nonprofits for over ten years. So, I understand plan and strategy and am ready to be my own boss. Meanwhile, I have been hired to consult for non profits starting in 2020 to receive a cost of living. So your funds will go directly to The Autistic Nutritionist business

 

Chapter 4:

lose your head, lose your temper & the almighty dollar

Congratulations, you're almost at the end of your quest

Now. Take a deep Breath because there is no real ending, just the place where we stop the story.

how are you feeling?

A. i believe in the power of people coming together to create something magical

B. I will support your start up, Jersey.

C. I don't know: Honestly, I am still unsure. It's not personal. Let's check out the perks because I'm buying holiday presents anyway!!

A.B & C. Continue to complete your voyage

 

Chapter 5:

The Cats out of the Bag & It's Easier than Pie:

Follow the steps to "select a perk" to continue your adventure...
