story:
Short Summary

Hello! I'm Kerri, wife and mother, yoga teacher and doula.  After having my daughter, Iris, I went through a tough time of great anxiety and deep depression. While I did hear of postpartum depression, I didn't understand it completely and minimized my perceived risk. However, I was clearly at risk. I had been diagnosed with clinical depression in the past and during the early part of my pregnancy I had, what I now know, was antenatal depression. 

Now, I know that I am not alone. 1 in 7 women suffer with perinatal mood disorders (including depression, anxiety, bipolar, OCD, PTSD, and a small group with psychosis).  Some are dying.

Having postpartum depression and anxiety was like sitting in a dragons mouth - one move and it would swallow me. It was a paralyzing and lonely experience. Eventually, with time and yoga, I was able to break through some of that isolation and find a more peaceful outlook on motherhood and life. This was also with support of friends and family.

Some women need more including mental health counseling and/or medication.  Every mom is different, but I believe every mom could benefit from yoga and mindfulness instruction and at the very least, as safe, supportive community. 

This is what I want to build and about a year ago I introduced Out of the Blue Yoga for this purpose. The first year, I was able to reach around 70 prenatal and postnatal moms with yoga. I want to do more. My husband, Isaac, works multiple jobs to support my dream of building Out of the Blue Yoga. The purchase of Yoga Harbor gives me the space to legitimize Out of the Blue Yoga and more flexibility to DO more and HELP more moms find their way out of the blue. 

 

What We Need & What You Get

The money raised in this campaign will help us with the creation of the right space for families in the Clearwater-Largo community at our newly purchased, Yoga Harbor studio. Out of the Blue Yoga is a program within the studio. While classes are held for the entire community, we wish to build special moms room to provide services such as mindfulness classes, support groups, private prenatal and postpartum class, mother roasting services, massage, and doula consultation. Our main yoga room will provide group prenatal and mommy and me yoga classes as well as space for child birth classes, prenatal yoga instructor trainings, and birth/parent- related work shops. 

Your gift will go towards:

  • the buildout of the moms room and adding amenities for the comforts of moms and babies
  • re-painting, re-furnishing, and redesigning the lobby, moms room, and yoga room.
  • setting up added security to create the safest space possible
  • floor cleaning
  • purchase and install of new signage
  • enhancing the front porch and grounds surrounding the studio
  • assisting with buy-in cost of business
  • Any extra funds will go towards marketing expenses.

Perks!

Depending on the amount your gift will get you services and products offered by myself and the studio, including yoga instruction, massage, t-shirts, and more.

If we do not make that goal, we will push on with less and put the donations towards the most needed expenses. 
 

The Impact

I want to offer moms a support system and community.  Often what is lacking is support and understanding of the difficulties of adjusting to motherhood. 1 in 7 go through it, many more are silent. I want to offer moms tools and options, so no one feels like they have none. I want to build a bridge (with yoga, essentially) between that mom and any other professional help she may need by continuing to build relationships with resources in the Tampa Bay area. 

Research and studies are starting to show the benefits of yoga to pregnant and new mothers in terms of reduction of physical pain, stress levels, and anxiety.  I believe we can have the same results.

http://www.ctcpjournal.com/article/S1744-3881(1... 

http://onlinelibrary.wiley.com/doi/10.1111/j.15...

Risks & Challenges

My biggest challenge is financial support. I have enjoyed building connections in this community and will continue to form more. I also have a great business partner, Melissa, whom supports my vision for Out of the Blue Yoga. However, in order to make the greatest impact and create longevity for Out of the Blue Yoga program and Yoga Harbor studio, we will need as much financial support as possible.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are not in a position to contribute financially, please consider using Indiegogo's share tools to share this campaign with your friends, family, neighbors and associates.  

 

THANK YOU!

story:
Elate Fitness is a new mobile app based fitness program that aims to help users boost their mental health by improving their physical fitness using a more personal approach.

We understand starting to exercise can he hard, and challenging to make it regular. We created Elate Fitness to show you exactly what to do.

Each exercise includes detailed written instructions, as well as demonstration videos. All designed to do them at home without having to go to a gym or utilize any specialized equipment.

We help hold you accountable. You have direct messaging with us the entire time, and we monitor what you enter in the app and provide suggestions and timely encouragement.

Our goal is to allow anyone wanting to improve their physical & mental health the ability to do so easily.

Help us reach our goal so we can help more people on their wellness journey.

What makes starting so hard?

We work with you to get you more active and overcome those barriers.

Introducing our Inclusive Plan:

An at-home body weight program for a generally healthy person.

Designed by a Clinical Exercise Physiologist & Kinesiologist to help you get moving and understanding the benefits of physical and mental health.

We have put together the most supportive features and give you:

  • Ongoing Support & Accountability to help keep you accountable.
  • Access to the App with so many awesome features.
  • Direct Messaging with us anytime. 
  • Instructional Videos of every exercise so you know you're doing it right.
  • Programmed Workouts to follow built specific for your physical and mental health.
  • Workout & Progress Tracking Features to stay motivated.

The best part? You get all of this for less than $2.60 per day! 

We understand affordability is important so we made our program for the entire month the same cost as a single personal training session.

We're even offering 20-30% off that just for signing up early!

What does it take?

  • 3 workouts per week (taking just 20-45 minutes each)
  • 3 times per week of general physical activity (completing our cardio exercises, walking, playing a sport, or anything you do that is active)

We’ve designed this as a monthly subscription so there is no large upfront cost, allowing you to get started faster, continue month to month without a contract, and cancel at any time.

AND if you ever need a break or don’t need our full support.

You can downgrade to our Maintenance Plan at a very low monthly cost of $17.99, and have continued access to the app with your current workouts. 

"He has taught me things I will carry with me for the rest of my life and was always there encouraging and supporting me every step of the way! I truly enjoy how easy the Elate Fitness app is and I felt that was a huge key to my success." - Janessa M

Physical health has a huge positive impact on mental health.

Good physical health is so important and often overlooked.

Elate Fitness gets you moving and living a better, healthier life in 3 ways:

We're with you the whole way along with check ins and direct messaging, so our expert advice is always just a text away. 

Exercise increases and balances hormones & chemicals in your body that literally make you:

  • Feel good 
  • Stress less 
  • Manage anxiety
  • Lower depression 
  • Improve your quality of life

Compared with other fitness services:

Unfortunately most programs focus on physical appearance over physical & mental well-being.

"Exactly what I was looking for.  Following the plans are easy, using the app that he provides. Everything is well explained and great for tracking your progress." - Jesse B

Why are we doing this?

1 in 5 of us will struggle with a mental health challenge in our lifetime.

Physical activity is proven to help manage depression.

Doctors, counselors, and psychologists directly recommend it.

​So why doesn’t everyone exercise? That is why Elate Fitness was created.

My name is Corbin Bednarik, I am a Clinical Exercise Physiologist, Practicing Kinesiologist, & High Performance Specialist.

What’s the problem?

Health professionals will recommend exercise to help improve your health.

Then you are often left on your own to figure out how.

  • Do you join a gym?
  • Do you pay for a personal trainer?
  • Do you follow the free programs online?

If you can do any of these, that is GREAT! Unfortunately, most won’t and increasing physical activity stops there.

What is our mission?

There is a disconnect between health professionals recommending exercise and people doing it.

Elate Fitness is somewhere for doctors, counselors, psychologists, other healthcare professionals, and you, to direct friends and clients to when recommending exercise.

Done through Education, Online Exercise Programs, and Accountability. 

Making you not only much more likely to get in the habit of exercising, but enjoy it too.

 

"I am stronger both mentally and physically and I owe that to Corbin and his comprehensive training program." - Shaina K

We really need your help getting started.

We need your support to bring this to life. 

A small donation will help us get started so much faster. Aside from funding, we need help with awareness. You can show support just by telling your friends and sharing on your social media, especially with anyone you feel would benefit from this.

Help us help people like you on their journey to improved mental well-being.

(us working hard recording exercises)

What is your reward for helping us get started?

To show our thanks we are offering discounts..

Plus anyone who supports us will receive exclusive offers in the future (a.k.a. forever) and lifetime discounts.

It’s time to reduce barriers to exercise.

 

Stay in the loop: Sign up for updates

Founder:

View the rest of my team here.

Testimonials

(from our personalized program) 

"My life has been turned around for the better. All I had to do was get the courage to ask for help." - Steve L

"I am stronger both mentally and physically and I owe that to Corbin and his comprehensive training program." - Shaina K

"Exactly what I was looking for.  Following the plans are easy, using the app that he provides. Everything is well explained and great for tracking your progress." - Jesse B

"He has taught me things I will carry with me for the rest of my life and was always there encouraging and supporting me every step of the way! I truly enjoy how easy the Elate Fitness app is and I felt that was a huge key to my success." - Janessa M

For more testimonials click here.

 

Have a question? Reach out!

story:
Cancer has been a part of our lives for so long, I don't remember anything else.

Hello my dear friends. That's a picture of my Mom and I last year around this time. My Name is Wayne Colig. I am the youngest of two Boys born to Patricia Colig (Patty) and my Dad - Miro Colig, who died when I was 15 years old. My older Brother (of 2 years) Sean, lives quite far away in Vancouver.
I'm 34 Years old and and I have been taking care of my Mom for many years. I was 11 when My Mom and Dad first sat us down and explained that my Mom had Cancer, Stage 3 Cervical to be specific. At this point the Tumor was the size of a Orange. . I can't remember how I felt, I was so young and confused. But all I do remember thinking was "What would I ever do without her?".
 
She immediately had 32 Radiation treatments in Vancouver B.C, and I didn't miss a single treatment with her. Every day at 4pm the volunteer drivers would pick us up and take us on the long cummute from Burnaby to the Cancer Care Agency of British Columbia (CCABC). I was so scared and confused, I just wanted her to get through this. I remembered when they kept her in the hospital towards the end of her treatments - thinking I would never see her again and having a feeling of complete emptiness. Shortly after she completed her treatment, minor complications started not too long after. Although nothing serious enough to cause alarm.
 
It was one and a half years later in 1991 when my Family started falling apart. My parents seprarted and eventually I made the very hard decision to leave with my Mother and come back to Ontario, where we were from originally to start a new life. My Brother Sean, stayed with my Dad. I was - crushed and what was to come was possibly the worst thing that has ever happened to us. 
 
It wasn't long after we moved back to Ontario in 1992 that the Cancer had returned, She immediately became a patient of the Hamilton Regional Cancer Centre, Now called the Jurvinski Cancer Centre and Hospital because of the most gracious donations made by Margaret and Charles Jurvinski, two amazing Canadian philanthropists.  She has been going to this hospital now for 21 years. 
 
The Tumor had returned and it was aggresive she was given the option for 15 more Radiation treatments, for a grand total of 47. If we had known back then what this treatment would evetually do, I wonder if she would have looked into alternative routes? Sometimes the suffering caused from the treatment itself, though it does save lives, makes me wonder if buying time is worth the pain that is sure to hit you in the future. It breaks my heart. :(
 
Even though everything looked good, there was an evil lurking in my Mother that wanted to pick a fight with her over and over.... I hate this Disease!
 
1993 went by with little problems into 1994, when one day on June 16, 1994, we had received a phone call that My Dad had been in an accident and was in a Coma. He was still in B.C and my Mother had no Money to get us out there to see him. The next 5 days were excrutiating. If it wasn't for one Man:
 
Brad Rossin: Director of Marketing for Canada 3000 Airlines. "If you are out there, Thank you!"
 
This man is an Angel, and if anyone reading this knows who this may be, please pass the message on that I am eternally grateful for his gracious generosity and help. Bless his heart.
 
How my Mother was able to get a hold of Corporate is beyond me, But this Man got us on a Plane to Vanouver free of charge. It was a blessing, because no sooner did we land and get to The Royal Columbian Hospital in New Wesminster - My Dad had just passed away. We didn't even have a chance to say goodbye.
 
A piece of me died with him that day. I don't think I ever really recovered.
 
My Mom's Cancer returned in 1995 and after Chemo Cream, Chemotherapy and Laser to remove the diseased tissue, they finally decided to perform a Radical Hysterectomy. Even without a Uterus or Cervix, the Cancer just didn't want to give up and it decided to try again, but it was caught in time and killed with more lazer and Chemo Cream. I remember my Mother's Oncologist, Dr. Francois Moens stating once that it was a battle-ground in there. the next 10 years were calm but always stressfull. It was after 2005 that things started on a downward spiral.......
 
My freinds. I could probably write a Book. With 24 years of watching my Mother go through this day after day, month after month and year after year and Medical file nearly 10 thousand pages split into several binders......The conditions are endless. The Journey - exhausting. I wouldn't wish it upon any Woman. Or anybody for that matter.
 
It's the past 5 years that have been the hardest. The Radiation that saved  my Mother is now killing her. She is literally falling apart and rotting from the inside out. It's graphic. Her Bladder has literally disintegrated and everything in the plevic area is one gigantic hole. She lost her ability to use the restroom and now has a Colostomy and Nephrostomy tubes. She can barely walk these days and she is in constant agonizing pain.
 
I wish I could help her when she is in pain but the best I can do is give her her medications, make her a nice meal, make her laugh, watch a movie, run the household and make things as normal as possible, as abnormal as we all feel.
 
But then there is the hardest part. Just recently tests have discovered on an MRI that she has extensive Tumor, as they put it -  in the Pelvic Area. She didn't want to hear it. She ran out of the room. They told me it's about making her comfortable now. 
 
To add insult to injury, we just lost our precious little Girl, our Cat Maggie of 16 years to Breast Cancer less than two weeks ago, which has compounded and filled us with so much more grief.
 
 I have been a walking wreck. This thought, the constant thought of her not being with me one day is the hardest thing I have endured since losing my Dad. The thought of being alone scares me so badly. I have been so dependant upon my Mother over these years and she upon me. I have hope. But because of all of this. I have lost my Job because her care was more important to me. My Grandmother (Mum's Side) past away of Cancer in 2008 and  My Grandfather of Cancer is 2011. We have very little family left besides my Mother's Aunts, Eleanor and Marilyn who have been very wonderful in emotional support this past year. And my Mom's Sister, My Aunt Diane. Her support is minimal as she is dealing with some very difficult situations herself these days. Although the love is there, asking anyone for finanial support is just out of the question. Besides that, very little support from immediate family because there really isn't any left.
 
My Car, the one thing I depend upon to get my Mom to all of her appointments in Hamilton and Toronto is starting to fall apart and I can't afford to get the repairs needed. Her life insurance was cancelled because of default payments due to the fact that her Medical Supply expenses are so costly that we were left with nothing. No body will insure her now. And going back to work is not an option for me, which is just dreadful.
 
I just want, if "it" does happen, for my Mother to have a little diginity in death. To be sure that everything will be taken care of. She deserves that at least.  I pray everyday for a miracle. But seeing that she has had absolutely no quality of life for the past 2 years and practically has not left the house in a whole year while watching her get worse every month makes me believe that her battle is wearing her thin, Although I KNOW that she has a whole lot more fight in her. I'm so proud of her. And in retrospect, I wouldn't trade it for anything. Every moment of heartache, pain, suffering, poverty and loss. I wouldn't trade her if I was offered the Universe 
 
She is the best part of me. And when it's her time, Most of me will have gone with her. God help us.
 
Thank you for listening my freinds and thank you for your kind consideration, Your generosity and your kindness, We will be forvever in your debt. And you will forever be a part of our lives.
 
 
With all the strength and love I could possibly spare.
 
Sincerely
 
Wayne Colig
 
 
 
 

What my Mom Needs. 

Our vehicle is in need of nearly 4 Thousand dollars in repairs. I need to ensure that I have a working safe ride for her to make the treks to the Hamilton Jurivinski and Princess Margaret Hospitals in Toronto, which round trip are in the hundreds of Km's. 

Our vehicle is 9 years old and I have not always had the financial ability to keep the repairs up to date. I'm afraid of not being able to drive it at all soon. It's not sounding good at all these past few Months.

To clear My Mother's debts and ensure that Medical supplies will not be a hardship in the future and in these difficult times. With me not working, any extra will be a blessing. With her debts and and supplies, An extra 4 Thousand would ensure less worry and more focus on fighting to live.

The most imprtant thing and the part that I cry about every night as I try to sleep is not being able to pay for a proper funeral for My Mother. Funerals can run upwards of $10,000 dollars these days and we just don't have anything like that. This scares me the most. I haven't slept in 2 months since the most recent diagnosis. I have frightening visions of her being put in a plywood box and and not being able to ensure a proper service for her. I feel terrible that I have not been on top of this from the beginning, but truth be told - I always believed that she would be with me for a lot longer than this. And I never imagined that things would be this bad this fast.

My Brother Sean. He is really the only family I will have left. And All I want is for him to get out here to see and spend some time with me and Mom. But 4000km separating us and his financial situation is making this impossible. My Mom needs him more than ever right now and I want to bring him home to Ontario to stay with us for a while. Our family is not complete without him.

My Mom has never ever been on a real vacation and one thing she has always wanted to do was go away somewhere. She loves David Letterman, so I thought about taking her to see a show, but she has always talked about seeing Venice. I know Venice would more than likely be too hard on her, so New York City and Letterman would be a dream come true for her.

You can help make this happen. 

Please. Please help us.

 Whatever you can spare would change our lives forever and for the better.

It's hard to find Joy where there is so much pain and suffering all around you.

I have never asked anyone for anything and asking now is the hardest thing I have ever done in my life. It's humbling and embarassing. But we are desperate for your help.

I'm just a regular guy who has had a tumultuous life. though, through it all I have kept my head together and have tried to do for others as much as I could. I'm not perfect. I have screwed up so many times in my life and learning the first time has always been a task, but I'm honest and caring. I would gladly give up everything if it meant my Mother would be okay. I love her so much that I would rather die before her bcause the thought of watching her go is something that tears me apart every day. I don't want to see her die and I don't want be an adult orphan. 

I love my Mummy so much. So I'm doing this for her.

We don't have much to offer. We have no perks or gifts to give. But what you will recieve is the love and respect from us until the end of time.

What I can offer is if you'd like to request my Mother as a freind on Facebook. She doesn't go on much these days but we both browse and update regularely.

Feel free to add her as your freind and ask questions any or message her anytime.

Patty Colig from Brantford, Ontario.

 

Please pray for us.

Please - include my Mom and I in your prayers. I think - if anything I would rather have a miracle than Money. But peace of mind would be a good thing also these days.And please share this with your freinds and family. If you have someone you know would be willing to consider us in their thoughts and prayers or a donation....Words could not express my gratitude. I know there is so much suffering in the World, but if you could help just one today. Please consider us. Once again.

 

With Love 

 

Wayne and Patty Colig. :) <3
story_txt:
Cancer has been a part of our lives for so long, I don't remember anything else.
Hello my dear friends. That's a picture of my Mom and I last year around this time. My Name is Wayne Colig. I am the youngest of two Boys born to Patricia Colig (Patty) and my Dad - Miro Colig, who died when I was 15 years old. My older Brother (of 2 years) Sean, lives quite far away in Vancouver.
I'm 34 Years old and and I have been taking care of my Mom for many years. I was 11 when My Mom and Dad first sat us down and explained that my Mom had Cancer, Stage 3 Cervical to be specific. At this point the Tumor was the size of a Orange. . I can't remember how I felt, I was so young and confused. But all I do remember thinking was "What would I ever do without her?".
 
She immediately had 32 Radiation treatments in Vancouver B.C, and I didn't miss a single treatment with her. Every day at 4pm the volunteer drivers would pick us up and take us on the long cummute from Burnaby to the Cancer Care Agency of British Columbia (CCABC). I was so scared and confused, I just wanted her to get through this. I remembered when they kept her in the hospital towards the end of her treatments - thinking I would never see her again and having a feeling of complete emptiness. Shortly after she completed her treatment, minor complications started not too long after. Although nothing serious enough to cause alarm.
 
It was one and a half years later in 1991 when my Family started falling apart. My parents seprarted and eventually I made the very hard decision to leave with my Mother and come back to Ontario, where we were from originally to start a new life. My Brother Sean, stayed with my Dad. I was - crushed and what was to come was possibly the worst thing that has ever happened to us. 
 
It wasn't long after we moved back to Ontario in 1992 that the Cancer had returned, She immediately became a patient of the Hamilton Regional Cancer Centre, Now called the Jurvinski Cancer Centre and Hospital because of the most gracious donations made by Margaret and Charles Jurvinski, two amazing Canadian philanthropists.  She has been going to this hospital now for 21 years. 
 
The Tumor had returned and it was aggresive she was given the option for 15 more Radiation treatments, for a grand total of 47. If we had known back then what this treatment would evetually do, I wonder if she would have looked into alternative routes? Sometimes the suffering caused from the treatment itself, though it does save lives, makes me wonder if buying time is worth the pain that is sure to hit you in the future. It breaks my heart. :(
 
Even though everything looked good, there was an evil lurking in my Mother that wanted to pick a fight with her over and over.... I hate this Disease!
 
1993 went by with little problems into 1994, when one day on June 16, 1994, we had received a phone call that My Dad had been in an accident and was in a Coma. He was still in B.C and my Mother had no Money to get us out there to see him. The next 5 days were excrutiating. If it wasn't for one Man:
 
Brad Rossin: Director of Marketing for Canada 3000 Airlines. "If you are out there, Thank you!"
 
This man is an Angel, and if anyone reading this knows who this may be, please pass the message on that I am eternally grateful for his gracious generosity and help. Bless his heart.
 
How my Mother was able to get a hold of Corporate is beyond me, But this Man got us on a Plane to Vanouver free of charge. It was a blessing, because no sooner did we land and get to The Royal Columbian Hospital in New Wesminster - My Dad had just passed away. We didn't even have a chance to say goodbye.
 
A piece of me died with him that day. I don't think I ever really recovered.

It was after 2005 that things started on a downward spiral.......
 
My freinds. I could probably write a Book. The Journey - exhausting. I wouldn't wish it upon any Woman. Or anybody for that matter.

Besides that, very little support from immediate family because there really isn't any left.

story:
Help us bring our Dad home

Roberto Alveo, missionary and pastor for over 30 years throughout Panamá, Dominican Republic and Puerto Rico, friend of many, and always remembered as someone who constantly was helping and serving others. Last year, on July 4th, 2012, just one day before returning home to Houston, Texas from visiting family in Panamá, our dad had a massive stroke that has left him paralyzed due to the brain damage.

What this money will cover

Our goal is to raise $9,000 to bring our dad home where he will have a better opportunity to recover alongside his children and grandchildren. With this money, we will contract Medical Life Flight, to transport our dad from Panama to Houston, TX. This is the cost of his flight and the transportation for the medical and technical personnel who will monitor his vitals, administer any medications, and will assure his safe return home. 
 
$9,000 is just the base cost to cover his flight home. Any other monies collected will go towards his medical expenses, therapies and equipment needed to make his daily routine easier. Every small amount counts and is much appreciated. All donors will receive monthly updates on his progress.
 
Thank you,
Kristian, Jair, Karen and Maryann "Roxy" Alveo
 

Ayúdanos a traer a nuestro Padre a casa

Roberto Alveo, misionero y pastor por los pasados 30 años en Panamá, República Dominicana y Puerto Rico, amigo de muchos y siempre recordado como alguien que siempre ayudaba y servia a otros. El 4 de julio del 2012, estando de visita a la familia en Panamá y a solo un día de regresar a su casa en Houston, Texas, nuestro papá sufrió una serie de infartos cerebrales masivos que lo dejaron en estado de parálisis debido al daño cerebral causado por los mismos.

¿Qué cubrirá este dinero?

Nuestra meta es recoger $9,000 para traer a nuestro papá a casa en donde tendrá una mejor oportunidad de rehabilitarse junto a sus nietos e hijos. Con éste dinero, vamos a contratar a "Medical Life Flight", para transportarlo desde Panamá a Houston, TX. Éste es el costo del vuelo y del personal técnico y médico que van a monitorear sus vitales, administrar medicamentos y asegurarse de traerlo de una manera segura.
 
$9,000 solo es el costo de su transportación. Cualquier otros dinero que se colecte irá directamente a cubrir sus gastos médicos, terapias y equipos para hacer su rutina diaria un poco más fácil. Cada pequeña donación cuenta y es muy apreciada. Todos los donantes van a recibir reportes mensuales de su progreso.
 
Gracias,
Kristian, Jair, Karen and Maryann "Roxy" Alveo

story:
Who We Are and What We're Trying to Do

Safe Gun Technology is developing unique gun safety technology using biometric fingerprint recognition to prevent unauthorized users from firing your gun. No this is not out of a spy movie, this is very real. Bottom line, SGTi technology will reduce gun violence across the United States.

Pitch in today, and help Fund Safe Guns! 

Safe Gun Technology, Inc. (SGTi), was founded in Columbus, Georgia by a group of individuals from all walks of life, who are dedicated to making guns safer and reducing gun violence through technology. In 2008, we successfully built a functioning prototype with SGTi technology. The original prototype was built by retrofitting SGTi technology on to a Remington 870 shotgun, but now, we need your help to develop a market ready prototype of SGTi technology on an assault style rifle.

SGTi Technology

SGTi is developing proprietary technology that is fully self-contained requiring no external devices. SGTi technology includes mechanisms which, if tampered with, would render the firearm useless.  SGTi’s goal is to make this technology functional on all types of firearms ranging from an AR-15 to a 1911 handgun.

What We Need

We need to raise $50,000 to retrofit a gun and build a market ready prototype of SGTi technology on an assault style rifle.  Any money raised will be solely dedicated to our engineering team who are experts in the field.  The SGTi engineering team will then use the money on the research and development, and refinement of the market ready prototype.

SGTi backers will have the option of receiving a perk reward as a gesture of our sincere gratitude and appreciation. Perk rewards include recognition as a supporter on the SGTi website (you can remain anonymous if you want to), subscription to the SGTi e-newsletter, SGTi-branded bumper stickers, notepads & pens, t-shirt & polo shirts, as well as exclusive access to the latest SGTi product demos and advance notification of SGTi product launches.

Our Passion and Determination

Moved by the tragedy at Columbine 14 years ago, Kenneth Collins, a construction worker and resident of Phenix City, Alabama, was determined to follow through and turn his prior gun safety ideas into action. With some assistance, he developed a "smart" gun technology system for firearms. Ken filed his patent on April 22, 1999, just two days after the Columbine  tragedy.

An avid gun owner, Ken has been trying to develop viable gun safety technology for the past 15 years. Along the way, he's brought a team of dedicated people from diverse backgrounds on board who all share his desire to improve gun safety. What started as one person in the late '90s has now become an unprecedented social enterprise intent on making a positive impact.

We believe that there are many other people across the country just like Ken.  People who support and respect the 2nd Amendment right to bear arms but who also believe that this right comes with a responsibility.  People who are sickened every time an innocent human being is killed as a result of a senseless gun tragedy.  

These are the words we live by: "If we save the life of one child then it is a miracle to that child and to everyone whose life is touched by that child."

PLEASE PITCH IN TODAY TO HELP MAKE GUNS SAFER! WITH YOUR COLLECTIVE HELP, SGTi WILL BE ABLE TO EXPEDITE MARKET ENTRY OF OUR PROPRIETARY GUN SAFETY TECHNOLOGY. 

If you support what we are doing but are unable to contribute at this time, you can still help us by spreading the word about our campaign.  Don't forget to use the Indiegogo share tools. 

SGTi In the News

  • NBC 4 Los Angeles - July 10, 2013
  • KSL Salt Lake - July 10, 2013
  • WCSH6 Portland, Maine - July 10, 2013
  • 22WWLP Western Massachusetts - July 10, 2013
  • KDFX Wichita Falls, TX - July 10, 2013
  • KDSK St. Louis - July 10, 2013
  • www.myhighplains.com - July 10,2013
  • 41NBC Macon - July 8, 2013
  • WTVM - June 21, 2013
  • NBC Bay Area - June 17, 2013
  • Boston Globe - May 18, 2013
  • SecureID News - May 9, 2013 
  • SmartPlanet - April 30, 2013
  • Computerworld - April 29, 2013 

SAFE GUN TECHNOLOGY, INC. IS A FOR-PROFIT COMPANY INCORPORATED IN THE STATE OF GEORGIA.  YOUR CONTRIBUTIONS ARE NOT TAX-DEDUCTIBLE AND ARE SOLELY REWARDS-BASED.  SAFE GUN TECHNOLOGY, INC. IS NOT OFFERING ANY EQUITY IN RETURN FOR YOUR CROWDFUNDING CONTRIBUTION.

What We Need
We need to raise $50,000 to retrofit a gun and build a market ready prototype of SGTi technology on an assault style rifle.  Any money raised will be solely dedicated to our engineering team who are experts in the field.  The SGTi engineering team will then use the money on the research and development, and refinement of the market ready prototype.
SGTi backers will have the option of receiving a perk reward as a gesture of our sincere gratitude and appreciation. Perk rewards include recognition as a supporter on the SGTi website (you can remain anonymous if you want to), subscription to the SGTi e-newsletter, SGTi-branded bumper stickers, notepads & pens, t-shirt & polo shirts, as well as exclusive access to the latest SGTi product demos and advance notification of SGTi product launches.
Our Passion and Determination
Moved by the tragedy at Columbine 14 years ago, Kenneth Collins, a construction worker and resident of Phenix City, Alabama, was determined to follow through and turn his prior gun safety ideas into action. With some assistance, he developed a "smart" gun technology system for firearms. Ken filed his patent on April 22, 1999, just two days after the Columbine  tragedy.
An avid gun owner, Ken has been trying to develop viable gun safety technology for the past 15 years. Along the way, he's brought a team of dedicated people from diverse backgrounds on board who all share his desire to improve gun safety. What started as one person in the late '90s has now become an unprecedented social enterprise intent on making a positive impact.
We believe that there are many other people across the country just like Ken.  People who support and respect the 2nd Amendment right to bear arms but who also believe that this right comes with a responsibility.  People who are sickened every time an innocent human being is killed as a result of a senseless gun tragedy.  
These are the words we live by: "If we save the life of one child then it is a miracle to that child and to everyone whose life is touched by that child."
PLEASE PITCH IN TODAY TO HELP MAKE GUNS SAFER! WITH YOUR COLLECTIVE HELP, SGTi WILL BE ABLE TO EXPEDITE MARKET ENTRY OF OUR PROPRIETARY GUN SAFETY TECHNOLOGY. 
If you support what we are doing but are unable to contribute at this time, you can still help us by spreading the word about our campaign.  Don't forget to use the Indiegogo share tools. 
SGTi In the News


NBC 4 Los Angeles - July 10, 2013

KSL Salt Lake - July 10, 2013

WCSH6 Portland, Maine - July 10, 2013

22WWLP Western Massachusetts - July 10, 2013

KDFX Wichita Falls, TX - July 10, 2013

KDSK St. Louis - July 10, 2013

www.myhighplains.com - July 10,2013

41NBC Macon - July 8, 2013

WTVM - June 21, 2013

NBC Bay Area - June 17, 2013

Boston Globe - May 18, 2013

SecureID News - May 9, 2013 

SmartPlanet - April 30, 2013

Computerworld - April 29, 2013 

SAFE GUN TECHNOLOGY, INC. IS A FOR-PROFIT COMPANY INCORPORATED IN THE STATE OF GEORGIA.  YOUR CONTRIBUTIONS ARE NOT TAX-DEDUCTIBLE AND ARE SOLELY REWARDS-BASED.  SAFE GUN TECHNOLOGY, INC. IS NOT OFFERING ANY EQUITY IN RETURN FOR YOUR CROWDFUNDING CONTRIBUTION.

story:
Check out our new campaign for Vitastiq 2 



As seen on:

Do you know which vitamin or mineral your body needs?

We know vitamins and minerals are essential to life. Our bodies need them to function, but do we know which vitamin or mineral we have enough of and which we do not?

To answer this question we developed Vitastiq! 

You can measure the status of the 30 most important vitamins and minerals. Vitastiq will determine whether your vitamin and mineral levels are too low, too high or just right.

Caring for ourselves just became easier:

  • Self-exam anytime, anywhere
  • Detailed instructions for quick and easy measurement
  • Non-invasive, painless method
  • Cable-connection to secure instant feedback
  • Modern device made from quality, durable materials
  • User-friendly application
  • Perfect size for a firm grip
  • No age limits

Gives insight, gives advice

Vitastiq provides insight into vitamin and mineral levels and individual advice on how to improve your vitality with the right choice of nutrients. This way you can react promptly and take the necessary steps to preserve your well-being. As this device saves and evaluates previous measurements, you can keep track of your progress.

Vitastiq mobile app

The Vitastiq device works with the Vitastiq mobile app. We have developed the iOS version and we will launch the Android version of Vitastiq app in April 2015! 

How to use Vitastiq

1. Download the free Vitastiq app.

Create your profile, choose or make your personal vitamin and mineral template, track and evaluate.

2. Connect your Vitastiq device to your smartphone's audio port.

3. Set up your profile.

You can set up more than one profile if a friend or family member wishes to try it out.

4. Prepare for measuring.

For optimal measurement, clean the measuring points with rubbing alcohol.

5. Start measuring.

Determine the reference point and then measure vitamin by vitamin, mineral by mineral, touching the relevant points as shown on the screen.

User-friendly in-app tutorial will make it easy to find all the points needed for measuring.

Traditional knowledge meets modern technology

So, what's the trick? There isn't one – just a synergy between traditional knowledge and modern technology. A thousand years of acupuncture knowledge proves that acupuncture points differ from the surrounding skin. In terms of electrical current, there is an increased conductance and decreased resistance at these points. Vitastiq is based on the EAV methodology that was tested and proved by a team of medical doctors headed by Dr. Reinhard Voll.


Hand measuring points

Foot measuring points

Body measuring points

The evolution of traditional knowledge

Vitastiq is a single innovative concept that connects EAV methodology to your smartphone. Expensive tests and specialist check-ups are not needed anymore.

One of the traditional EAV devices used by a specialist.

One of the traditional EAV devices used in pharmacies.

Our story

We are a group of friends working together in an advertising agency. After years of working on successful, diverse projects for other companies' brands and products, we decided to create a product of our own. And not just an ordinary product: a product that could benefit our own healthy lifestyle. That's why we created Vitastiq – a simple and smart product that can really change your life while making it easier.

Why we need you

After two years of continuous work on the development of the Vitastiq device and smartphone iOS app, we need to bring our product into the next phase. The tools needed for the mass production and development of Android software have proven a considerable financial obstacle.

Our goal is to make Vitastiq available to everyone.

We hope you will recognize the potential of this product and back our project by helping us turn an idea into a reality. Together, let’s make Vitastiq available to everyone!

Budget calculation

  • Android software development: $12,000
  • Tool production to enable mass production: $37,000
  • Total: $49,000

Timeline


Heroes

Dean Vranić
Idea creation, boosting the growth and development of the idea

Damir Ciglar
Project leadership, vital nutrient of the project

Vlatko Đikić
Product development, important for project vitality

Irena Lešković
Project management, vital spark of the project

Dina Dretvić
Brand & Strategy, strategically attacking the weak points

Vanja Osredečki
Business management, essential for the increase of project efficacy

Elica Šuša
Finance & Legal affairs management, protection from legal trouble and budget increases

Igor Mladinović
Marketing & Communications, contributing to communication effectiveness

Ana Burazer
Communication, responsible for boosting verbal vitality

Saša Perić
Graphic Design & Photography, accountable for beauty and physical appearance

Željko Glavor
Software & Design, important for internal functioning of the project

Hrvoje Hrvatin
Online media, provides adequate dosage of digital

Ivis Burić
Public Relations, makes every conversation healthy

Selena Petrović
Business advice, enhancing business and management

Thank you for your Support!

You can expect transparency and direct communication from us all the way. All 14 members of the team give you their word that everything will be implemented as promised. We have big plans with this product. This is just the beginning!

Your Vitastiq team

Check out our new campaign for Vitastiq 2 


Disclaimer: App Store, iPhone, Android and iOS are the trademarks of third parties.
Vitastiq Inc. is not affiliated with, sponsored, licensed or associated with any of these third parties.

story:
About UMass Quidditch:

UMass Quidditch was founded in 2008 and has been a competitive Quidditch team in the IQA (now USQ) Northeast Region since our inception. We have been to World Cups IV,V,VI,and VII, and have shown the rest of the world what we are capable of. 
But most importantly, we are a bunch of college goofballs who just love to have fun and play a silly game :)
(look at that picture up top, aren't we beautiful?)

 

What We Need 

We need funds to subsidize our trip to Rochester, NY for Northeast Regionals in November 15th and 16th. These funds would be used for gas and for hotel expenses. Due to USQ's Stay and Play Policy we are required to go through USQ's travel agency Traveling Teams to purchase rooms instead of going about it ourselves. This results in an unfortunate hike in hotel prices that we need more money for. 

    What You Get

    That warm, tingly feeling you get inside from helping poor college kids achieve their dreams!

    And nice perks too, you will get nice perks too

story:
Fourth of July Special SHIPS NOW!

Only $35!!! 18oz The BOSS: Red, White and Blue Camo Fourth of July Special. ORDER NOW SHIPS NOW! USA $7 and Int'l $15! 

The World's First Foam Roller Water Bottle

A Blend Of Hydration And Innovation. MOBOT is an eco-friendly reusable foam roller water bottle, designed to help reduce plastic waste and provide a healthier, more convenient way to stay hydrated.


H2O - Water Is Life

Simply put, most people don't take in enough water on a day-to-day basis. Over time, failure to drink enough water can contribute to a wide array of medical complications, from fatigue, joint pain and weight gain to headaches, ulcers, high blood pressure and kidney disease. On the flip side, water can clear your skin, boost energy and improve mood.


You Are Designed To Feel Good

The human body was meant to move around. Long periods of inactivity can lead to serious health issues and limit range of motion. Let's face it, society is busier and more exhausted than ever, it’s time for a more convenient, healthier solution. 


It's Your World

Too much plastic! One of the most obvious impacts of plastic bottles is what happens after the water has been consumed. Considering that approximately        60 million plastic water bottles are used every day in the US, we can assume that nearly 18,834,000,000 end up in landfills each year. Each bottle can take up to 700 years to decompose. Where does it end?


A Solution To Benefit All

MOBOT 

The concept and design behind MOBOT, was to create products that help counter the effects of a busy, active lifestyle. Our mission is to keep you moving and hydrated, while helping reduce the negative impacts of plastic bottles on your health and the environment.  MOBOT's are made of recycled, FDA-approved stainless steel and designed to be endlessly reusable and extremely durable. Each MOBOT purchased will result in less plastic and less waste. Together we can help the planet.


A Simple Reminder

Bring it with you. The MOBOT is one toteable tool. No longer bound to the gym or therapists office, a massage session and a refreshing sip of water can be accessed virtually anywhere. Keeping the MOBOT by your side will serve as a constant reminder to stay hydrated and keep your body nourished. Travel Karma!

                     


Rolling

Foam Rolling is a cure-all for many different aches. It can help improve posture and relaxation, increase circulation, lengthen and loosen muscles, relieve joint pain, break down knots and increase range of motion. The grooves on the MOBOT act as fingers and provide a deeper massage geared towards releasing trigger points.

" I didn't know I was tight until I tried the Mobot, now if I am rolling anyone can roll." - love Mum, 60 years young!


A Product For Everyone

Athletes

The MOBOT serves as the perfect compliment for any athlete. It's great for both pre and post workout and will help you combat those sore muscles after intense training sessions or while on the road, allowing for quicker recovery and increased performance come game day. 


Roll On Any Job

Whether you are on your feet or sit all day at work, we've got you covered. Bring your MOBOT with you and give your body a quick massage every few hours during your break. Keep it by your desk to help remind you to DRINK MORE WATER!! 


Children

Kids absolutely love the MOBOT.  With colors that really capture their attention, they want to stay hydrated and healthy. Make hydration one less thing to nag about. You're welcome!


Lifestyle 

The MOBOT promotes an active, mindful lifestyle.  Its unique and sleek design creates an avenue for health, wellness and convenience to come together in one aesthetically pleasing package. 

"The MOBOT was one of my top 3 essential tools while backpacking in Alaska" - Tommy Cassano


Join The "Movement"

Since our first release, November 2013, we have been on a roll and all from an airbnb garage, thanks to Anne and Dave! After a sell-out event and equipped with a pre-order list from all over the world and great customer feedback, we returned to R&D. In September 2014, MOBOT officially launched in the USA with a positive response from a wide array of businesses and athlete’s from sports including: surfing, rugby, volleyball, soccer, SUP, water polo, golf, gymnastics as well as chiropractors, trainers, first responders and military, flight attendants, dancers, schools and more! MOBOT has a unique characteristic in that it is not industry, age or gender specific. We are really excited to share MOBOT with you.


MOBOT Options

Sizes - 


Colors  - 


            (support@mobotnation.com will contact you to choose your colors)



Video Testimonials

 


Mobot Nation Rugby Supporters!

Love rugby? Well so do we! Get a limited edition MOBOT Nation Canterbury rugby jersey, Canterbury rugby ball and all 3 MOBOT sizes in Black (Adams Ale) 18oz/27oz/40oz. Jersey only available in Large or X-Large.


Your contributions

Throughout our campaign we will deliver with the highest standard of effort, honest and regular communication and a dedication to bring our product to you. You will help us make the 27oz MOBOT a reality sooner than we ever dreamed possible! Currently the 40oz and 18oz are on the market and have received great feedback, with much anticipation for the 27oz release. In an effort to cover manufacturing and tooling costs, retail and e-commerce packaging and add more designs and colors, we ask for your help, as your donations will directly go towards delivering the  27oz MOBOT to you! Reaching our initial goal of $12,000 dollars would be a true blessing. This would give us the ability to deliver our new size. Any amount above that, is icing on the cake and will enable us to provide the MOBOT Community with more products, accessories and colors, as well as fun, educational content and foam rolling classes. 

Testimonials


Timeline 


Packaging

         facebook.com/BayCitiesContainer         twitter.com/BayCitiesPak 

Meet the Team


FAQ

Q. How do I use my Mobot?

A. For in-depth instructions on the best way to use your MOBOT check out our MOBOT blog. But if you want the short answer: sip some water, close the lid tight, lie on top of your MOBOT, and start rolling out your body parts. We recommend your legs, upper back, arms, hips, and glutes. We do NOT recommend rolling on your head, lower back, or trying to stand on your MOBOT.

Q. Does It hurt to roll?

A. It all depends on your threshold for pain. We wouldn't say rolling tickles, but no pain, no gain right? Pressure is necessary for the MOBOT to do its job. If you're new to rolling, just adjust your pressure and build up slowly. Nothing worth doing is ever easy in the beginning, but trust us — it will not only get better, it will get great. You will start to experience changes all over your body and before you know it, you'll be downright craving a roll (and not the kind that comes with dinner).

Q. How often and long should I roll?

A. Our MOBOT blog has great tips for how to roll, but we believe you should roll every day for around 5-15 minutes. If you're an athlete, have injuries or other specific needs, or are just unsure, please ask your health care professional about tailoring a program specifically for you.

Q. Is the Mobot big enough for me?

A. Yes. It might seem too good to be true, but all of our MOBOTs are adaptable to human bodies of all shapes and sizes.

Q. I already have a foam roller, why should I get a Mobot?

A. Foam rollers are great, but can your foam roller also deliver hydration (the other crucial component to recovery) while fitting conveniently into your purse, gym bag, or man satchel?

Q. How do I clean my Mobot?

A. Like most other sports water bottles, a MOBOT has a wide mouth to make cleaning super easy. We recommend a small bottle brush and a good old-fashioned solution of diluted vinegar or water with a bit of baking soda.

Q. Can I use other beverages in my Mobot?

A. Of course. Although water is our fave and we recommend you always use your MOBOT for hydrating first, thanks to the high quality, food-grade stainless steel, you can put juices, shakes, or even booze (heyo!) in your MOBOT. Just make sure you clean it thoroughly afterwards and do NOT roll under the influence.

Q. Can I put my Mobot in the freezer?

A. Please don't put your MOBOT in the freezer. Liquids expand when they freeze, which could deform or break your MOBOT. Freezing damage is not covered by the one-year warranty. If you like your drink cold, add ice.

Q. Can I microwave it?

A. Dear God, no! Never put anything metal in the microwave.

Q. Can I put it in the dishwasher?

A. No. When you need to clean, we recommend scrubbing out the inside with a bottle brush and patting down the outside with a wet towel. You can soak your lids if extra TLC is needed.

Q. Is the foam removeable?

A. No. One of the standout qualities of a MOBOT is that our foam is heat-pressed directly onto the steel, guaranteeing better performance and insulation.

Q. How much does my Mobot weigh?

A. A 40oz/1.2 L MOBOT weighs just under 2lbs when full. A 18oz/0.5 L MOBOT weighs just under 1lbs when full— but if you're staying hydrated, it’s never full for too long!

Q. How much weight can my Mobot hold?

A. We've successfully tested up to 300+ Lbs.

Q. Will it rust?

A. Nope. If you see any discoloration, just give your MOBOT a good clean with a bottle brush. If you have more questions, let us know at support@mobotnation.com.

Q. What if it dents?

A. MOBOTs are constructed of heavy-gauge #304 (18/8) stainless steel that has outperformed all other bottles in independent tests. BUT if you whale your MOBOT into the ground, a dent is possible. So like anything you own and care about, treat it nicely. Your one-year warranty covers manufacturer's defects only, not damage caused by use. If you do happen to dent your MOBOT, the bottle is still perfectly safe to use and will nearly always be functional unless it's one big-a$$ dent, and that we would like to see!

Q. Where is my Mobot made?

A. Our company is based in Venice, CA, and our MOBOTs are handcrafted in Taiwan. All our factories are ISO approved. We pride ourselves on having the highest standards in the industry when it comes to quality, materials, and happy, healthy team members — no matter where in the world, they are MOBOT family. We visit all our locations regularly to make sure these standards are not only being met, but exceeded.

Q. Will it wear out?

A. MOBOTs are made to last a long, looooong time and endure an incredible amount of use. But if you're really rolling like a rock star your MOBOT could lose a bit of its original luster. In this case we recommend you do your body a favor and get yourself another one!

SUP, water polo, golf, gymnastics as well as chiropractors, trainers,
first responders and military, flight attendants, dancers, schools and
more! MOBOT has a unique characteristic in that it is not industry, age or
gender specific. We are really excited to share MOBOT with you.





MOBOT Options






Sizes - 





Colors  - 



            (support@mobotnation.com will contact you to choose your colors)




Video Testimonials


 





Mobot Nation Rugby Supporters!




Love rugby? Well so do we! Get a limited edition
MOBOT Nation Canterbury rugby jersey, Canterbury rugby ball and all 3 MOBOT
sizes in Black (Adams Ale) 18oz/27oz/40oz. Jersey only available in Large or
X-Large.


Your contributions







Throughout our campaign we will deliver with the highest standard of effort, honest and regular communication and a dedication to bring our product to you. You will help us make the 27oz MOBOT a reality sooner than we
ever dreamed possible! Currently the 40oz and 18oz are on the market and have
received great feedback, with much anticipation for the 27oz
release. In an effort to cover manufacturing and tooling costs, retail and
e-commerce packaging and add more designs and colors, we ask for your help, as your
donations will directly go towards delivering the  27oz MOBOT to
you! Reaching our initial goal of $12,000 dollars would be a true blessing.
This would give us the ability to deliver our new size. Any amount above
that, is icing on the cake and will enable us to provide the MOBOT Community
with more products, accessories and colors, as well as fun, educational content
and foam rolling classes. 








Testimonials














Timeline 


Packaging


         facebook.com/BayCitiesContainer         twitter.com/BayCitiesPak 

Meet the Team














FAQ
Q.
How do I use my Mobot?
A.
For in-depth instructions on the best way to use your MOBOT check out our MOBOT
blog. But if you want the short answer: sip some water, close the lid tight,
lie on top of your MOBOT, and start rolling out your body parts. We recommend
your legs, upper back, arms, hips, and glutes. We do NOT recommend rolling on
your head, lower back, or trying to stand on your MOBOT.
Q.
Does It hurt to roll?
A.
It all depends on your threshold for pain. We wouldn't say rolling tickles, but
no pain, no gain right? Pressure is necessary for the MOBOT to do its job. If
you're new to rolling, just adjust your pressure and build up slowly. Nothing
worth doing is ever easy in the beginning, but trust us — it will not only get
better, it will get great. You will start to experience changes all over your
body and before you know it, you'll be downright craving a roll (and not the
kind that comes with dinner).
Q.
How often and long should I roll?
A.
Our MOBOT blog has great tips for how to roll, but we believe you should roll
every day for around 5-15 minutes. If you're an athlete, have injuries or other
specific needs, or are just unsure, please ask your health care professional
about tailoring a program specifically for you.
Q.
Is the Mobot big enough for me?
A.
Yes. It might seem too good to be true, but all of our MOBOTs are adaptable to
human bodies of all shapes and sizes.
Q.
I already have a foam roller, why should I get a Mobot?
A.
Foam rollers are great, but can your foam roller also deliver hydration (the
other crucial component to recovery) while fitting conveniently into your
purse, gym bag, or man satchel?
Q.
How do I clean my Mobot?
A.
Like most other sports water bottles, a MOBOT has a wide mouth to make cleaning
super easy. We recommend a small bottle brush and a good old-fashioned solution
of diluted vinegar or water with a bit of baking soda.
Q. Can
I use other beverages in my Mobot?


A.
Of course. Although water is our fave and we recommend you always use your
MOBOT for hydrating first, thanks to the high quality, food-grade stainless
steel, you can put juices, shakes, or even booze (heyo!) in your MOBOT. Just
make sure you clean it thoroughly afterwards and do NOT roll under the
influence.
Q.
Can I put my Mobot in the freezer?
A.
Please don't put your MOBOT in the freezer. Liquids expand when they freeze,
which could deform or break your MOBOT. Freezing damage is not covered by the
one-year warranty. If you like your drink cold, add ice.
Q.
Can I microwave it?
A.
Dear God, no! Never put anything metal in the microwave.
Q.
Can I put it in the dishwasher?
A.
No. When you need to clean, we recommend scrubbing out the inside with a bottle
brush and patting down the outside with a wet towel. You can soak your lids if
extra TLC is needed.
Q.
Is the foam removeable?
A.
No. One of the standout qualities of a MOBOT is that our foam is heat-pressed
directly onto the steel, guaranteeing better performance and insulation.
Q.
How much does my Mobot weigh?
A.
A 40oz/1.2 L MOBOT weighs just under 2lbs when full. A 18oz/0.5 L MOBOT weighs
just under 1lbs when full— but if you're staying hydrated, it’s never full for
too long!
Q.
How much weight can my Mobot hold?
A.
We've successfully tested up to 300+ Lbs.

Q.
Will it rust?
A.
Nope. If you see any discoloration, just give your MOBOT a good clean with a
bottle brush. If you have more questions, let us know at support@mobotnation.com.
Q.
What if it dents?
A.
MOBOTs are constructed of heavy-gauge #304 (18/8) stainless steel that has
outperformed all other bottles in independent tests. BUT if you whale your
MOBOT into the ground, a dent is possible. So like anything you own and care
about, treat it nicely. Your one-year warranty covers manufacturer's defects
only, not damage caused by use. If you do happen to dent your MOBOT, the bottle
is still perfectly safe to use and will nearly always be functional unless it's
one big-a$$ dent, and that we would like to see!
Q.
Where is my Mobot made?
A.
Our company is based in Venice, CA, and our MOBOTs are handcrafted in Taiwan.
All our factories are ISO approved. We pride ourselves on having the highest
standards in the industry when it comes to quality, materials, and happy,
healthy team members — no matter where in the world, they are MOBOT family. We
visit all our locations regularly to make sure these standards are not only
being met, but exceeded.
Q.
Will it wear out?
A.
MOBOTs are made to last a long, looooong time and endure an incredible amount
of use. But if you're really rolling like a rock star your MOBOT could lose a
bit of its original luster. In this case we recommend you do your body a favor
and get yourself another one!

story:
Who are the Innovators?

The majority of Detroit's Major League Quidditch players are current college students or recent graduates from the state of Michigan and Toledo. 

Being a young team, the travel, housing, and costs of missing work for MLQ Championship weekend are significant, and any bit of support helps.

Where will money raised be spent?

Any money donated to the team will be allocated as followed:

  • Money will first be used to cover the costs of three nights in hotels in Texas.
  • Secondly, funds will be used to help athletes of considerable monetary need finance travel to and from Texas. 
If we do not reach our goal of $1,500 to completely cover hotel costs, all money raised will go to such, with the rest being out of pocket for players, but will still alleviate a large financial burden.

The Importance of Championship Weekend

Having spent over three months working towards the championship, to not be able to go because of money is the worst possible end to a player's season. The value of sports and competition in a young persons life is undeniable and massive, which is why getting every player possible there is of the utmost importance to the team. And, in repayment to our friends, family, and fans who contribute we are offering awesome perks that can be appreciated by almost everyone. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Love Detroit, but can't afford to give, you can still help the team!

  • Sharing the campaign on any social media platforms is always appreciated!
  • Sharing the MLQ Facebook event will also help exposure for the team! https://www.facebook.com/events/207269522974426/

Thanks!

story:
OMNI PRO IS CUTTING EDGE

MEDICAL TECHNOLOGY.



MORE THAN $200 IN SAVINGS

FOR INDIEGOGO BUYERS.



Micro USB rechargeable.



Early Bird Special pricing starts at $225 per unit.



HMD is also offering a variety of other deals including a carry case,
a special perk that will send the Omni-Pro units to Project C.U.R.E.,
an organization that delivers medical devices to severely resource-limited
communities—making diagnosis and treatment possible, and a gift to pre-med students at COPE’s Pre-Med Scholar Program with UCLA.


Order today to ensure a piece of state-of-the-art medical technology in your hands at half the price before it hits the market.



READ ABOUT THE CREATOR.



 



Dr. William Hasbun, an internist and geriatrician in Mount Laurel, New Jersey developed the Omni-Pro. He has been in practice for over 40 years and is a former professor of medicine at Columbia University as well as University of Medicine and Dentistry of New Jersey.

“The reason we developed the Omni Pro is to address the health professional requirements for diagnostic devices. In addition, to provide an accurate and complete examination of the patient while increasing the examiner’s efficiency.”

HMD’s mission is to develop multi-functional medical devices that can be distributed to health professionals to enhance the future of diagnostic services. hmdmedical.com

story:
The ObiToner allows you to workout and tone your body in any setting.

It doesn’t matter whether you’re watching the big game, browsing reddit, on a road trip, or even laying down in bed. With the ObiToner you can always get a good workout in, anytime and anywhere.

People of all fitness levels (Beginner, Intermediate, Advanced):

Whether you are thinking about joining a gym or have already been working out for a long time, the ObiToner is the perfect device for you.

This video details how the ObiToner helped transform my life:


Those with limited mobility (injured, paralyzed, disabled, etc.):

  • Sculpt your upper body - The ObiToner is the only thing you need to give your entire upper body a great workout. You can perform over 50 exercises with it! 
  • Take it wherever you're going - The ObiToner weighs only four pounds, and comes with it’s own pouch. It’s super easy to take it anywhere you want to go. 
  • Great back support - The ObiToner supports your back while working out and makes you feel good. It’s hard not to have amazing posture when it’s on. 
  • Get fit anytime - The ObiToner is designed to be used in settings where people normally don’t think they can work out (on the couch, in bed, in the kitchen, etc.).

 Note: The ObiToner fits up to waist size 40. Past that it may not comfortably fit when strapped to your waist. Although, you'll still be able to do many different exercises with it (via sitting or stepping on the belt).

The ObiToner is a patent pending, comprehensive workout belt that allows you to tone your entire upper body. The belt utilizes resistant band technology to help you build muscle and shed fat.

The resistant bands make use of your body weight while the belt simultaneously supports your back and tones your stomach. 

On each side of the ObiToner there are five clip-on slots which allow you to adjust the part of the belt that the resistance bands clip-on to. This will enable you to attach the bands to the locations on the ObiToner where they feel the most resistant.

On each resistant band there are 3 notches you can use to adjust the length of the band, in order to better fit your arm length or to perform a specific exercise that requires the band to be either longer or shorter.

The ObiToner can be used in various positions ranging from:

  • Standing up with it strapped to your waist 
  • Standing up while you step on it 
  • Sitting down with it strapped to your waist 
  • Sitting on it 
  • Sitting down while you step on it 
  • Laying down with it strapped to your waist 
  • Laying down on it 

 Due to the many ways the ObiToner can be used, there are over 50 exercises you can preform with it. Check out the “Possible exercises” section below.

My results have been a combination of using the ObiToner on daily basis as well as going to the gym 1-2 days a week. 

The ObiToner can act as a gym replacement, however I found great usage in it being more of a supplement for me. Though, I’m certain that if your goal isn’t to put on tons of muscle, but rather to tone your body and make it more defined. The ObiToner can most definitely act as your primary source of working out.

For me, the ObiToner has had an incredible impact on my body. This is due to the fact that I was always using it whenever I was on the computer, bingeing a season of Breaking Bad, or even just waiting for some eggs to boil. Since it strapped to my waist, I’d take it all around the house during my daily routine. Hence, I was always periodically using it, sometimes without even realizing it. Seriously, it’s the most effective yet effortless workout tool I’ve ever used.  

I created the ObiToner with the intention to change the way people view working out. In today’s day and age, there is so much to do, see and experience. You can receive breaking world news, see updates on how your friends are doing, read the latest books, view breathtaking pictures, watch videos on nearly any topic and play any kind of game you can imagine, all while wearing pajamas and sitting on the couch. So, why shouldn’t you be able to workout as well?

My desire is to make people realize that getting and keeping in shape can be easier than they’ve ever previously thought. And that it doesn’t require an exorbitant amount of time and effort to accomplish, but rather they can get fit while doing anything else they’d normally be doing. 

I’m so dedicated to that desire, that I took a gap year and saved up all the money I made working, in order to manufacture the first 1000 ObiToners. Meaning that if you are one of the first 1000 backers you will be receiving yours around the time of estimated delivery. If you are not one of the first 1000, then it will take a month longer to get it to you. I know one of the most frustrating things is to back a project and not receive what you were promised. So be rest assured, I’ve got your back (and so will the ObiToner when it arrives). I’m on Kickstarter because I need your support to take the ObiToner further. I want to get it into the hands of even more people, to raise awareness that there is a new, and easy solution to working out and to help everyone, everywhere who is struggling to get fit.

Please consider backing the ObiToner! 

               Here is a sample of 15 exercises that are possible with the ObiToner.

By the time the ObiTone ships our website will be up and running. Our site will have detailed instruction videos available to educate backers on how to perform the numerous exercises possible with the ObiToner.

Don’t forget, once you receive your ObiToner and start using it consistently. You’ll begin to start acquiring amazing physical rewards, better health and a toned body!

We began to work on the ObiToner back in 2013. We received a provisional patent, and recently applied for it's non-provisional patent, which is currently pending. 

This is what the belt looked like when we first started: 

 Here are a few of the comprehensive sketches we sent to our manufacturer in China, in order to create the various prototypes:

 Another material we used in the creation of the belt. In addition to, a few more sketches: 

 It took a long time and many different iterations: 

But, now it's finally here:

story:
Who are we? Michigan!

The Michigan Quidditch team began in the fall of 2010 and have been hooked since. We are a group of University of Michigan students and Alumni that share a love of Harry Potter. We have competed all over the Great Lakes region and this will be our fifth time attending the championship. This year's team, Team Five, has competed all over the Great Lakes region and brought home gold medals from this year's Great Lakes Regional tournament. We would love to continue the tradition of competing on the nationals stage. We appreciate any amount you can give! Let's show them who Michigan Quidditch is! Let's go blue! 

Past World Cup appearances:

  • World Cup V - New York City, New York
  • World Cup VI - Kissimmee, FL
  • World Cup VII - Myrtle Beach, SC
  • World Cup VIII - Rock Hill, SC

So here's the deal...

Transporting 22+ team members from Ann Arbor, Michigan to South Carolina is pricey, and we need your help to get there! We love traveling to the championship every year, and we love making our Michigan name proud! Help Michigan Quidditch get to US Quidditch Cup 9 in Columbia.

The Impact

We look forward to our annual trip to the championship all year long. It is not only a great time to spend with the rest of the players on the team, but we get to meet so many other students from other colleges around the country (and around the world)! We gain incredibly important teamwork and leadership skills as we improve in the sport that we have all grown to love.

Being in College is hard! 

As a group solely made up of college students, it can be quite difficult to commit to this sort of trip. We want our players on our Nationals roster to feel ready to play their best at the Cup without worries of financial crisis. These donations will be helping our team to succeed in our sport. 

Other Ways You Can Help

We know not everyone can contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help out!

  • Please share our page with other people and groups! Spreading the word helps us tremendously! 
  • Visit our Facebook, Twitter, and Instagram pages to continue supporting our team!
  • Check out our sweet merch store and stock up on your MQ gear!
