story:
Our mission is to inspire people to care about their health through discovering their bodies. We want our product to provide the solution in becoming better, healthier versions of themselves. Together, we can achieve this goal.

 

Layzzzy is a mat with properties based on acupressure, which is known practice dating over 7 thousand years. According to Eastern medicine, our health is based on a balanced energy flow and disturbances in this flow are the root cause of various illnesses. Layzzzy's design is based on the trigger point concept from the 1940’s, created by the American doctor Janet Travell. This concept states that there are multiple points in the human body and by applying pressure to them, energy flow to corresponding organs is unlocked, thus reducing unwanted symptoms. During the process of designing Layzzzy, we came up with a body map which helped us to precisely allocate the cones (4000 of them) to put pressure on crucial points of the human body. This makes Layzzzy your private masseur, allowing you to conduct a full body therapy from the comfort of your home.

 

 

 

Be like a sloth - lie down - rest! You can use one or more mats depending on how much area of your body you want to 'relax'. Then link them with the Layzzzy Mini that you use for point pressure.

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 


...and this is how our mat is created. Working on the form in progress !

 

Introduce ourselves

We are a group of balanced and healthy lifestyle enthusiasts. Each one of us is different, but together we create one entity. Our goal from the beginning was very clear - to create a product that is both simple in use but complex in its purpose and benefits. This is how our journey really began:

Piotr, after working for years as a physiotherapist, created his first brand – Physioroll. He launched a production of eco-friendly training accessories produced in Poland. He observed both regular people as well as professional athletes and encountered many modern day problems and disabilities caused by stress, too many responsibilities, a stationary lifestyle and lack of time to regenerate. Piotr took into account these problems and came up with the idea to create something that is therapeutic, but portable and easy at the same time. He brought together a trusted group of specialists from different fields and together, looking for a cure and answer, they came up with the concept of Layzzzy – the only mat that not only has therapeutic values, but is also 100% recyclable.

Born from a shared passion to create something unique, from experience, from countless meetings, discussions, smiles, little arguments, big arguments, lots and lots of take out, and most importantly from the belief that it is worth to do things that you enjoy and invest in those things- it is good to be together, but even better to be Layzzzy together!

 

 

 

Risks and challenges

Unlike most Indiegogo projects, we've been working on Layzzzy for a year prior to the launch of this campaign. That means, there are still risks and challenges. Tax or handling fees: Layzzzy will not collect taxes or extra fees from our supporters. We will take precautions in ensuring the shipping items meet the targeted local policies, but the backer is responsible for any duties, handling fees, and/or VAT/GST/Sales tax. As the regulations vary from country to country, we advise customers to reach out to their local customs office for information about the duties and fees to be expected. Products: You should be aware, that there is a risk, that yellow dots mat could not meet our quality requirement after final production. In that case we provide you with basic mat in black colour. In addition, we would like to inform, that the shape of the spikes of our prototype (visible on the video and photos) may be little differ from the final product. * If you have any serious medical condition or disease, we recommend you consult your physician before using this product. The information provided is not intended to prevent, diagnose or treat any medical condition or disease. The information and advice given on the campaign is not intended to replace the services of a physician or a health care professional acting under a physician’s supervision, nor does it constitute a doctor-patient relationship. Warning: Before using Layzzzy consult your doctor if you have at least one of the following diseases or states - oncology; coagulation problems (haemophilia) or using anti-coagulants; epilepsy; substantial skin damage (severe eczema or psoriasis, singes) in the areas of use; pregnancy; fever or an acute illness; heart diseases; severe forms of various diseases; thrombophlebitis. Using Layzzzy does not cancel medical treatment.
story_txt: Our mission is to inspire people to care about their health through discovering their bodies. We want our product to provide the solution in becoming better, healthier versions of themselves. Together, we can achieve this goal. Layzzzy is a mat with properties based on acupressure, which is known practice dating over 7 thousand years. According to Eastern medicine, our health is based on a balanced energy flow and disturbances in this flow are the root cause of various illnesses. Layzzzy's design is based on the trigger point concept from the 1940’s, created by the American doctor Janet Travell. This concept states that there are multiple points in the human body and by applying pressure to them, energy flow to corresponding organs is unlocked, thus reducing unwanted symptoms. During the process of designing Layzzzy, we came up with a body map which helped us to precisely allocate the cones (4000 of them) to put pressure on crucial points of the human body. This makes Layzzzy your private masseur, allowing you to conduct a full body therapy from the comfort of your home.   Be like a sloth - lie down - rest! You can use one or more mats depending on how much area of your body you want to 'relax'. Then link them with the Layzzzy Mini that you use for point pressure.        ...and this is how our mat is created. Working on the form in progress ! Introduce ourselvesWe are a group of balanced and healthy lifestyle enthusiasts. Each one of us is different, but together we create one entity. Our goal from the beginning was very clear - to create a product that is both simple in use but complex in its purpose and benefits. This is how our journey really began:Piotr, after working for years as a physiotherapist, created his first brand – Physioroll. He launched a production of eco-friendly training accessories produced in Poland. He observed both regular people as well as professional athletes and encountered many modern day problems and disabilities caused by stress, too many responsibilities, a stationary lifestyle and lack of time to regenerate. Piotr took into account these problems and came up with the idea to create something that is therapeutic, but portable and easy at the same time. He brought together a trusted group of specialists from different fields and together, looking for a cure and answer, they came up with the concept of Layzzzy – the only mat that not only has therapeutic values, but is also 100% recyclable.Born from a shared passion to create something unique, from experience, from countless meetings, discussions, smiles, little arguments, big arguments, lots and lots of take out, and most importantly from the belief that it is worth to do things that you enjoy and invest in those things- it is good to be together, but even better to be Layzzzy together!   Risks and challengesUnlike most Indiegogo projects, we've been working on Layzzzy for a year prior to the launch of this campaign. The information and advice given on the campaign is not intended to replace the services of a physician or a health care professional acting under a physician’s supervision, nor does it constitute a doctor-patient relationship. Using Layzzzy does not cancel medical treatment.

story:
Horses have been my passion since I was a little girl and I`ve always enjoyed observing their strong bodies and beautiful mane. There was a horseclub near my home and whenever I had time, I ran there and watched people ride or helped in the stables.  I soon started riding myself as well and absolutely loved it from the first moment I sat on a horse. If you`re a rider yourself you probably understand what exactly I`m talking about  (sitting in the saddle, looking at your horse`s mane being blown by the wind &  a feeling of absolute freedom ).


Recently I discovered Natural Horsemanship, known also as horse whispering. It is basically communicating with horses based on natural equine behaviours, which is similar to the way horses communicate with each other in a herd.
It is an amazing approach, as it encourages keeping horses as naturally as possible, gaining their trust and love, training them naturally and riding without a bit and a saddle. 

I would really like to deepen my knowledge about natural horsemanship and hopefully someday train horses by myself and help other people with theirs as well. 
In order for me to do that I need a trainer to teach me more about it and of course a horse to practice on.  Before becoming a natural horsemanship instructor myself I also have to pass several exams and in the final stage, go to the United States for further training and a final exam. 

Luckily, I already found a wonderful trainer, who is willing to teach me and is even gonna let me borrow her horses in exchange for some work on her farm. But the only problem left are my funds, which are very limited as I`m still a student, so I won`t be able to pay for the expenses of training and travelling to United States all by myself.  

That`s why I`m asking you for some help in making my wish come true. Any kind of support will mean a lot to me and will be highly appreciated. If you cannot contribute financially, feel free to share my project on any social platform.


Thank you all very much :)

story: I, am one of twenty five children who fulfilled my dream of creating access to primary health care for the uninsured, under insured, homeless, and children whose parents had to choose between paying the cost of health care or having their basic needs go unmet. The late, Juretta Webb and i started the first African American owned and operated clinic of its kind in the USA, 11/03/80. I have seen more than 30,000 precious children as a Certified Pediatric Nurse Practitioner. My work with the homeless and disenfranchised must continue; the crowd-funding will allow me to continue my ministries to those who need my services in reaching those who are sick and shut in, providing food, clothing, etc for the homeless at Dignity Village and transportation to accomplish the continued ministries. I would rather wear out than rust out, thus-i have not retired from serving the poor, my community and my brothers and sisters in need. My story of being on the OPRAH show in 2000, as her "Use Your Life Award" winner can be seen when you Google my name, Mariah A. Taylor, and the title of Use Your Life Award winner. I would be grateful for any help given, as i have for the past 16 years taken money out of pocket, and now out of my very limited income. God bless you and thank each of you who believe that i am my brothers keeper.

story:
Amaryllo International, Inc.  

Proudly Presents

Meet iCamPRO FHD, world’s first intelligent home security robot.

Unlike any other home security devices, iCamPRO is the first robotic home security camera that can actually see, hear, sense, and track moving objects, all while communicating with you. "In today's world of clever thieves and Industrial Saboteurs, the iCamPRO will record every movement in perfect detail so you can identify security threats or common thieves and protect your business and family," commented by David Rodwell, one of the campaign contributors. 


See Auto Tracking Demo Below


See Patent-Pending Ommidirectional Tracking

Pay attention to the black iCamPRO. It turns itself to where it detects an object even from behind, thanks to our multiple-sensor network embedded in the product to steer the camera in all directions.

Standing just over 3” tall and powered by a high-speed CPU with a patent-pending multi-sensor network, the iCamPRO is the smallest intelligent security robot that sees and tracks objects in real-time at your home or office, and even in a dimly lit environment.


Front View


Top View




Front View



Back View

Actual Size in Hand 


With multiple motion  sensors, no matter where the intruders appear in your home, iCamPRO can immediately rotate itself to capture the intruders in seconds. Real-time object tracking is an expensive technology that is available only in military or professional surveillance systems. Amaryllo is the first company to realize it with a compact design for your home or office at an affordable price.  

Our goal for this campaign is to collect invaluable feedback from those who are either experts or just enthusiasts about surveillance technology, as well as gain new ideas for how to make the iCamPRO more user friendly and attractive.


In return for your help, you will receive the finished product before it hits the market and at a price well below the retail value.

*Computer Rendering.  Packaging may differ slightly from the picture.  

Applications

Included in the box is an adjustable mount.  You can mount it on a flat surface, wall, or ceiling depending on your intended usage.  If you mount it on the ceiling, you can enable the 180° rotate feature in the app settings so you don't get an upside down view.  

Shown below is the custom-made brackets for iCamPRO FHD. Its compact design allows you to fit iCamPRO to wall or to ceiling. The bracket is made of high-quality material not only to fit the device well but also small enough to hide the bracket itself.

      

     

(ceiling mount)

                              (wall mount)                               



Full-HD Resolution

Using a 2 Megapixel lens serves two functions for the iCamPRO:
First, it allows for a crystal clear video stream and always FHD cloud recording.  
http://www.amaryllo.eu/n40822videodemo/


Second, the FHD lens and image sensor gives extremely accurate pixel calculation and therefore a more accurate motion analysis for tracking moving objects.The iCamPRO also features dynamic channel adjustment.  This means that as your WiFi bandwidth increases or decreases the camera will automatically downgrade or upgrade the video quality so that the stream will always be smooth and without any video or audio delay.

Below is a shot of our cameras viewing angle of 100° without any distortion in the picture.

Here's a shot of one of the competitor's HD cameras inside a small office (notice the strange curvature of their industry standard fish eye lens):

 
This is a quick demo taken from one of our prototypes, make sure to enable the highest quality on the YouTube player.

Intelligent Tracking System (ITS)


The iCamPRO is the very first affordable camera that can automatically track any moving object. Our algorithms teach the camera to always keep the object in the middle of the viewing area.  When an object begins to move away from the pixels in the middle of the viewing area, the camera will track the object until it's in the middle again.


What if 2 people are in the tracking area?

The algorithm is designed to follow the first object detected until it stops moving. 

Basically, the iCamPRO is using the lens and PIR motion sensors to constantly hunt for any moving object.

This is from the other side to see how far iCamPRO can track. In the video below, a walking person is over 30 feet (9 meters) away from iCamPRO.

Below is a tracking test in a very dimly lit room.  

*Please don't mind the motor noise as these are just prototypes.

Smart Sensor Network (SSN)

This was a late decision to implement, however a truly innovative idea that is one of a kind.  


We will have 3 PIR motion sensors placed strategically around the iCamPRO and if one of the sensors is triggered, the camera will turn to face the object, lock in, and begin to track it using the ITS.  

Unlike any other home security devices, this innovative design ensures no blind spots or dead zones for intruders to hide, and removes the need to install a multiple camera security system.

As you can see by the videos only some of our prototypes have the sensors.  That's because we just recently began testing it, but only after a short while we are sure that you are going to agree that it is a remarkable feature.

       


Built-in Intelligence


The iCamPRO FHD employs a high-speed CPU to encode 256-bit encryption, encipher Full HD video, track moving objects, conduct two-way audio, deliver picture alerts, upload recorded video, etc

It communicates with multiple sensors and compares picture frames one-by-one to detect the slightest movement in real time. This is not an easy task as iCamPRO is taking Full HD picture in each frame and grid each frame in many small blocks to compare their changes. .

iCamPRO’s multiple sensors are always on, and these sensors work together to continuously feed information to its CPU. They are like scouts detecting heat signature even in the dark!!

Traditional security devices' CPUs run at 100 MHz to 200 MHz because they use simple encryption, which does not require a big computation power. For some IP cameras employing a 56-bit encryption, it takes only 399 seconds to hack, which is less than 7 minutes. For 256-bit encryption, it may take a life time to break. Moreover, conventional IP cameras are unlikely to be firmware-upgradeable, meaning that what you buy will always be the same and the functionality will always be limited. 

For the iCamPRO project, Teams from Google WebRTC offer us help in selecting chipset vendors, and some of the vendors have very powerful quad-core CPUs with running at 1.6 GHz. We try to balance cost and performance to make our products affordable for everyone, and that is why we won the top honor at 2015 CES Best of Innovation Award under "embedded technology" category.

Our embedded technologies allow us to continue enhancing iCamPRO's algorithm and functions through firmware upgrades. This means that iCamPRO will be continually learning and increasingly smarter.

 Mechanized Infrared-Cut Filter 

This special piece is only found in high-end cameras.  The reason is because this infrared filter is motorized and switches the lens depending on the lighting.  It improves the night vision in the dark and the contrast during the daytime when the sun is brightest.

With an IR-cut filter, you won’t see any purplish color under bright sun light and will be able to see better in the dark.



Listen to the click sound when the mechanic infrared-cut filters are switched and the infrared LED lights to turn ON or OFF automatically while tracking an object to yield the best video image under bright or dark environment .

*You can hear the filter switch at the time the IR LED comes on.

Infrared-LED Mask

iCamPRO has 8 built-in IR LEDs with a light sensor to trigger them on/off. Our patent-pending technology allows you to turn the IR LED lights ON or OFF from app. 
This is important as empirical data indicates harmful results if eyes are exposed to IR LED for a long period of time.

For aesthetics purpose, we chose to mask these IR LEDs by selecting a special material applied on a custom-made mask yet allowing IR to penetrate the mask when needed.

Without IR LED Mask


With IR LED Mask

        

Front                                                           Back

                                

                                         

Amaryllo is the first IP camera to integrate Google's browser-based real time communication service. WebRTC offers extremely stable audio and video streaming without the need of downloading software add-ons or plug-ins. Recent News:

1. http://www.webrtc-solutions.com/topics/webrtc-solutions/articles/389356-amsterdam-based-company-reveals-first-webrtc-wireless-network.htm

2. http://blog.peer5.com/webrtc-the-future-of-the-web/

3. http://www.webrtcworld.com/topics/webrtc-world/articles/391226-amaryllo-announces-new-camera-line-with-webrtc-functionality.htm

                                                     

        Free Google Drive Upload

Amaryllo is also the first company to offer free cloud storage to consumers. 
Through the application, you can link your Google Drive with your camera.
Although the video is stored in your drive, you can manage and access them right through the app.  This saves you time and energy when searching for your video.  


           Real-Time Push Picture Alert

With built-in motion and audio sensors, you will receive a push text messages triggered by either motion or audio detection. The service is free.
                                                                                            

Push Picture with Time and Date

By tapping the phone's messages above, our app will download the push picture alert with time and date on the phone screen.

          


Push Picture with Time and Date

Push picture alerts will be kept for 3 days. The old pictures will be automatically deleted.



Amaryllo Application is available for Android and iOS

                             



The iCamPRO has built-in motion and audio sensors. This means that it can sense and hear you. Our app allows you to select push picture alert and/or push text alert. Once the sensors are triggered, iCamPRO will send out push alerts to you and others who receive administrator rights to use your iCamPRO. 
The push alert typically takes 10 ~ 20 seconds to deliver to your wireless devices. In the app, you may check in to review all of the push picture alerts sorted by either “Motion Alert” or “Audio Alert”. 
The push picture alerts are “time-stamped” to indicate when the events took place. The timestamp can be removed from the app if preferred. In general, there is no limit on the number of push picture alerts stored, but the alerts will be kept for 3 days and automatically replaced by the new pictures.



We've seen a big demand for viewing multiple cameras on a split screen platforms and sharing cameras with others.  So, Amaryllo introduces “Amaryllo Live” where you can view all your cameras simultaneously from a PC browser or share your cameras with others.  The beta version is now available and you can view your own cameras at:
                                                    https://live.amaryllo.eu 

To access Amaryllo Live, you must have Mozilla Firefox web browser, Firefox browser supports Amaryllo Live; however, the rest of the browser companies have agreed to support Amaryllo Live and WebRTC in the very near future due to its recent growth in demand.

                                                  My Camera Page (above)

Above is the "My Camera" Page showing 4 different live streams.  Also, there are 2 featured cameras from our partner restaurants on the right. Below is a snap shot of a restaurant in a 24" screen at Amaryllo Live.

Below is a video demo showing that you can view with a full screen at Amaryllo Live. You can swipe the PC browser to move the camera right, left, up, and down just like what you do with your smart phone. This is super convenient and easy to control.
 
\




How do I set it up?

We plan to have the setup procedure for the iCamPRO the same as our other products. 

The setup process takes only 1 minute if you know your WiFi password.  Our app will guide you through the steps and with a simple QR code scan, the camera is up and working. Here is the instructional video for the iSensor HD:


What kind of WiFi connection speed do I need?

Our Cameras have built-in WiFi 802.11 bgn and both downloading and uploading speeds depend on your available bandwidth.

For FHD, a minimum bandwidth of 2.0Mbps is recommended.

How long can I record video?  


World's Best 256-bit encryption?

We care about your privacy protection and that is why we employ 256-bit encryption, which is the same level of security as used by NSA, NASA, the Pentagon. With 256 bit encryption and Google's security network, AES permits the use of 256-bit keys. Breaking a symmetric 256-bit key by brute force requires 2128 times more computational power than a 128-bit key. 50 supercomputers that could check a billion billion (1018) AES keys per second (if such a device could ever be made) would, in theory, require about 3×1051 years to exhaust the 256-bit key space.

And you can rest assured that something like this doesn't happen with our camera's.

Can I use it outdoors?

Sorry, no :(

 Most of our our products are not weatherproof.  Weatherproof cameras are easily a couple hundred dollars more than in-house IP cams.

The iCamPRO is able to capture outdoor video with great quality thanks to the IR-cut filter, however we do not suggest to put the camera outside.

Amaryllo IS planning to introduce an outdoor camera in early 2015.

Look for the iSensor HD "Patio Edition" to premier at CES in Las Vegas, 

Jan. 6-9, 2015

Can I mount it anywhere I want?
YES!  A 2-meter-long power adapter is included in the package. It converts 100 V ~ 240 V power to a 5V / 2A supply to iCamPRO FHD. 

Does it have night vision?

Of course yo!  with the help of 8 IR LED, the iCamPRO can record FHD quality video in complete darkness.


The above room is PITCH BLACK, by the way.


We have a well-rounded team of engineers and support peeps that are more than willing to hear any comments, questions, or feedback that you may have for us.  Don't hesitate to let us know.

Website Support: 

http://www.amaryllo.eu/icam/index_support1_20140822A_test.php

Youtube channel for instructional videos:

https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCo0m8Z02ENQKKnDPFkW-eUA

Email Support:

support.ai@amaryllo.eu

Our experienced sales team is always willing to explore any new opportunities that approach.  If you have a question or just want to get in touch with us, we're always willing to chat.

Email inquiries to: sales.ai@amaryllo.eu


iCamPRO FHD wins 2015 CES Best of Innovation Award!!

 

http://www.cesweb.org/Events-Programs/Innovation

Amaryllo International has just received one of the most prestigous awards given by the Consumer Electronics Association (CEA), producer of the Consumer Electronics Show (CES), the world's largest electronics show that takes place every year in Las Vegas, Nevada.

            


There are two tiers to the Innovation awards given by the CEA at CES.  The first is "Honoree".  Over 100 products were chosen as an honoree from 28 different product categories.

However, only the products that score the highest, AND above the required score, are awarded the "Best of Innovation".  This year 20 products were able to acheive the required score and receive this highest honor.

iCamPRO was chosen for the Best of Innovation award in the category of "Embedded Technology", beating out major companies like Samsung, Qualcomm, and Nvidia.

We welcome you to come share the enjoyment with us at the official awards ceremony on January 4th  or at the show January 6-9 at CES in Las Vegas.  The iCamPRO will be on display at the Best of Innovation Awards Showcase, located in the Sands Expo at CES Tech West. You can find the Amaryllo booth also in the Sands Expo @ booth #70625

http://cesweb.org/Events-Programs/CES-Unveiled/CES-Unveiled-Las-Vega




Amaryllo is the winner of the 2015 WebRTC World Product of the Year Award.



Amaryllo was selected as a Cool Vendor by Gartner in their 2014 Connected Home Report . Gartner is the world's biggest investment research company.

http://www.gartner.com/technology/home.jsp

 Amaryllo was also the recipient of 2 prestigious awards at Computex 2014.     

    

  


Founded in Amsterdam, the Netherlands, Amaryllo designs, markets, and sells an increasingly larger line of wireless intelligent smart home networking products. www.amaryllo.eu

Below is a shot of our cameras viewing angle of 100° without any distortion in the picture.


Here's a shot of one of the competitor's HD cameras inside a small office (notice the strange curvature of their industry standard fish eye lens):

 
This is a quick demo taken from one of our prototypes, make sure to enable the highest quality on the YouTube player.



Intelligent Tracking System (ITS)





The iCamPRO is the very first affordable camera that can automatically track any moving object. Our algorithms teach the camera to always keep the object in the middle of the viewing area.  When an object begins to move away from the pixels in the middle of the viewing area, the camera will track the object until it's in the middle again.

What if 2 people are in the tracking area?
The algorithm is designed to follow the first object detected until it stops moving. 
Basically, the iCamPRO is using the lens and PIR motion sensors to constantly hunt for any moving object.

This is from the other side to see how far iCamPRO can track. In the video below, a walking person is over 30 feet (9 meters) away from iCamPRO.


Below is a tracking test in a very dimly lit room.  




*Please don't mind the motor noise as these are just prototypes.



Smart Sensor Network (SSN)
This was a late decision to implement, however a truly innovative idea that is one of a kind.  



We will have 3 PIR motion sensors placed strategically around the iCamPRO and if one of the sensors is triggered, the camera will turn to face the object, lock in, and begin to track it using the ITS.  
Unlike any other home security devices, this innovative design ensures no blind spots or dead zones for intruders to hide, and removes the need to install a multiple camera security system.
As you can see by the videos only some of our prototypes have the sensors.  That's because we just recently began testing it, but only after a short while we are sure that you are going to agree that it is a remarkable feature.





       



Built-in Intelligence







The iCamPRO FHD employs a high-speed CPU to encode 256-bit encryption, encipher Full HD video, track moving objects, conduct two-way audio, deliver picture alerts, upload recorded video, etc
It communicates with multiple sensors and compares picture frames one-by-one to detect the slightest movement in real time. This is not an easy task as iCamPRO is taking Full HD picture in each frame and grid each frame in many small blocks to compare their changes. .
iCamPRO’s multiple sensors are always on, and these sensors work together to continuously feed information to its CPU. They are like scouts detecting heat signature even in the dark!!
Traditional security devices' CPUs run at 100 MHz to 200 MHz because they use simple encryption, which does not require a big computation power. For some IP cameras employing a 56-bit encryption, it takes only 399 seconds to hack, which is less than 7 minutes. For 256-bit encryption, it may take a life time to break. Moreover, conventional IP cameras are unlikely to be firmware-upgradeable, meaning that what you buy will always be the same and the functionality will always be limited. 

For the iCamPRO project, Teams from Google WebRTC offer us help in selecting chipset vendors, and some of the vendors have very powerful quad-core CPUs with running at 1.6 GHz. We try to balance cost and performance to make our products affordable for everyone, and that is why we won the top honor at 2015 CES Best of Innovation Award under "embedded technology" category.
Our embedded technologies allow us to continue enhancing iCamPRO's algorithm and functions through firmware upgrades. This means that iCamPRO will be continually learning and increasingly smarter.



 Mechanized Infrared-Cut Filter 

This special piece is only found in high-end cameras.  The reason is because this infrared filter is motorized and switches the lens depending on the lighting.  It improves the night vision in the dark and the contrast during the daytime when the sun is brightest.
With an IR-cut filter, you won’t see any purplish color under bright sun light and will be able to see better in the dark.







Listen to the click sound when the mechanic infrared-cut filters are switched and the infrared LED lights to turn ON or OFF automatically while tracking an object to yield the best video image under bright or dark environment .




*You can hear the filter switch at the time the IR LED comes on.



Infrared-LED Mask

iCamPRO has 8 built-in IR LEDs with a light sensor to trigger them on/off. Our patent-pending technology allows you to turn the IR LED lights ON or OFF from app. This is important as empirical data indicates harmful results if eyes are exposed to IR LED for a long period of time.
For aesthetics purpose, we chose to mask these IR LEDs by selecting a special material applied on a custom-made mask yet allowing IR to penetrate the mask when needed.
Without IR LED Mask




With IR LED Mask






        Front                                                           Back




                                
                                         

Amaryllo is the first IP camera to integrate Google's browser-based real time communication service. WebRTC offers extremely stable audio and video streaming without the need of downloading software add-ons or plug-ins. Recent News:
1. http://www.webrtc-solutions.com/topics/webrtc-solutions/articles/389356-amsterdam-based-company-reveals-first-webrtc-wireless-network.htm
2. http://blog.peer5.com/webrtc-the-future-of-the-web/
3. http://www.webrtcworld.com/topics/webrtc-world/articles/391226-amaryllo-announces-new-camera-line-with-webrtc-functionality.htm

                                                     
        Free Google Drive UploadAmaryllo is also the first company to offer free cloud storage to consumers. Through the application, you can link your Google Drive with your camera.Although the video is stored in your drive, you can manage and access them right through the app.  This saves you time and energy when searching for your video.  


           Real-Time Push Picture Alert

With built-in motion and audio sensors, you will receive a push text messages triggered by either motion or audio detection. The service is free.
                                                                                            


Push Picture with Time and DateBy tapping the phone's messages above, our app will download the push picture alert with time and date on the phone screen.


          



Push Picture with Time and Date
Push picture alerts will be kept for 3 days. The old pictures will be automatically deleted.





Amaryllo Application is available for Android and iOS

                              The iCamPRO has built-in motion and audio sensors. This means that it can sense and hear you. Our app allows you to select push picture alert and/or push text alert. Once the sensors are triggered, iCamPRO will send out push alerts to you and others who receive administrator rights to use your iCamPRO. 

The push alert typically takes 10 ~ 20 seconds to deliver to your wireless devices. In the app, you may check in to review all of the push picture alerts sorted by either “Motion Alert” or “Audio Alert”. The push picture alerts are “time-stamped” to indicate when the events took place. The timestamp can be removed from the app if preferred. In general, there is no limit on the number of push picture alerts stored, but the alerts will be kept for 3 days and automatically replaced by the new pictures.






We've seen a big demand for viewing multiple cameras on a split screen platforms and sharing cameras with others.  So, Amaryllo introduces “Amaryllo Live” where you can view all your cameras simultaneously from a PC browser or share your cameras with others.  The beta version is now available and you can view your own cameras at:
                                                    https://live.amaryllo.eu 


To access Amaryllo Live, you must have Mozilla Firefox web browser, Firefox browser supports Amaryllo Live; however, the rest of the browser companies have agreed to support Amaryllo Live and WebRTC in the very near future due to its recent growth in demand.


                                                  My Camera Page (above)



Above is the "My Camera" Page showing 4 different live streams.  Also, there are 2 featured cameras from our partner restaurants on the right. Below is a snap shot of a restaurant in a 24" screen at Amaryllo Live.
Below is a video demo showing that you can view with a full screen at Amaryllo Live. You can swipe the PC browser to move the camera right, left, up, and down just like what you do with your smart phone. This is super convenient and easy to control.
 \






























How do I set it up?
We plan to have the setup procedure for the iCamPRO the same as our other products. 
The setup process takes only 1 minute if you know your WiFi password.  Our app will guide you through the steps and with a simple QR code scan, the camera is up and working. Here is the instructional video for the iSensor HD:


What kind of WiFi connection speed do I need?
Our Cameras have built-in WiFi 802.11 bgn and both downloading and uploading speeds depend on your available bandwidth.
For FHD, a minimum bandwidth of 2.0Mbps is recommended.



How long can I record video?  


World's Best 256-bit encryption?


We care about your privacy protection and that is why we employ 256-bit encryption, which is the same level of security as used by NSA, NASA, the Pentagon. With 256 bit encryption and Google's security network, AES permits the use of 256-bit keys. Breaking a symmetric 256-bit key by brute force requires 2128 times more computational power than a 128-bit key. 50 supercomputers that could check a billion billion (1018) AES keys per second (if such a device could ever be made) would, in theory, require about 3×1051 years to exhaust the 256-bit key space.
And you can rest assured that something like this doesn't happen with our camera's.




Can I use it outdoors?
Sorry, no :(
 Most of our our products are not weatherproof.  Weatherproof cameras are easily a couple hundred dollars more than in-house IP cams.
The iCamPRO is able to capture outdoor video with great quality thanks to the IR-cut filter, however we do not suggest to put the camera outside.
Amaryllo IS planning to introduce an outdoor camera in early 2015.
Look for the iSensor HD "Patio Edition" to premier at CES in Las Vegas, 
Jan. 6-9, 2015

Can I mount it anywhere I want?

YES!  A 2-meter-long power adapter is included in the package. It converts 100 V ~ 240 V power to a 5V / 2A supply to iCamPRO FHD. 


Does it have night vision?Of course yo!  with the help of 8 IR LED, the iCamPRO can record FHD quality video in complete darkness.



The above room is PITCH BLACK, by the way.




We have a well-rounded team of engineers and support peeps that are more than willing to hear any comments, questions, or feedback that you may have for us.  Don't hesitate to let us know.
Website Support: 
http://www.amaryllo.eu/icam/index_support1_20140822A_test.php
Youtube channel for instructional videos:


https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCo0m8Z02ENQKKnDPFkW-eUA
Email Support:
support.ai@amaryllo.eu






Our experienced sales team is always willing to explore any new opportunities that approach.  If you have a question or just want to get in touch with us, we're always willing to chat.
Email inquiries to: sales.ai@amaryllo.eu







iCamPRO FHD wins 2015 CES Best of Innovation Award!!

 
http://www.cesweb.org/Events-Programs/Innovation
Amaryllo International has just received one of the most prestigous awards given by the Consumer Electronics Association (CEA), producer of the Consumer Electronics Show (CES), the world's largest electronics show that takes place every year in Las Vegas, Nevada.

            

There are two tiers to the Innovation awards given by the CEA at CES.  The first is "Honoree".  Over 100 products were chosen as an honoree from 28 different product categories.
However, only the products that score the highest, AND above the required score, are awarded the "Best of Innovation".  This year 20 products were able to acheive the required score and receive this highest honor.
iCamPRO was chosen for the Best of Innovation award in the category of "Embedded Technology", beating out major companies like Samsung, Qualcomm, and Nvidia.
We welcome you to come share the enjoyment with us at the official awards ceremony on January 4th  or at the show January 6-9 at CES in Las Vegas.  The iCamPRO will be on display at the Best of Innovation Awards Showcase, located in the Sands Expo at CES Tech West. You can find the Amaryllo booth also in the Sands Expo @ booth #70625
http://cesweb.org/Events-Programs/CES-Unveiled/CES-Unveiled-Las-Vega







Amaryllo is the winner of the 2015 WebRTC World Product of the Year Award.





Amaryllo was selected as a Cool Vendor by Gartner in their 2014 Connected Home Report . Gartner is the world's biggest investment research company.

http://www.gartner.com/technology/home.jsp


 Amaryllo was also the recipient of 2 prestigious awards at Computex 2014.     


    
  




Founded in Amsterdam, the Netherlands, Amaryllo designs, markets, and sells an increasingly larger line of wireless intelligent smart home networking products.
www.amaryllo.eu

story:
Please donate to help Celeste and her family keep their home! If you can't donate, take the #icebucketchallenge to help spread awareness about ALS. 

Our Story: 

Six days after my 14th birthday, my parents divorced.

My Mom towed me and my 3 younger siblings all the way from Illinois down to Florida: a five day drive in a cramped silver pick-up truck in the middle of winter. We had no place to go, no resources of our own, and only one friend. He helped us look for a home, while we slept on the floor of his mother’s guest bedroom and tried uselessly not to be a burden.

Unwilling to let her friend support us indefinitely, my Mom picked up a job waitressing at Bob Evan’s and filled the rest of her time watching for ‘For Rent’ signs that never seemed to be there. Nearly a month later, she found what would become our first home: a mint green, 3-bedroom with a fenced in backyard out in the middle of nowhere.

We moved in and Mom got a second job, waitressing at Sonny’s BBQ when she wasn’t at Bob Evan’s or getting us off to school. After two years and some pretty bad months, we finally got the hang of being on our own as a family. I was in high school, my sisters were in middle school, and my brother was in elementary school, but we were all equal partners. Mom raised us to be strong and independent. In some ways, I guess that’s what kept us all from going to pieces.

Even when things seemed to be working, I knew something was off. My Mom had us, but she was the heart that kept us running and her heart was lonely. It was at that two year mark when that began to change. On one of her shifts at Bob Evan’s, one of her regular customers came in with his son Jeff, a 36 year old lawn maintenance man who was running his own small business.

Though his father introduced them and encouraged Jeff to ask my Mom out, Jeff was shy and went to the restroom first to give himself a pep-talk in the mirror. Even after that, he was barely able to give her his number and invite her for a date. I don’t know exactly how it happened, but it was like magic. One day they went out in his mud-truck, Betsy, and the next he was moving in.

Suddenly, we were a normal family again. And I can’t deny that we had normal family problems. It wasn’t easy for us kids to give up the equality we had gotten used to and have real parents for what seemed like the first time in forever. Jeff wasn’t like our father, who had abused his power and left us shattered. It took almost a full year for us to realize that he only wanted to help us.

Before Jeff moved in, we were just barely surviving. Once he was with us, things began to change little by little for the better. Mom was able to give up working at Bob Evan’s and, finally, had some time to spend with us. We had clothes without holes, beds, food that wasn’t microwavable, and another person that we could depend on. But it wasn’t only Jeff we gained, he brought his son, Junior, and his dog, Brandy, with him. Now I can’t imagine a time without them.

Just as we were getting on our feet, though, Mom lost her job at Sonny’s. We were able to cope, but Jeff had to give up his business and bring in a partner who had more connections. This man would end up lying, stealing, and drinking his way through what was left of Jeff’s hard earned cash. Soon we couldn’t afford our rent. Luckily, our landlords were decent people and allowed Jeff to pay as he could.

Mom found a job in telemarketing and, for a few months, we were okay again. Then Mom started having pains in her back and numbness in her shoulder and arm. The doctors thought something might be wrong with the disks in her spine and she had an operation that they said would fix it, hopefully, At first she felt better, but after a while the pain got worse and she began to lose the use of her right leg. Jeff worked even harder to support us.

In February of 2012, my Mother was diagnosed with Amyotrophic Lateral Sclerosis (ALS). Her mother had had it, as well as 11 others on her mother’s side of the family. We belong to the 10% of cases that are genetic. After finding out what was going to happen to her, she begged Jeff to leave. She tossed his bags out, yelled, and spent days acting like one of Florida’s hurricanes, but it was all useless. Jeff dug in his heels and proposed.

By the time she was diagnosed, my mother was struggling to use a walker and was unable to work. Most days she was confined to bed. Having been independent for the majority of her life and a capable mother of 4, she struggled with her new weaknesses. But she never gave up. She just discovered new ways to do things.

After receiving a HoverRound on loan, she broke free of her bedroom and began to terrorize the house. If her hands couldn’t clean and cook, she would direct someone else’s. If she couldn’t hold the pen to fill out some forms, she would dictate what was necessary. She never once lost her sense of humor, even when she lost the use of her one good leg and had to have help to shower and use the restroom.

Thanks to his lousy business partner, Jeff struggled to get the bills paid. Some days there was no water or electricity, but he always managed somehow to get things done. He made time to sit down with my Mom and talk or watch their favorite shows on TV. They still had fun together. Another whole year passed and Mom’s condition stayed the same. She could still sit up, use both of her arms, her breathing was mostly normal, and she could speak. I graduated from high school and got accepted into university, Mariah entered the summer before her senior year, Alexis was about to start high school, and Nikolas was looking forward to summer break.

But the house that we had come to love wasn’t big enough for us anymore. During the summer, we adopted another dog and Mom’s wheelchair wasn’t easily managed around tight corners and in narrow spaces. Mom needed special equipment and room for us to help her maneuver, so Jeff contacted an old friend who ran his own lawn care business nearer to the coast of central Florida about a job. After hearing about our situation, they jumped to help.

I struggled with the decision to either go off to college or stay home and take care of my mother. Refusing to let herself become a burden, Mom made the choice for me. When she was a sophomore in college, she dropped out to take care of her own mother. She wouldn’t let me make the same mistake and made sure that all of the arrangements were made so that I could move into the dorms when the fall semester started.

They found a house for rent that was just the right size with a backyard that opens out onto the canal. August of 2013, we moved to North Port. At the end of the month, I was carted off to the dorms at the University of South Florida St. Petersburg Campus and Alexis started with online schooling through Florida Virtual School (FLVS), so that she would be home to help Mom. Thanks largely to an increase in regular pay for Jeff and Mom’s social security disability benefits, my family was able to survive. I was attending USFSP on the grace of academic scholarships, grants, loans, and the work study program, so I was glad not to be yet another financial burden.

I skyped every week, sometimes just to listen to everybody talk. Mom couldn’t feed herself by Thanksgiving and when Christmas came around she had completely lost the use of her arms. That spring her condition worsened even further and she couldn’t sit up by herself and needed an oxygen mask to make sure she didn’t stop breathing at night. The ALS foundation found her a chair that she could move by blowing into a tube and, again, she was mobile.

Though they were engaged, my Mom and Jeff had yet to get married. Because the family was together for Christmas, Jeff decided that it was finally time. He ran all over town for the ring, barely remembering the marriage license. On December 19th 2014, my parents were married at the Sarasota courthouse. My Mom wore white, had her hair and nails done up, and her kids as her witnesses on the happiest day of her life. It was the first time I saw Jeff cry, though he refused to admit to it.

Spring came and the ALS foundation was able to find a handicap equipped van, so that Mom could leave the house again. When her 45th birthday came in May 2014, she was able to enjoy herself with friends and family at a park. She even got to eat some cake. My sister Mariah graduated just before summer and Mom was adamant that she would join me at USFSP.

To help that summer before she left, Mariah got her first job at Lowe’s and helped with what she could. I continued with summer school and found an affordable apartment near campus and my job at the campus library. When I could I visited home, but without a car of my own I couldn’t always make it.

On July 8th, 2014, Mom went in for surgery to place a feeding tube in her stomach. Her throat muscles were too weak for solid food. Due to complications in the surgery, she stayed a few extra nights in the hospital, but still came home complaining of pain in her stomach.

On July 13th, 2014, Mom stopped breathing and went into seizures. The only ones home at the time, Mariah and Alexis and Nikolas, called for an ambulance and then called Jeff at work. Everyone was panicking. The ambulance came and they were able to get her breathing again, but she was unresponsive and the seizures continued. They rushed her to Tampa General Hospital. For two weeks, we camped in the hospital waiting room. I was at school when I got the call in the middle of class. Jeff came to get me that night and we went to the hospital together. Mariah, Alexis, Nikolas, Jeff’s mother, and Karen and Chyenne- family friends-were already there.

Family and friends, who heard about the situation through phone calls and facebook messages, sent money and their prayers. Two weeks felt like 10 years as we waited, fearing the worst. Alexis and I slept in her hospital room. The doctors tried to figure out how to stop her constant seizures. They couldn’t tell us if she had brain damage. They put her into a medically induced coma and hoped for the best. Jeff sent me home for the next few days, promising to return if there was any change. After a few days in the coma, they began to bring her out of it.

She woke up bleary eyed and hardly responsive, but over the next week things changed, The doctors had operated to place a hole in her windpipe, so that she would be able to breathe (a Tracheostomy). She could no longer speak to us, but could only use her eyes to let us know what she was thinking or a click of her tongue to let us know something was wrong. The breathing machine meant that she needed constant care and monitoring, but insurance at the time would not pay for a full time nurse that would be required if we wanted to take her home. She was stuck in the hospital until the middle of September, when they transferred her to a rehab center closer to home.

Jeff went back to work harder than ever. For a time, Alexis went back to public school. Mariah moved into the dorms. In the back of everyone’s minds was the fear that Mom would never get to go home again, that they would only ever see her on weekends when they could. In mid-September, they found her a nurse that could take an 8 hour shift during the day if someone was home besides Mom to supervise her.

Alexis went back to virtual school and Mom got to come home. Now things are settling down again. Everyone is getting back into a routine, but now our landlord has put the house up for sale. Jeff works so hard to make rent and pay the bills. We’ve held fundraisers and people have donated, but it won’t be enough to keep our home. There is no place else that Mom wants to be.


Please donate to help Celeste and her family keep their home! If you can't donate, take the #icebucketchallenge to help spread awareness about ALS.

schooling through Florida Virtual School (FLVS), so that she would be
home to help Mom. Thanks largely to an increase in regular pay for
Jeff and Mom’s social security disability benefits, my family was
able to survive. I was attending USFSP on the grace of academic
scholarships, grants, loans, and the work study program, so I was
glad not to be yet another financial burden. 


I skyped every week,
sometimes just to listen to everybody talk. Mom couldn’t feed
herself by Thanksgiving and when Christmas came around she had
completely lost the use of her arms. That spring her condition
worsened even further and she couldn’t sit up by herself and needed
an oxygen mask to make sure she didn’t stop breathing at night. The
ALS foundation found her a chair that she could move by blowing into
a tube and, again, she was mobile. 


Though they were
engaged, my Mom and Jeff had yet to get married. Because the family
was together for Christmas, Jeff decided that it was finally time. He
ran all over town for the ring, barely remembering the marriage
license. On December 19th 2014, my parents were married at the
Sarasota courthouse. My Mom wore white, had her hair and nails done
up, and her kids as her witnesses on the happiest day of her life. It
was the first time I saw Jeff cry, though he refused to admit to it. 


Spring came and the
ALS foundation was able to find a handicap equipped van, so that Mom
could leave the house again. When her 45th birthday came in May 2014,
she was able to enjoy herself with friends and family at a park. She
even got to eat some cake. My sister Mariah graduated just before
summer and Mom was adamant that she would join me at USFSP. 


To help that summer
before she left, Mariah got her first job at Lowe’s and helped with
what she could. I continued with summer school and found an
affordable apartment near campus and my job at the campus library.
When I could I visited home, but without a car of my own I couldn’t
always make it. 


On July 8th, 2014,
Mom went in for surgery to place a feeding tube in her stomach. Her
throat muscles were too weak for solid food. Due to complications in
the surgery, she stayed a few extra nights in the hospital, but still
came home complaining of pain in her stomach. 


On July 13th, 2014,
Mom stopped breathing and went into seizures. The only ones home at
the time, Mariah and Alexis and Nikolas, called for an ambulance and then called
Jeff at work. Everyone was panicking. The ambulance came and they
were able to get her breathing again, but she was unresponsive and
the seizures continued. They rushed her to Tampa General Hospital.
For two weeks, we camped in the hospital waiting room. I was at
school when I got the call in the middle of class. Jeff came to get
me that night and we went to the hospital together. Mariah, Alexis,
Nikolas, Jeff’s mother, and Karen and Chyenne- family friends-were
already there. 


Family and friends,
who heard about the situation through phone calls and facebook
messages, sent money and their prayers. Two weeks felt like 10 years
as we waited, fearing the worst. Alexis and I slept in her hospital
room. The doctors tried to figure out how to stop her constant
seizures. They couldn’t tell us if she had brain damage. They put
her into a medically induced coma and hoped for the best. Jeff sent
me home for the next few days, promising to return if there was any
change. After a few days in the coma, they began to bring her out of
it. 


She woke up bleary
eyed and hardly responsive, but over the next week things changed,
The doctors had operated to place a hole in her windpipe, so that she
would be able to breathe (a Tracheostomy). She could no longer speak
to us, but could only use her eyes to let us know what she was
thinking or a click of her tongue to let us know something was wrong.
The breathing machine meant that she needed constant care and
monitoring, but insurance at the time would not pay for a full time
nurse that would be required if we wanted to take her home. She was
stuck in the hospital until the middle of September, when they
transferred her to a rehab center closer to home. 


Jeff went back to
work harder than ever. For a time, Alexis went back to public school.
Mariah moved into the dorms. In the back of everyone’s minds was
the fear that Mom would never get to go home again, that they would
only ever see her on weekends when they could. In mid-September, they
found her a nurse that could take an 8 hour shift during the day if
someone was home besides Mom to supervise her. 


Alexis went back to
virtual school and Mom got to come home. Now things are settling down
again. Everyone is getting back into a routine, but now our landlord
has put the house up for sale. Jeff works so hard to make rent and
pay the bills. We’ve held fundraisers and people have donated, but
it won’t be enough to keep our home. There is no place else that
Mom wants to be. 

Please donate to help Celeste and her family keep their home! If you can't donate, take the #icebucketchallenge to help spread awareness about ALS.

story:
Princeton in Africa (PiAf) is an organization which develops young leaders committed to Africa’s advancement by offering yearlong fellowship opportunities with a variety of organizations that work across the African continent.  As fellows, we all have a certain connection with Africa and we represent an organization which sees others as our own.


Ebola has now been ravaging Liberia, Sierra Leone and Guinea since December 2013. The global response from governments, organizations (both for-profit and non) and individuals has been slow and, unfortunately, has not assuaged fears about further impacts. Since the beginning of this outbreak our hearts ache knowing that our brothers and sisters are dying from a disease that no one fully understands or are prepared to battle. As a global community, we can do much better. 


Over the past month, PiAf Fellows have discussed ways to leverage our networks and make a difference in this battle.  We have decided that directing our efforts to Médecins Sans Frontières and vulnerable groups, such as children (More Than Me) and the elderly (Last Mile Health) who live in remote villages, would have the most impact.  Past and current fellows have provided first-hand insight, enabling us to identify these local NGOs and better understand what is happening on the ground.  We are still in contact with these fellows to explore options for our own initiatives focused on these groups.


100% of your donation will go to the selected organizations as we have recieved support to cover campaign expenses.  Contribute today and help the fellows continue to make an impact on the continent we love!


*Donations are managed by PiAf Fellows and are separate from Princeton in Africa 501(c)(3).

story:
16VIT is a premium gaming supplement brand committed to designing wellness products for the needs of the modern player. 

Be a part of our story, join us as we continue to develop more products, help the gaming/streaming community grow and become a brand that exceeds expectations of our customers and the community. 

With your support, we will be able to invest in product development and accelerate our brand building activity. We invest heavily in our social presence and an investment from you will help us drive more traction in the community and assist in leveling up our marketing efforts across social platforms. 

All our products are currently gummy based and are manufactured in a GMP certified facility in the USA. As we continue to develop more products, we maintain a promise of purity, safety and potency. 

Check out our store: http://16vit.com

Our Goal & What's In It For You

Our fundraising goal is $100,000

  • $40,000 for research and development/manufacturing/optimization of current/new formulas. 
  • $50,000 to hyper charge our marketing efforts (twitter, facebook, instagram, mixer and twitch) along with developing 16Vit tradeshow booth for industry events and influencer engagement
  • $10,000 for website optimization and 3PL warehouse investment

Perks for Backers: 

  • $10: Shout out on our social media
  • $25: One bottle of a 16VIT product of your choice and shout out on social media
  • $50:Three bottles of a 16VIT product of your choice, shout on on social media
  • $100: Official sponsorship from 16VIT (along w/ all other lower $ perks)
  • $250: One year supply of a product of your choice (along w/ all other lower $ perks)
  • $1000: Badge to industry event (along w/ all other lower $ perks)
  • $5000: Paid airfare/hotel for industry event of choice (along w/ all other lower $ perks)
  • $10,000+: Personalized product (name, design, and formula) in the 16VIT collection (along w/ all other lower $ perks)

Your Impact on 16VIT

Building a brand requires significant investments in research, development, marketing, design, and logistics.

16VIT has big goals, but those goals require significant funding to enable the proper investments to drive the brand. 

Our funding so far has been through friends and family, and we believe in the power of community and made the decision to crowdfund to enable the community to be a part of our story and build relationships. 

We currently have three products/formulas available (START, CONTINUE and BLINK) on our site http://16vit.com designed for specific needs of the gaming community.

BLINK is our eye health formula, CONTINUE is our anti-inflammatory formula to help support joint health and START is our daily multi. We are developing more products for sleep, stress and energy. 

We recently launched our sponsorship/affliate program and already have partnerships with 5+ streamers/gamers and are receiving multiple applications daily.

With your investment, you are helping shape 16VIT and our future. Building trust with the community and our network is critically important to us as we continue to grow. 

Risks & Challenges

As with building any brand, there are a variety of risks to our growth. The gaming/esports community is growing rapidly and with growth comes investment and competition.

There are several powdered drink brands that compete for mind space in the community, however 16VIT is building a supplement brand with specific benefits for the needs of the modern player in a different way. 

Some of the people we have been in contact with can get confused as to what our products can do for them due to the majority of supplements/messaging geared for gamers being in the energy space. With some quick discussion, the confusion is mitigated, but we need to ensure our messaging is clear and consistent to our audience. 

Our products are all gummy form, which is different and delicious way for the community to help support their health and wellness needs. 

Developing gummy vitamins has proven difficult and there are manufacturers who market gummy production, but aren't equipped to deliver the highest quality we expect.

Our current manufacturer is GMP certified, third party tests all product and has been manufacturing gummy vitamins for over 20+ years. As we expand, we will continue to seek out more partners in manufacturing as future formulas are out of scope for our current manufacturer at this time. 

We have a registered trademark on our name/logo to protect our brand and its identity. 

16VIT is a brand owned by Sync Labs Corporation, a registered S-corporation. Very small in size, but primed for rapid growth. 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you aren't in a position to support us financially, we would still love to hear from you! Let your network know about us! Stay "Always on Your Game" with 16VIT.

If you are in the gaming community, please find/follow us on social media, we are highly active on all platforms and would love to hear from you.

-16VIT Team

"Always On Your Game"

story:
A Toothbrush for Kids that Makes Brushing Teeth Easy

Kids have a hard time brushing their teeth for two whole minutes--with or without their parent's encouragement. Singer/songwriter Steven Zelin, also known as “The Singing CPA,” wrote the catchy song "I'm Gonna Brush My Teeth" with this in mind. His motivational tune first appeared on his children's album, “Magical Boxes,” available on iTunes and Spotify. 

ToothyBeats pairs “I’m Gonna Brush My Teeth” with a battery-operated toothbrush. When a child presses the power button, the upbeat song plays and teaches kids the names of different teeth while they brush. After two minutes, the amount of time the ADA recommends we brush twice a day, the song and the brush both stop. 

Kids focus on the song instead of the act of brushing, and parents get to relax instead of insisting their child keep brushing.

Your support means that we can give you the gift of ToothyBeats immediately—our first brushes are ready to ship!—and allows us to scale future production.

What We Need & What You Get

The amount of money we’re trying to raise will help us scale our production of ToothyBeats.

Backing our campaign means you can receive a Toothy Beats brush immediately, and allow us to produce more for families across the country.

If we don’t meet our goal we will use the money to defray the costs associated with producing and shipping our first run of Toothy Beats.

We are sending our first ToothyBeats packed with extras that we’d like to include in future shipments:

• Extra batteries to help remind you that it’s battery operated (just replace the batteries by pulling out the bottom!).

• An extra replacement head so you will remember to replace the toothbrush head after 3 months.

• A hygienic cap so you can protect your ToothyBeats brush head.

• Stickers to customize your ToothyBeats toothbrush.

How ToothyBeats Will Change Your Family's Morning and Nighttime Routine

If you’ve been able to successfully encourage your child to brush his or her teeth for the recommended two minutes, twice a day, you are a miracle worker! For parents who find it hard to enforce this rule in the morning and before bed, ToothyBeats is the answer. It will make your life easier, and encourage kids to brush for two whole minutes without a fuss!

Many families have already received sample ToothyBeats brushes. Here are a few of their testimonials:

"Both my young boys have loved Steven Zelin songs since they were young toddlers, so you can imagine our joy to find out that their favorite tooth brushing song was captured inside an electric tooth brush, whoa! Sometimes the boys will brush for FOUR minutes (twice the recommended), just to jam out to that catchy song once more before bedtime. As a parent of two little monsters that will rarely sit still for two minutes to do anything, I can safely say that dancing while teeth-brushing is the easiest and most fun way to get all those 20 teeth shiny and clean. Thank you, Steven!" – Adriane Stare

“Jasper loves his ToothyBeats! You've made teeth-brushing all the more fun, which is immensely helpful, given his reluctance to clean his teeth.” – Clay Chapman

"My wife and I used to dread the tooth brushing routine.  The catchy song which emanates from Steven's toothbrush changed all that.  My kids love the song and I love the quality of the toothbrush. Now we look forward to it!" – Anthony Visco

Order ToothyBeats and turn a daily chore into a fun routine!

story:
This is my dad Dennis , he is one of the most hardworking and selfless men I could ever hope to know, He was diagnosed in February with High grade Muscle invasive stage 3/4 Bladder cancer, He has been fighting si hard . He was diagnosed at a time when he was out of work so had no health insurance, His bills have skyrocketed out of his control, We have lost our home , found a new one but in the illegal eviction from our home while he was in the hospital we lost everything, The landlord stole or broke anything he could find leaving us with very little, My father has been selling everything he owns to keep us afloat but now he is out of things to sell. His doctors refuse to do the surgery he needs because of no insurance and with out it offer him very little hope. I have watched him sit on the phone for days following every lead given to him to find help. I never thought I would see my father cry but lately he does and often, Everyone tells him to lower his stress so his body can fight the cancer but he just can't, with his world crumbling around him he is just not able to do anything. Mom tries to help but what can she do if he is giving up? We need a miracle at this point. My dad has been humbled to the point where he is turning into an empty shell of the man he was. I found this site by the grace of God and pray that people will find it in their hearts to help us.

 

   My daughter asked me to introduce myself and tell a bit of my story and how it has come to this the most humbling experience of my life

 

 As you know my name is Dennis, I am 41 years young , I would like to let you in on the backround a bit please.

 

   I worked at a local steel mill for 8 years , about year 7 I started with some back pain and hip pain . I went to several doctors looking for a cause but they never found it, I through the year was getting very tired physically I mean and was slacking at my job because of it. Like most companies they would not believe my claims that there was a unfound reason , instead it was chalked up as lazy and they gave me back breaking job after job to get me to quit so they would have no unemployment claim.  I found my self with severe back pain and went to the ER , they diagnosed a kidney stone from the left kidney. Lets jump forward a bit but my health was getting worse and yes I had to walk away from the job. Well fast forward because after leaving there was no jobs to be found. In February of this year I woke to find I was urinating just blood, we rushed to the ER and this time they found the problem, A large high grade tumor in my bladder and a small tumor in the left ureter, Remember the kidney stone , same place . Anyway, Being out of work meant no insurance so . The initial visit to the hospital was a 6 day stay and a visit from an oncologist to explain that I needed to have my bladder removed as soon as possible and get started on chemo and radiation treatments In that order. The plan changed once they found out there was no insurance so they decided on the cheaper route which was chemo first, I was on round 3 of chemo when medicaid finally came through ( answered prayer right) well it seems at the same time my disability was approved , well the issue was when disability was approved it comes with medicare good so far right. NO it turns out that with medicare there is a 2 tear waiting period but yet menicaid stops at then. Well I had medicaid for 2 months total , before the medicaid was to expire I talked to my doctor and he said we needed to get ready for the surgery, Well he wanted 1 more round of chemo first which ended after the medicaid ran out so now back to square 1 on the surgery because once again no insurance. 

  I have tried every place to find help including my own church just to be denied for help due to lack of funds not to say they wouldn't have liked to do more, I am not complaining, Times are tough and it just was not available . I love those in my church and know that if all they can give is a prayer , I will take it greatfully . 

 

 I have tried to do this with just my family and the help of a very few good friends that have stood by me. 

 The way it stands now is if I can't start raising funds , the treatments will end and The cancer will win. I have no choice. Disability only gives me $1456 / month and with my medical bills above $60000 so far I can't make it. The medications they have me on alone are lovenox which is a shot I have to take 2 times a day , These shots are $375 per shot so for a 30 day supply that is $22500/month. Now with no medicaid those have ended . Chemo has stopped . The surgery has not been scheduled and may never be.

I know this is long and I am sorry but without the hystory I just seem lazy . The bottom line is if I can't get help then I will die. I don't know how to ask for this kind of help because I have always found a way for my family to make it and now I just have nothing left to offer. 

  I know times are tough but if you can help me and my family please do . You will be helping to save my life. 

 

 All I can say is thank you and God bless those who have a kind heart that will help.

The initial visit to the hospital was a 6 day stay and a visit from an oncologist to explain that I needed to have my bladder removed as soon as possible and get started on chemo and radiation treatments In that order. The plan changed once they found out there was no insurance so they decided on the cheaper route which was chemo first, I was on round 3 of chemo when medicaid finally came through ( answered prayer right) well it seems at the same time my disability was approved , well the issue was when disability was approved it comes with medicare good so far right. NO it turns out that with medicare there is a 2 tear waiting period but yet menicaid stops at then. Well I had medicaid for 2 months total , before the medicaid was to expire I talked to my doctor and he said we needed to get ready for the surgery, Well he wanted 1 more round of chemo first which ended after the medicaid ran out so now back to square 1 on the surgery because once again no insurance. 
  I have tried every place to find help including my own church just to be denied for help due to lack of funds not to say they wouldn't have liked to do more, I am not complaining, Times are tough and it just was not available . I love those in my church and know that if all they can give is a prayer , I will take it greatfully . 
 
 I have tried to do this with just my family and the help of a very few good friends that have stood by me. 
 The way it stands now is if I can't start raising funds , the treatments will end and The cancer will win. I have no choice. Disability only gives me $1456 / month and with my medical bills above $60000 so far I can't make it. The medications they have me on alone are lovenox which is a shot I have to take 2 times a day , These shots are $375 per shot so for a 30 day supply that is $22500/month. Now with no medicaid those have ended . Chemo has stopped . The surgery has not been scheduled and may never be.
I know this is long and I am sorry but without the hystory I just seem lazy . The bottom line is if I can't get help then I will die. I don't know how to ask for this kind of help because I have always found a way for my family to make it and now I just have nothing left to offer. 
  I know times are tough but if you can help me and my family please do . You will be helping to save my life. 
 
 All I can say is thank you and God bless those who have a kind heart that will help.

story:
Why in the hell are we doing this?

It's simple, really. We have ideas. We have desires. We have dreams. Can you fault us for that? (Insert Successful 1st World Country) was built on dreams. The founders knew that in order to be successful and achieve those dreams, they had to launch a marketing campaign and raise funding through annonymous interweb donors such as yourself. ...It's in the history books people! 

Look, our dream started with listening to podcasts. At first, there was just one. However, many more podcasts were added to our listening library. Some we loved; some we didn't. For the ones we kept, we found ourselves contributing ideas to those podcasts, and then, a lot of those ideas were used. Finally, it dawned on us! Why continue to contribute to others success, when we can do it ourselves?!?! Duh! So, that's why we're here, random citizen. We want to entertain you, and ourselves, at the same time. AT. THE. SAME. TIME. ...Mindblowing.

Michael The Red, Jablonski, Midwest Adam, and Lil' Boh all have various "day jobs" (corporate shill, Polish outdoorsman, meat handler, healthcare victim). However, we want our "night job" to involve a mixture of our thoughts, ideas, opinions, willingness to subject ourselves to large quantities of food and beer,  humor, seriousness, interpretive dance, etc., all put into podcast and webcast form. ...A legacy for our children to cherish.

What can you do for us?

We are an upstart. The economy affected us all like millions of others around the globe. None of us can fund such a project on our own (nor together in the near future). We all have bills and responsibilities. Some of us have drinking problems. Basically, we need equipment and an initial merchandise run. We have nothing. It's sad, really.

We've calculated that a meager sum of $5000 will give us the ability to purchase all of the equipment and initial merchandise that we will need in order to really get this project going properly. We don't want to sound horrible. We don't want to be 5 people sitting around 2 microphones with someone video recording on their phone. That's amateur. Rank amateur.

We need: computer, 5 mics, mixer, soundboard, video camera, software, web address/hosting, t-shirts, and bumber stickers. If we have any money left over after purchasing all of the equipment, it will go towards the supplies needed to do our food/beer challenges, for costume related items, and for other, here-to-unknown, items.

For your contribution; not only will you be highlighted on our first show--and through our Twitter and Facebook pages--with producer credit, but you will also be offered some incentives based on how much you give to our dream. See our "Perks" section for details. And remember...it's helping our children in a "legacy" kind of way.

What more can we say?

Not much. It's all laid our for you in a nice little essayesque fashion. However, if you'd like a little more of our flavor, follow us at our Twitter page at http://www.twitter.com/ShockTherapySTL, like us at our Facebook page at http://www.facebook.com/ShockTherapySTL, or email us at ShockTherapySTL@gmail.com.

 

THANK YOU FOR HELPING US!!! WE LOVE YOU!!!!
