story:
Help Michelle Fund www.JoeyPouch.com , Comfort and Protection.

My sister Michelle was diagnosed with Hodgkins Lymphoma Cancer nearly 10 years ago.
The majority of those with this type of cancer receive radiation and chemotherapy and are soon into remission.  Michelle fell into a smaller group of cancer patients that need much, much more treatment.  She had multiple rounds of radiation, chemotherapy and stem cell transplants over the years.  At one point in her treatment she was given a 1 percent chance of living.  She is a survivor and never gave up.  She has never been cancer free but lives with it courageousely as the technology and medicines continue to get better year after year.  She is a Cancer Super Hero!

Michelle Invented the www.JoeyPouch.com

While in early stages of her treatment, Michelle realized that her Hickman Catheter was cumbersome and uncomfortable as it protruded from her chest.  It had to be taped against her body and watched carefully so that it didn't become infected.  She created and invented a pouch like product that could not only hold the catheter comfortably but provide protection from infections.  She named it the "Joey Pouch" after my brother Joey as he has been fortunate to provide stem cells for Michelle's treatment on several ocassions. 

Michelle Provides the www.JoeyPouch.com to Hospitals.

With your financial contributions, Michelle will be able to continue providing the Joey Pouch to hospitals and directly to patients.  Her hope is to raise enough money so that she can provide them at no charge to those that need them most.  

Other Ways You Can Help.

Many cancer patients have been fortunate to receive a Joey Pouch one way or another.  Everyone that is fortunate to use them has given Michelle rave reviews.  If you know someone you feel would benefit from the use of a Joey Pouch send them to www.JoeyPouch.com.  

Thank you for your time and consideration...  Tony Salerno

story:
My mother and I talked on the phone last night. We talked about my grandmother and grandfather in their Portland,Maine assisted living facility. My mom said that everytime she calls my grandfather asks if she's right around the corner. They've told my mom in less dramatic ways...as they have told me that they wish to see us just as much as we wish to see them.

 Gone are the days of affordable air-travel. If you don't have the money then you're just confined to your town; isolated by a sea of states between you and your loved ones. Florida to Maine is quite a distance! "If I could only fix up a vehicle", my mother said "I would drive up there this weekend!" She doesn't have the money to do that. She works as hard as she can just to get her truck to run within city limits. My mother takes care of my niece and nephew, who have been placed under her and my stepfather's care. Papa and Mimi they call them. "Mimi" is the affectionate Franco nickname that my grandparents call her by. She calls me, and even in person...seeing them is always a hot topic of conversation. "If only" we say. But with only one income...the money is not there.

 As for me...It's been at least three years since I've seen my "Grandmama" and "Grandpapa". "We would have given anything to be at your graduation", my grandmother says to me. Even still they scrounged up 50$ of their social security to help with textbooks. "You don't have to do that", I said. I was greeted with a sharp,"No. This only happens once in your life. This is special, and our gift to you." If you ask me...I still don't know how they were able to do that. I'm learning what a budget is. I'll be rolling in student loans. Sure, I worked hard and got a few scholarships but it just doesn't cover the cost. I'll be working hard to try and afford it...but my next semeter at UCF comes without a guarantee.

 My grandparents are in their 80s and I just feel like for us...it's now or never. I just get that feeling. Don't know if thats the fault of age, the economy, or both. I don't know if this will even work. But it can't hurt to have faith. If you can send us up to Portland for however long...I feel like it will bring a bit of life-changing peace and bring some relief and strength to our family ties.

My hope is to AT LEAST be able to cover the round-trip airfare (for two)...If all we can do is get there, then we'll do our best to figure something out!

I forgot to mention one last thing. My mother doesn't know. Her expression when this is unveiled would without a doubt beat any TV-Moment. But Best of all: I want you to see it! I will be uploading updates as we go. YouTube has redefined society as we know it, and now let me (a oneday film industry hopeful) use it to share this moment...and introduce you to my family.

story:
Hello, my name is Christina, Chrissy to my family and friends. My daddy (Charlie) was diagnosed this year with colon cancer at 52 years young after a routine colonoscopy. As devastating as it is to hear, he still has a smile on his face and a joke in his mouth and we're so blessed to still have him around. He went through surgery in April to remove the cancerous mass and to determine what the next step would be. Hearing your dad has cancer is one of the worst sounds that you'll ever hear and hearing the cancer cells are in the lymph nodes isn't much easier.
 
My dad started chemotherapy 16 weeks ago and despite it's horrible effects, he's still a trooper, as always. On top of everything he's battling, he's unable to work because of the chemo. This is really hard for him (and everyone) because he's always been the rock of the family, strong "like bull", and hard-working and now I hear him say things like he feels like such a wimp because the chemo makes him so weak he can't stand or lift his arms. He says sometimes that he needs to "man up", but let me just say he's not a wimp, he's still my rock of a dad, that is fighting something bigger. He's the strongest man I know to be going through such a debilitating treatment and still be worried about us, not himself.
 
On July 3, my grandfather passed away suddenly. While in the hospital, the doctors discovered that he had colon cancer, as well. I didn't know a situation that was already so devastating, could be worse. We are now in a position that most people (including us) don't plan for. The medical bills are extensive and when we add those on top of a mortgage and other expenses, it's overwhelming. We take everything day-by-day and try to look at the brighter side of life, the most important being that we still have our daddy and he will fight this and win.
 
Your generosity will assist my dad in getting the medical bills off his mind and his mind on getting healthy again. Our family thanks you from the deepest of our hearts. Words can't express our gratitude.

story:
Golf For Everyone!

Golf is a game of a lifetime!  Unfortunately, it is also probably one of the least handicapped friendly sport.  What if you could help change the way the game is played and perceived? 

The Wolf at Tenkiller, a new golf course located near beautiful Lake Tenkiller in Eastern Oklahoma, is making plans to have a golf course built for everyone.  The vision is to have a 100% handicap accessible golf course.  We plan on buying two Paragolfers and 1 Solorider but will purchase more if we can raise the funds.

The Goal

What we are asking for is for $35,000.  This will purchase two Paragolfers at about $16,000 a piece.  We will use any remaining funds to purchase more carts including a Solorider which is ideal for the golfer that can still stand on their own but just can't get around as well as they used to.  This is an idea that is just starting to take root and you can be on the ground floor.  Anyone making a donation will be thanked on our website www.thewolfattenkiller.com and you will have the satisfaction of giving the gift of golf to someone that may not think they have the ability. 

The Impact

We will use the game of golf to promote healing and a sense of pride!  We are in development on programs to provide golf clinics for disabled veterans, Native Americans and charities that help the disabled.  Golf is truly the game of a lifetime and everyone should have the chance to enjoy it! 

Other Ways You Can Help

Please let everyone you can think of that may be interested in helping know about our site.  Also, please support other groups that are working hard at this fantastic idea!  Here are a couple of groups that promote handicapped golf:

www.veterangolf.org

www.stand-up-and-play.com/ (run by Paragolfer founder Anthony Netto)

story:
Project name

The study of a diabetes-specific herbal

supplement as a potential adjunct therapy

for hard-to-treat type 2 diabetes patients

 

Study goal: to see A1c will decrease is type 2 diabetes

Study length: 90 days

Patient selection: double blind and total randomized

Number of patients: 80 patients

Study coordinator: Charles Liu, R.Ph. Clinical Pharmacist

Principal investigator: J Prada, MD

Study location: proposed double-blind clinical study is going to be in a Michigan diabetes clinic affiliated with Crittenton hospital

Background information

Type 2 diabetes (T2D)

It is predicted by 2030, there will be approximately 400 million individuals with diabetes worldwide. In the US, about 1/3 of its population is at risk of being diagnosed with diabetes. Unfortunately, with the increase we will see a parallel increase in the diabetes-related complications. Diabetes is a metabolic disease and one of the most insidious diseases. Diabetes can be controlled but seldom cured. If not controlled it will destroy vital organs such as heart, liver, pancreas, eye and kidney. This diabetes-related complications cause health care costs to soar. In the US, 80% of deaths in diabetic patients die from heart disease. Diabetes is also the leading cause for renal failure, blindness and limb amputation. Historically, T2D was a disease mainly affected adults. This pattern has changed drastically during last 20 years as more young adults and children are inflicted with T2D. The pathophysiology of T2D is complex and involves multiple pathways and organs. This could include insulin resistance, pancreatic insulin secretory irregularities, increase of glucagon secretion, over production of glucose in liver and reduction of incretin and other hormonal abnormalities. 

Current diabetes therapy regimen consists of medications which are synthetic chemicals and insulin. Because of the undesirable side-effects and the need to help control better from other mechanism of action, physicians are forced to prescribe additional medications to the two front-line medications (metformin and insulin). The addition of the medication is called adjunct therapy. Over 50% of adult population in the US takes supplements with or without attending physician's approval. The values of supplementation are often debated among health professionals in the US.

However, clinicians in other advanced countries such as Germany and Japan are more open-minded about herbal supplements. Many herbal-based products in these countries are finding ways to become an important part of therapy.

Currently, a few supplement-based adjunct therapy agents are in the market, none with the evidence-based ingredients combination and none followed by a well designed standard as the proposed formula submitted this application. Furthermore, none of them are manufactured in an FDA-inspected GMP pharmaceutical manufacturing facility; the proposed finished product in this application will be produced exclusively in a pharmaceutical manufacturer governed by FDA.

Treatment Goals

American Diabetes Association (ADA) glycemic goal is: A1c < 7%, pre-prandial glucose level 70-130 mg/dL, postprandial glucose level <180 mg/dL. American Association of Clinical Endocrinologists (AACE): A1c < 6.5%,  Fast Plasma Glucose <110 mg/dL, 2-hour postprandial glucose < 140 mg/dL. Overall therapeutic goal: to control blood glucose and delay the onset of dangerous complications.

Approaches to Therapy

ADA recommendation: 

Step 1, life style changes plus metformin for the first few months. (Possible problems: patients often do not have energy to exercise and metfomin causes GI upset). Step 2, if ideal A1c level is not achieved or maintained after 3 months, basal insulin or sulfonylurea will be added. (Possible problem: insulin and sulfonylurea cause weight gain, an undesirable side-effect for diabetes patients and patient generally does not like insulin injection.) Step 3, in patients whose A1c is >8, intensive insulin therapy will be added (Possible problem: at this stage, patient education and compliance is very important, there may be some signs of complication shown). At all three steps (stages), the life style management such as exercise, proper diet, etc., is an integral part of the therapy. Lack of energy among diabetic patients is a common phenomenon. An ideal therapy needs to control blood glucose and increase energy at the same time.

Rationale of Adjunct Therapy with Novel Evidence-Based Supplement Combination (NEBSC)

NEBSC is designed to provide energy for patient to exercise and lower glucose on its own to help medication such as Metformin to work better at a lower dose and this will ease the GI upset. Exercise regularly with NEBSC will enable patients to react to diabetes medication better, thus lessen the frequency and perhaps the amount of the medication. The end result could be delaying the progression of diabetes, thus, minimize the complications, minimize the side-effects (such as weight gain associated with prescription drugs by using less), increase energy to exercise for better sensitivity to insulin.  NEBSC can be a valuable non-prescription-based adjunct therapy at all stages of diabetes. It helps lower blood glucose, increase energy to exercise and provide nutrients to help delay deadly complications. Resulting in an overall reduction of health care costs and increase in patient well-being. 

Significance

Considering the comprehensive beneficial ingredients discussed above as supplement-based adjunct therapy agents, we have developed a state-of-art formulation and standardization technology which provides ingredient integrity over the length of the shelf life. We have also determined the ingredient amounts and ranges. A double-blind clinical study is underway with this formula in Crittenton hospital affiliated diabetes clinic.  The goal of the study is whether NEBSC formula decreases A1c after three months of treatment when compared with placebo group.

Currently, the average range of A1c lowering ability of prescription based adjunct therapy agents is 0.5 to 0.70. If our study result falls within 0.1 to 0.5 ranges it will be a remarkable success.  Because it will be more economical to use and with less side effect and well tolerated, this constitutes a major finding in the diabetes therapy.

If successful, diabetes patients will have a better way to help them to control diabetes and delay the onset of diabetes associated deadly complications such as amputation, kidney failure and heart diseases.  In conclusion, this successful finding will save lives around the world.

This could include insulin resistance, pancreatic insulin secretory irregularities, increase of glucagon secretion, over production of glucose in liver and reduction of incretin and other hormonal abnormalities. 
Current diabetes therapy regimen consists of medications which are synthetic chemicals and insulin. Because of the undesirable side-effects and the need to help control better from other mechanism of action, physicians are forced to prescribe additional medications to the two front-line medications (metformin and insulin). The addition of the medication is called adjunct therapy. Over 50% of adult population in the US takes supplements with or without attending physician's approval. The values of supplementation are often debated among health professionals in the US.
However, clinicians in other advanced countries such as Germany and Japan are more open-minded about herbal supplements. Many herbal-based products in these countries are finding ways to become an important part of therapy.
Currently, a few supplement-based adjunct therapy agents are in the market, none with the evidence-based ingredients combination and none followed by a well designed standard as the proposed formula submitted this application. Furthermore, none of them are manufactured in an FDA-inspected GMP pharmaceutical manufacturing facility; the proposed finished product in this application will be produced exclusively in a pharmaceutical manufacturer governed by FDA.
Treatment Goals
American Diabetes Association (ADA) glycemic goal is: A1c < 7%, pre-prandial glucose level 70-130 mg/dL, postprandial glucose level <180 mg/dL. American Association of Clinical Endocrinologists (AACE): A1c < 6.5%,  Fast Plasma Glucose <110 mg/dL, 2-hour postprandial glucose < 140 mg/dL. Overall therapeutic goal: to control blood glucose and delay the onset of dangerous complications.
Approaches to Therapy
ADA recommendation: 
Step 1, life style changes plus metformin for the first few months. (Possible problems: patients often do not have energy to exercise and metfomin causes GI upset). Step 2, if ideal A1c level is not achieved or maintained after 3 months, basal insulin or sulfonylurea will be added. (Possible problem: insulin and sulfonylurea cause weight gain, an undesirable side-effect for diabetes patients and patient generally does not like insulin injection.) Step 3, in patients whose A1c is >8, intensive insulin therapy will be added (Possible problem: at this stage, patient education and compliance is very important, there may be some signs of complication shown). At all three steps (stages), the life style management such as exercise, proper diet, etc., is an integral part of the therapy. Lack of energy among diabetic patients is a common phenomenon. An ideal therapy needs to control blood glucose and increase energy at the same time.
Rationale of Adjunct Therapy with Novel Evidence-Based Supplement Combination (NEBSC)
NEBSC is designed to provide energy for patient to exercise and lower glucose on its own to help medication such as Metformin to work better at a lower dose and this will ease the GI upset. Exercise regularly with NEBSC will enable patients to react to diabetes medication better, thus lessen the frequency and perhaps the amount of the medication. The end result could be delaying the progression of diabetes, thus, minimize the complications, minimize the side-effects (such as weight gain associated with prescription drugs by using less), increase energy to exercise for better sensitivity to insulin.  NEBSC can be a valuable non-prescription-based adjunct therapy at all stages of diabetes. It helps lower blood glucose, increase energy to exercise and provide nutrients to help delay deadly complications. Resulting in an overall reduction of health care costs and increase in patient well-being. 
Significance
Considering the comprehensive beneficial ingredients discussed above as supplement-based adjunct therapy agents, we have developed a state-of-art formulation and standardization technology which provides ingredient integrity over the length of the shelf life. We have also determined the ingredient amounts and ranges. A double-blind clinical study is underway with this formula in Crittenton hospital affiliated diabetes clinic.  The goal of the study is whether NEBSC formula decreases A1c after three months of treatment when compared with placebo group.
Currently, the average range of A1c lowering ability of prescription based adjunct therapy agents is 0.5 to 0.70. If our study result falls within 0.1 to 0.5 ranges it will be a remarkable success.  Because it will be more economical to use and with less side effect and well tolerated, this constitutes a major finding in the diabetes therapy.
If successful, diabetes patients will have a better way to help them to control diabetes and delay the onset of diabetes associated deadly complications such as amputation, kidney failure and heart diseases.  In conclusion, this successful finding will save lives around the world.

story:
Short Summary

Mirco Needle Roller

It's no secret that the economy is bad and the economic pain is spreading. People are finding ways to cut corners to save because they have to face the facts of reality with the economy downfall. But we don't think that should reflect on how you look. You deserve to look good and feel great about yourself regardless of the economic downfall. At Myasiatrade.com we believe in bringing you affordable and quality spa products that can be easily used at the comfort of your own home without you forking out your morgage to pay for it. We strive to give our consumers affordable quality spa products without paying spa prices. Our Micro-Needle Roller, our best-selling inexpensive tool that has been "tried & tested" to stimulate elastin, collagen, banish stretch marks, aid with scarring and more to give you the effects simular to micro-dermabrasion but with many more added benefits for just a fraction of the price. We would like to take this opportunity to spread the word so more of you can take advantage of our affordable Micro-Needle Roller. We don't need to sacrifice our looks! But we want to make this even better for consumers and we need you help to keep this up.

To learn more about this skin tool please visit www.myasiatrade.com

What We Need & What You Get

We are selective with the manufactures that we work with to ensure our consumers are getting high quality products, since there are quite a few manufacture that also produces this tool. We want to make sure the quality we bring to customers is with the best quality and at an afforable price. To increase the market awareness of this tool so more people can enjoy it, we need to obtain a better price from the manufacturer and increase our marketing budget.

To accomplish this goal, we will need your help! No matter big or small, your help can make a difference. We are seeking to raise $5000 for this project. The $5000 will allow us to increase our advertising budget and to provide a budget where we can offer some free samples to different bloggers around the world to help promote this device to their audiences. Inflation has impacted our economy significantly in the past year. Our manufacturer has also increased the cost and we are doing whatever we can to keep the price the same for our customers. Of course, this means we will need to increase the order volume to maintain the same cost level.

Again, our goal is to continue to provide quality spa beauty treatments, gadgets or products to our consumers at affordable prices. In other words, we are providing our customers with wholesale prices and by doing so, everyone can have a quality beauty device that they can afford. Who say's you have to cut down your skin care regimen during tough financial times?

Your help and contribution is greatly appreciated. To show our appreciation, we will provide a cash certificate for you to use on our site. The amount will be the same amount you contribute. We hope you can try our beauty tool and help us increase our order volume so we can continue to keep the prices down. If you can’t contribute today, please help spread the word. Your contributions are greatly appreciated!

story:
"Be The Change You Want To See " Ghandi

Have you ever been out and about and faced the temptation to eat junk food because a healthy alternative was either inaccessible, out of your budget, or waiting in your fridge at home? I have been there before and I’m particularly bothered when I’m in that situation with my nieces and nephews.  Nothing hurts more than giving in to their cries for fast food.  We’ve all hit that "drive- thru" out of convenience.   I was motivated to start Healthy Leaders to help out parents, grandparents, uncles and aunties, like me, who are invested in raising the standard of food that we offer our children.  In 2007 I bought and began restoring the Snack Attack Truck.  With the help of local artists, friends and family, we transformed this mobile food-vending unit into the iconic landmark of Healthy Leaders.


The mission of Healthy Leaders is to inspire emerging generations to develop and sustain healthy bodies and healthy environments. Healthy Leaders was created to engage youth and young adults in healthy living practices by providing programs and services that appeal to their special interests, popular pastimes and learning styles that are current in today's society.


We educate the public about nutrition while extending access to healthy, low-cost foods through the Snack Attack Food Program. To leverage the attention of youth and young adults, we tricked out an ice cream truck, equipped with a sound system and broadcast capabilities to screen visual media.  At school, after school, during lunch hour, or at special events, we bring the party: healthy snacks, fitness activities, food tastings, promotions, green themed merchandise, and meals to go!

 

The Snack Attack Truck serves a wide array of nutritious snacks; fresh produce, a fresh juice bar, baked goods, and an assortment of dry goods such as nuts, popcorn, and dried fruits.  We also offer pre-packaged healthy dinner meals" to go" that contain all the essential ingredients and recipes to make dinner for families. 


This program also provides a mobile platform for community events.  We create a safe space in parks and at after school programs for youth to participate in our go green challenges, fitness trainings, and enrichment activities.  


The Impact

Obesity is the second leading cause of unnecessary deaths in the United States.  Each year in the United States, more than 300,000 people die from obesity-related illnesses.  

Today 64.5% of all adult Americans (about 127 million people) are overweight, 60 million are obese, and 9 million are severely obese.  

About 30.3% of children (ages 6 to 11) are overweight and 15.3% are obese.  For teenagers (ages 12 to 19) 30.4% are overweight and 15.5% are obese.  When young people are overweight, there is a greater chance they will have chronic diseases later in life.  This is because people who become overweight as children usually have less active lifestyle and eat more foods with lots of calories and fats.


25% of all the foods teenagers eat are "junk food," like french fries, candy and soda.  


To address obesity Healthy Leaders has developed new approaches to change cultural norms and attitudes towards healthy living.  We use new media, art, and technology to aid in outreach and education. Our goal is to make health and eco-consciousness a prevalent and lasting trend in communities throughout Los Angeles and eventually across the country. In order to achieve this we make food and fitness fun.  


We Need Your Financial Contribution and Support For:  

Truck Upgrades: 

We are gearing up for the 2011 summer season and we need your help with a few upgrades that will improve our service capacity. 

·      Engine conversion –  When we leave a group of happy kids with smoothies and smiles it’s probably best that they not be left in a pool of exhaust.  We want to demonstrate business practices that support the environment by going green.  That's why we're converting our engine to run on LP (Liquid propane) an alternative fuel source that results in 70% less air pollution.

·      Solar power panels – With solar power we can utilize clean energy to power appliances and equipment.  Food trucks typically use a generator for power.  The benefits of solar energy are elimination of fuel emissions and noise pollution.   Visitors of the establishments we frequent won’t be bothered by the constant roar and fumes from a generator.

·      Kitchen renovation -  We’re expanding our menu to include fresh juice smoothies, salads, sandwiches, and dream cream (our premier coconut base, non-dairy frozen dessert).  We need purchasing power for additional concession equipment, a sink, and a refrigerator.

Community Events: 

·       Go Green Challenge – Once a month, we will host “Go Green” challenges in outdoor settings. The purpose of these events is to provide a rallying point to unite diverse communities that we serve.  During these sessions participants will challenge the body, stimulate their imagination and creativity and cultivate their spirit of adventure.  Youth are paired with young adult mentors and will go through a series of team building exercises that promote fitness and raise eco-consciousness, as well as health awareness.

 

·      Fun-Food-Fitness. - Live, from the Snack Attack Truck, Healthy Leaders will host regional dance contests  throughout the summer.  Each week youth from the surrounding areas can come to compete, hang out and move their feet while we serve refreshing treats.  We’ll videotape dance performances and feature the winner on our site.  Regional winners advance to a final city-wide battle that we’ll host at the beach to close out our summer series.  

$$$

Guess what folks we're already half way there!!!  Private philanthropist Marcia Wright-Tillman has pledged a matching funds donation to help Healthy Leaders reach our fundraising goal of $30,000.  This means that if we can find 1,500 people to give just $10, or 100 people to give $150 dollars, or a single person to give $15,000, we're there!  Seriously everyone, no matter what you can afford to contribute, can support Healthy Leaders' summer launch.  Below is a breakdown of what your funds will go towards:

Item

Estimated Cost

Tune Up

$500

Engine Conversion

$1,000

Alternator/Battery

$500

Solar Powered Panels

$1,000

Smog Check

$180

DMV Registration

$250

Insurance

$2,000

Health Permit

$500

City Vending Permits

$500

Commissary Parking

$450

Sink

$300

Refrigerator

$300

Snow cone machine

$500

Popcorn popper

$300

Soft serve machine

$350

Kitchen Rental

$1,200

Dry good storage containers

$200

Equipment Installation

$1,000

Exterior signs & Advertising

$1,500

Rims

$1,000

Tires

$200

Flat Screen Monitor

$1,000

Internet Connection

$300

Flags, vending & event signs

$500

Staff T-shirts

$200

Wholesale Product Inventory

$2,000

Event Permits

$400

Sporting Equipment

$150

Promotional flyers, posters

$1,000

Fans

$100

Exterior area lighting

$100

Work Space Rental

$200

HD Video Package

$1,500

Audio Package

$1,000

Dance Floor

$170

Backdrop

$150

Prizes/Incentives

$2,500

Volunteers/Student Interns (Stipends)

$5,000 

Total:

$30,000

Spread The Word
Please help get the word out by letting your social network know about this very necessary campaign.  If we all commit to sending an email to just 3 of our contacts, the ripple effect could yield exponentially.  Please post announcements and a link to this campaign on Facebook, twitter, myspace or anywhere you think we might be able to reach supporters.   THANK YOU!

story:
About the campaign…

Men To Be Feared by Rebecca Jane Stokes, produced by One21 Collective has been accepted into the 2012 New York International Fringe Festival! The story itself is a fairytale of sorts that explores the fine line between love, violence and loyalty in a kingdom torn apart by war and ruled by paranoia.

We’re so excited to present the world premiere of Men To Be Feared at FringeNYC – the largest multi-arts festival in North America – now we’ll finally have an international stage to tell stories as only we do…

One21 seeks to push the boundaries of modern day storytelling by utilizing a multifaceted approach in order to reach a broader audience. There’s a reason that Broadway shows are closing left and right, but a YouTube video has millions of viewers. Audiences have changed. By creating a short film that lives online, while producing a play from the same story allows us to expand our reach and bridge this great divide. We are creating a new method of storytelling that both reinvigorates theater and introduces our work to an expanded audience.

To that end, Men To Be Feared will be told in two parts – the first through a short film, shooting in July, and the second through our play at FringeNYC in August. Which is why we need your support!


What we need…

Because we’re used to producing HUGE works on a shoestring budget, we’re looking to raise $6,500, which will afford us the ability to shoot our 7-10 minute short film, and produce our full-length play.

We have a numbers guy that can break it down more specifically, but essentially $2,000 will go to our short film. This includes location and transportation costs, production insurance (yes, we’re creative AND responsible), feeding the cast and crew (we’re also hungry), costumes, props, and equipment rental. The remaining $4,500 will go to our play production. This includes renting rehearsal space, transportation stipends for our actors and crew (thank goodness public transportation is cheap), production insurance (again, safety first), set designer, set construction costs, lighting designer, printing promotional materials, costumes, props, and a light/sound board operator.

We know… you’re amazed at our penny-pinching ways – only $6,500 for all that?!? After living in New York for nearly six years we’ve learned a thing or two about stretching a dollar. Also, we have an amazing group of friends who have generously offered to volunteer their assistance in any way they can! We would LOVE for you to help in any way you can as well (even $1 gets us that much closer to our goal) and in return we have some pretty fun perks to dole out! (Check them out on the right.)


What your contribution means to us…

The WORLD. It’s been our dream to finally showcase the method to our madness. And we know by engaging audiences in new ways not only will we reinvigorate theater but we’ll reinvigorate the arts.

And don’t worry if you can’t contribute financially, sharing this on Facebook and Twitter or even by shouting it out your window is a major help! Thanks in advance for your support and please follow us on Twitter @One21Collective or visit our website www.One21Collective.com to stay up to date on all our happenings!

story:
BACBUDDY : SSD -   Promoting Safe Social Drinking !!!

There is no question that enjoying a drink is fun, and often the more you drink the more the fun increases. However, as many of us know all too well, it is that fine line between being pleasantly drunk and being completely intoxicated which can make the difference between waking up with a headache, or waking up in hospital, and that’s if you’re lucky!
Well, all that can be avoided, while adding to the fun of a great night out with your friends.

And how? With BACBUDDY – the safe social drinking app and smartphone attachment which turns your phone in to a breathalyser. Just download the app, connect your BACBUDDY, and away you go, you’re smartphone’s now a breathalyser! Cool huh?

We think so, and we think it’s cool because everyone with the BACBUDDY can connect with each other and monitor who’s drunk what. Gone are the days when the designated driver can sneak a few drinks, as the BACBUDDY will keep them on the straight and narrow, and often the person who has drunk too much won’t realise, but his friends will, because the BACBUDDY will alert them!

With the BACBUDDY we want you to have fun, but remain safe at the same time!

Have you ever been out in a group and lost someone by the end of the evening? Usually they’re too drunk to answer their phone or they’re in somewhere so noisy, they can’t hear it ringing. What if you’ve just become lost in a busy street and don’t know where everyone has gone? It’s even worse if this happens when you’re in a strange town and don’t know where you are – how can you tell your friends where to find you? This situation becomes even scarier if you are a young woman and it’s the end of the evening.

Thanks to the BACBUDDY design, not only will you be able to see where all your friends are, but they will know where you are too. Don’t you think it’s great to have an app that lets you know everyone has made it home safe and sound, rather than having to face a different scenario when you wake up the next day, because every story should have a happy ending?

Start the evening as you mean to finish it – safe and well. Enjoy your night out, have fun, and let the BACBUDDY keep a watchful eye over you and your friends.

What is BACBUDDY and How can it help you: 

BACBUDDY is the first smartphone application focused on SAFE SOCIAL DRINKING.

The BACBUDDY Gadget converts your smartphone in a portable Breathalyzer system, and manages the BAC results in a responsible way.

 

    


What is a BACBUDDY Party Event:

Let's say you and your friends meet at a party, and some of you have a drink. Just plug the BACBUDDY Gadget into your mobile and fun begins. It's time to start a BACBUDDY Party Event!

 

BACBUDDY Party Event is the new and exciting way to share the Breath Alcohol Concentration with your friends and to promote Safe Social Drinking.

 

Choose your role in a BACBUDDY Party Event!

   BACBUDDY Chauffeur : You are responsible of safe driving, and some BACBUDDIers will come with you. You will only drink soft, non-alcoholic drinks to keep you and your friends safe.

  BACBUDDY Guardian Angel : If there are many of you in the group, you take some of the responsibility during the night out. You are not supposed to drink too much alcohol, and you should keep an eye on other BACBUDDIES.

  BACBUDDY Private: Enjoy yourself, but remember to Drink Alcohol Responsibly.

 

  After you choose your role, BACBUDDY will check your BAC level periodically. Results of all BACBUDDIES will be instantly shared and displayed on the Application Social Score Tab.

In order to prevent a competition to see who can score the highest rating, values above the level of 0.06 % will be displayed as "OVER-DRINKING!".

 

 

 

 BACBUDDY SECURITY WARNINGS

As the App is focused in Safe Social Drinking, it will alert all the BACBUDDIES when the situation becomes potentially unsafe for one, or more of the group.

For example:

  If the BACBUDDY Guardian Angel or Chauffeur has an inappropriate BAC level, BACBUDDIES will be alerted, and either they are advised to stop drinking alcohol immediately, or contingency measures can be taken, like booking a taxi

  If the BACBUDDY Guardian Angel or Chauffeur don't check their BAC level periodically, BACBUDDIES will also be alerted, and advised to take appropriate action.

Track your friends with BACBUDDY Maps Feature!

This is not only a great safety feature of the app if you get separated on a night out – especially if you are one of a group of girls -  but you can also track your friends’ position and supervise their BAC levels. If you lose track of your friends, or they lose track of you, the application can be used to easily identify everyone’s location.

EMERGENCY TRACKER

Sadly is not uncommon for young girls to be raped or even murdered after becoming separated from their friends on a night out. BACBUDDY could have saved lives if it had been used as it is a great tracking device.

In Scotland last year a young man died on his way back home from a night out drinking as he got lost in the snow - if he had had BACBUDDY app, then they would have found him before he froze to death.

Easily find Chauffeur's car with BACBUDDY

  As can happen, after a night drinking, you may not remember exactly where Responsible Chauffeur parked his car. If you are Chauffeur, just click a button when you park your car for the night, which automatically pinpoints its location, and other BACBUDDIES will always know where your car is.

 

 

Have Fun with BACBUDDY Media.

  With BACBUDDY Media you can instantly share or save pictures and videos of the night’s greatest moments. The next day you will have a lot of fun surfing the Party Media from all BACBUDDIES. 

 

 

And lots more social features coming soon!

Depending on user feeback , other social features will be developed:

Block calls or messages to certain contacts when BAC level is inapropiate.

Block facebook and twitter posts. if your BAC level is too high it can save you from sending embarrassing/harassing/inappropriate Tweets/FB postings until the person is sober again!

One Click Call to your Guardian Angel or Chauffeur.

One Click Taxi Call – We want to include this if possible because we are aware that not knowing the number of a taxi is one of the reasons some people use their car to get home, when they know they shouldn’t.

Search BACBUDDIES from different Events Nearby.

BACBUDDY Flirts.

Your ideas are also welcome!

 

Why do we need funds and your support?

We have some prototypes of the BACBUDDY Breathalyzer. However, we need funds to redefine electronic design and go into production mode.

Some funds will be focused on enhance coding for a feature-rich , secure and reliable BACBUDDY Application.

We also need funds to set up a sufficiently powerful internet server to handle the social part of the BACBUDDY Project. Regrettably this costs money.

The Iphone version is also projected, but special permission is required from Apple to make any iPhone hardware accessory. Additional funds will be invested on the Iphone version.

BACBUDDY development costs estimation:

$ 6.000 - Hiring a good coder to improve the Smartphone App.

$ 7.000 - Develop the Iphone version, and get Apple's aproval.

$ 3.000 - Hire an electronic specialist to develop a miniaturized version of hardware.

$ 5.000 - Testing alternative Alcohol Sensor hardware to get the maximum realibility in bac results.

$ 4.000 - Estimated cost of perks.


SUPPORT OUR PROJECT AND RECEIVE A NICE PERK!

The BACBUDDY T-SHIRT

A funny BACBUDDY Key-Chain

A BACBUDDY Stickers

BACBUDDY Bracelet Role Pack

Help us making BACBUDDY a reality for the masses and encourage Safe Social Drinking!!

Be the first to start a BACBUDDY Party Event!!

And what is more important: Remember to Drink Safely & Happy Partying!!!

 

F.A.Q.

How does BACBUDDY Work?

BACBUDDY Gadget has an air intake at the bottom. Just download the app, connect the BACBUDDY to your smartphone, run the app and blow for 4 seconds through the air intake. The result will be displayed on your smartphone screen and shared with the other BACBUDDIES.

How does the BACBUDDY Gadget connect to the smartphone?

We are working in three different connection possibilities:

Earphone interface. PROS: It is compatible with all smartphones. CONS: The Gadget requires charging, and it must be plugged into the smartphone. It does not work remotely.

Bluetooth interface. PROS: There is no need to plug it into the smartphone, so it can be easily shared. CONS: The Gadget has to be paired to the smartphone, and still needs charging.

MicroUSB interface. PROS: No battery needed, so no need to charge the gadget. CONS: Must be plugged into the smartphone. IPhone version needs an adapter, and permission of Apple Inc.

Will the BACBUDDY App be free??

Our intention is to freely distribute the BACBUDDY App.

Who will pay the costs of the BACBUDDY Social Internet Server?

The funds we  earn selling the BACBUDDY Gadgets will be allocated to run the servers for the social aspect of BACBUDDY.

Does every BACBUDDIer need to buy the gadget?

No, the BACBUDDY Gadget can be shared with your friends. Just plug the device into others smartphones and have fun.


Have a question about the BACBUDDY Indiegogo project? Discuss BACBUDDY at Crowdfundingforum.com!

 (BACBUDDY is also known as DRUNK-ABOUT)

story:
L'équipage

Notre équipage est composé de deux amis, Romain MANZINI et Geoffrey MOIGNER, élèves ingénieurs à l'IFMA (Institut Français de Mécanique Avancée) située à Clermont-Ferrand. Tous les deux passionnés de mécanique nous souhaitons nous lancer dans l'aventure du 4L Trophy. Cette expérience serait pour nous très enrichissante autant du point de vue personnel qu'humanitaire.

Si vous souhaitez des renseignements complémentaires concernant notre projet vous pouvez vous rendre sur notre page facebook :

https://www.facebook.com/pages/Tout-pour-L/5413...

Le 4L Trophy

Inspiré par le Paris-Dakar, le 4LTrophy est organisé pour la première fois en février 1998 avec 3 voitures. 16 ans plus tard, ce n’est pas moins de 2700 étudiants dans 1350 4L qui sont attendus en février prochain sur la ligne de départ de Saint-Jean de Luz et de Poitiers pour la 16ème édition ! En effet, du 19 février au 1er mars 2015 plus de 1300 équipages européens s’élanceront pour un défi sportif et humanitaire hors du commun.

Le Raid 4L Trophy est une formidable aventure humaine, sportive et solidaire pour les étudiants âgés de 18 à 28 ans. Il n’est pas question de vitesse, mais d’orientation pour l’emporter. En 2014, 16ème anniversaire de ce grand événement, ce furent plus de 80 tonnes de fournitures scolaires acheminées !

L’objectif est simple :

Parcourir à bord d’une Renault 4L, pendant une dizaine de jours, plus de 6000 km à travers la France, l’Espagne et le Maroc, afin d’acheminer des fournitures scolaires et sportives aux enfants les plus démunis du Maroc.

Objectif quotidien pour les participants au cours du raid :

Rallier l’étape du jour à l’aide d’un road-book, d’une carte et d’une boussole. Le respect de l’environnement est au centre du 4LTrophy et s’inscrit dans une démarche éco-citoyenne.

Vos dons

L'argent récolté servira à financer notre inscription. Nous comptons sur vous pour votre soutien. Merci de nous aider à réaliser notre rêve.

story:
Sharing my Journey: From Near Death to Complete Transformation!

Photo Credit: Left (Matthew Billowes - Jan 11, 2014 ); Middle and Right (Time by TAEM - Jul 6, 2014)

Background

My name is Ayanna Samuels and I am a proud Jamaican Bodybuilding and Fitness/Figure athlete! In July 2014, I successfully competed for the first time, in the Jamaica AmateurBodybuilding and Fitness Association's (JABBFA) National Championships in the Body Fitness Category! I am proud to have won the award for Best Presentation! 

 “For Ayanna to win the title "Best Presentation" in her first National Championship show is a remarkable feat. She trains diligently in order to excel in the sport and to maintain her competitive form.  Well done.” –Sydney Davis, JABBFA President.

Recommendation to Compete Internationally

Coming out of my amazing JABBFA competition experience, I was recommended by a senior JABBFA judge, Audrey Allwood, to compete at the 42nd International Fitness and Bodybuilding Central American and Caribbean Amateur Bodybuilding and Fitness Championships (CACBBFC) in Dutch St. Martin from Oct 2-4, 2014! 

"From as far back as late 2012, I met Ayanna for the first time and thought she had great potential to be a figure/fitness competitor. Her subsequent training and commitment to nutritional discipline has borne fruit and she looked amazing at JABBFA Championships! I am confident Ayanna will continue to grow in this athletic quest to be best in class, and am happy I recommended her to be apart of Team Jamaica at the CAC Championships!” – Audrey Allwood, 3 times Caribbean Lightweight Champion, 2 times Ms. South Florida Champion, 3 times Ms. Jamaica Bodybuilding/BodyFitness Champion

I am shown in the picture above in the blue swimsuit.

My participation was further endorsed by the JABBFA administration and other members of the JABBFA judging panel. Indeed, an additional very touching testimonial came from another certified JABBFA judge who adjudicated at the 2014 JABBFA National Championships, Mr. Andre Seow: "When I first saw Ayanna on-stage at the 2014 JABBFA National Championships, I was immediately struck by the impressive conditioning and tone of her athletic physique. She had obviously been very disciplined and invested tremendous effort. Ayanna is well poised to compete internationally for Jamaica and I unreservedly support her efforts." I am most honoured.

Most intimately, this endorsement was echoed by my amazing trainer Shanique Green.  Shanique placed second in JABBFA's National Championships this year, in the Ms. Jamaica Physique category and I'm humbled by her following testimonial: "Ayanna's focus, drive and determination to accomplish her goal of simply stepping on stage, are the three simple things I believe that propelled her far beyond any expectations. She gives wholeheartedly of her efforts, in and outside of the gym, makes no excuses and gets what she needs to done, without apology. As a trainer, I couldn't ask for a better client. However the real accomplishment is seeing her inner transformation, from unawareness and disregard to self discovery and a true understanding of her own health and wellness consciousness. It is the kind of transformation that will transcend far beyond any competition."

Who am I?

When not training, I am an International ICT for Development Entrepreneur, Technology Policy Specialist and trained Aerospace Engineer. A deeper window into who I am may be had from this interview.

Significance of my Transformation Journey

I am so honoured that I was recommended as a part of team Jamaica for the CAC championships! Here is a review of my deeply rewarding CACBBFC experience. Additionally, this is a short video clip from the championships! JABBFA was unable to fund my CACBBFC expenses and I am grateful that I was able to successfully stage a crowdfunding campaign in order to compete!

Having been recommended to compete internationally means the world to me, in particular because I had 4 car accidents and 4 bicycle accidents over a 4 month span in 2013, the worst of which involved being thrown off my bicycle and landing with my head in front of the back driver's wheel. I am alive today purely because of divine intervention. That accident made me very aware of the gift of life and impassioned to live my best life now!

2013 also saw me struggling with recovering from knee surgery, dealing with an unplanned medical diagnosis, being the victim of a police matter and other such character tests. However these “learning experiences” gave me the extra layers of strength and insight I needed to prepare me for the mental and physical challenge of amateur bodybuilding. Given the emotional upheaval that was 2013, I feel so lucky and blessed to even be on this path.

The challenge of competing at the CAC Championships was especially poignant for me, as it was a living, tangible embodiment of my commitment to getting into the best shape of my life! I have already been on quite a journey, going from 149 lbs 12 years ago, down to 108 lbs and 13.5% body fat on my July 5, 2014 competition day. 

Notwithstanding the noticeable physical transformation, the biggest changes for me have been the spiritual, emotional and psychological changes I have had to effect!

Photo credit: L(Matthew Billowes - Jan 11, 2014); R(Time by TAEM)

Achieving this transformation required me to push way out of comfort zone. I also had to effect holistic changes in my nutrition that I’ve now permanently infused into my life and which have played a significant role in goals achieved thus far. I now am determined to keep pushing so I can excel at the highest levels and proudly represent Jamaica! I think you know that when Jamaicans approach anything in the world of sport, we don’t aim for bronze or silver… we are going for the GOLD!

How You Can Help and What You Get

The CACBBFC was an excellent opportunity. Here is a picture from this stellar event!

However, in order to excel at this fine sport, it is vital that I continue competing. I am very proud that coming out of the CACBBFC, I was further recommended by a distinguished and decorated successful competing veteran Bodybuilder and Bodybuilding and Fitness Coach, to compete at an Oct 25, 2014 Barbados international Bodybuilding and Fitness Championships entitled the 7th Annual Darcy Beckles Bodybuilding Classic (DBBC).

This is the seventh year for the DBBC which continues to grow, both in the level and quality of competitor and audience support. Over the years competitors and supporters have been drawn from USA, Antigua, Bahamas, Bermuda, Grenada, Guyana and Trinidad and Tobago. This event has developed into a high quality show on the Barbadian Bodybuilding calendar.

Last year, the Classic managed to capture an audience in excess of six hundred persons. This year the show will be complimented with a guest posing display by 10 times Ms. Olympia winner, Iris Kyle. It must also be noted that Barbados has a strong Bodybuilding tradition and copped the prize for the most successful competing country at the recently concluded 42nd CACBBFC`in St. Maarten! Confirmation of my being slated to compete at this event may be had by contacting the event organizers through their FB page here. Thank you.

US $1,100.00 will be needed to cover my expenses to compete at the 7th Darcy Beckles Invitational Classic. The funds will cover travel, training, competition attire and other necessities as shown below:

As a show of my appreciation I've also included fun perks to demonstrate my gratitude for your investment in my journey. I'm so looking forward to sharing these perks with you! My hope is that each perk will help you to begin or continue your journey towards serenity, health and fitness! 

The Impact

I cannot represent Jamaica in Barbados without your support! As amateur athletes in a country with a proud history of accomplishment in very many sporting endeavors, it has proved impossible for me to find corporate or state funding to represent Jamaica in Barbados. So now, I am turning to my friends, family and you to help make this dream to grow within Bodybuilding and Fitness Competing a reality!

Beyond the impact of being recommended to represent my country, one of the most heartwarming aspects of my journey thus far has been the way my transformation has not only changed me, but also inspired others. This journey has also proved to me how possible it is to take charge of your life and like the phoenix, go through the fire and come out a much better version of yourself than you would have ever thought possible!

Photo credit: Anthony Mullings

People have told me that my results have motivated them to recommit to, embark upon or continue their individual health quests. It has also created an extended family of sorts, united around the common cause of being our best selves. My hope is that you will join this family and to commit to living your best life now!

Risks & Challenges

My 41 lb weight loss has come through researching information around injury prevention and paying keen attention to detail during my training. The risks and obstacles I may face surround possible injury during training. To mitigate against this, I will ensure I continue to maintain good training standards.

Ways You Can Help Send Me to the CAC Championships!

·  Donating using a credit card or Paypal via the "contribution" button above

·  Depositing a contribution to the First Global Bank Savings Acct # 99085-8867037, Liguanea Branch. This is a Jamaican based bank.

·  Depositing a contribution to Bank of America, please contact me to obtain my BoA acct details. 

Of course, I am brutally aware that everyone’s circumstances differ and some will just not be able to contribute. In such instances, I would be much obliged if you could please still help by: 

·  Getting the word out about my campaign to everyone in your offline and online networks (via social media and emails)! 

·  Using the Indiegogo share tools. Increased campaign viewership could earn me a spot on Indiegogo's homepage!

·  Letting me know of any questions or ideas you may have about this campaign. Your feedback will be welcomed!

I am excited to welcome you along on this awesome journey and I thank you for your support along the ride! I wish I could thank each and every person who has offered me encouragement and motivation, it really takes a village! :)
story_txt:
Sharing my Journey:
From Near Death to Complete Transformation!


Photo
Credit: Left (Matthew Billowes - Jan 11, 2014 ); Middle and Right (Time by TAEM - Jul 6,
2014)


Background
My name is Ayanna Samuels and I am a proud Jamaican Bodybuilding and Fitness/Figure
athlete! In July 2014, I successfully competed for the first time, in the Jamaica AmateurBodybuilding and Fitness Association's (JABBFA) National
Championships in the Body Fitness Category! I am proud to
have won the award for Best Presentation! 
 “For Ayanna to
win the title "Best Presentation" in her first National
Championship show is a remarkable feat. She trains diligently in
order to excel in the sport and to maintain her competitive
form.  Well done.” –Sydney Davis, JABBFA President.

Recommendation to Compete Internationally
Coming out of my amazing JABBFA competition experience, I was recommended by a
senior JABBFA judge, Audrey Allwood, to compete at the 42nd International Fitness and Bodybuilding Central American and Caribbean Amateur Bodybuilding and Fitness Championships (CACBBFC) in Dutch
St. Martin from Oct 2-4, 2014! 

"From as far back as late 2012, I met Ayanna for
the first time and thought she had great potential to be a figure/fitness
competitor. Her subsequent training and commitment to nutritional discipline
has borne fruit and she looked amazing at JABBFA Championships! I am confident
Ayanna will continue to grow in this athletic quest to be best in class, and am
happy I recommended her to be apart of Team Jamaica at the CAC
Championships!” –
Audrey Allwood, 3 times Caribbean Lightweight Champion, 2 times Ms. South
Florida Champion, 3 times Ms. Jamaica Bodybuilding/BodyFitness Champion

I am shown in the picture above in the blue swimsuit.
My participation was further endorsed by the JABBFA
administration and other members of the JABBFA judging panel. Indeed,
an additional very touching testimonial came from another certified JABBFA
judge who adjudicated at the 2014 JABBFA National Championships, Mr. Andre
Seow: "When I first saw Ayanna on-stage at the 2014 JABBFA
National Championships, I was immediately struck by the impressive conditioning
and tone of her athletic physique. She had obviously been very disciplined and
invested tremendous effort. Ayanna is well poised to compete internationally
for Jamaica and I unreservedly support her efforts." I am
most honoured.
Most intimately, this endorsement was echoed by my amazing trainer Shanique Green.  Shanique placed second in JABBFA's National
Championships this year, in the Ms. Jamaica Physique category and I'm humbled
by her following testimonial: "Ayanna's focus, drive and
determination to accomplish her goal of simply stepping on stage, are the three
simple things I believe that propelled her far beyond any expectations.
She gives wholeheartedly of her efforts, in and outside of the gym, makes no
excuses and gets what she needs to done, without apology. As a trainer, I
couldn't ask for a better client. However the real accomplishment is seeing her
inner transformation, from unawareness and disregard to self discovery and a
true understanding of her own health and wellness consciousness. It is the kind
of transformation that will transcend far beyond any competition."
Who am I?
When not training, I am an
International ICT for Development Entrepreneur, Technology Policy Specialist and trained Aerospace Engineer. A deeper window into who I am may be had from this interview.
Significance of my Transformation
Journey
I am so honoured that I was recommended as
a part of team Jamaica for the CAC championships! Here is a review of my deeply rewarding CACBBFC experience. Additionally, this is a short video clip from the championships! JABBFA was unable to fund my CACBBFC expenses and I am grateful that I was able to successfully stage a crowdfunding
campaign in order to compete!
Having been recommended to compete
internationally means the world to me, in particular because I had 4 car
accidents and 4 bicycle accidents over a 4 month span in 2013, the worst of
which involved being thrown off my bicycle and landing with my head in front of
the back driver's wheel. I am alive today purely because of divine
intervention. That accident made me very aware of the gift of life and
impassioned to live my best life now!
2013 also saw me struggling with
recovering from knee surgery, dealing with an unplanned medical diagnosis,
being the victim of a police matter and other such character tests. However
these “learning experiences” gave me the extra layers of strength and insight I
needed to prepare me for the mental and physical challenge of amateur
bodybuilding. Given the emotional upheaval that was 2013, I feel so lucky and
blessed to even be on this path.
The
challenge of competing at the CAC Championships was especially poignant for me,
as it was a living, tangible embodiment of my commitment to getting into the
best shape of my life! I have already been on quite a journey, going from 149
lbs 12 years ago, down to 108 lbs and 13.5% body fat on my July 5, 2014 competition
day. 
Notwithstanding the noticeable physical
transformation, the biggest changes for me have been the spiritual,
emotional and psychological changes I have had to effect!

Photo credit: L(Matthew Billowes - Jan 11, 2014); R(Time by TAEM)
Achieving this transformation required me to push way out of comfort
zone. I also had to effect holistic changes in my nutrition that I’ve now
permanently infused into my life and which have played a significant role in
goals achieved thus far. I now am determined to keep pushing so I can excel at
the highest levels and proudly represent Jamaica! I think you know that when
Jamaicans approach anything in the world of sport, we don’t aim for bronze or
silver… we are going for the GOLD!
How You Can Help and What You Get
The CACBBFC was an excellent opportunity. Here is a
picture from this stellar event!
However, in order to excel at this fine sport, it is vital that I continue
competing. I am very proud that coming out of the CACBBFC, I was further
recommended by a distinguished and decorated successful competing veteran
Bodybuilder and Bodybuilding and Fitness Coach, to compete at an Oct 25, 2014
Barbados international Bodybuilding and Fitness Championships entitled the 7th Annual Darcy Beckles Bodybuilding Classic (DBBC). This is the seventh year for the DBBC which continues to grow, both in
the level and quality of competitor and audience support. Over the years
competitors and supporters have been drawn from USA, Antigua, Bahamas, Bermuda,
Grenada, Guyana and Trinidad and Tobago. This event has developed into a high
quality show on the Barbadian Bodybuilding calendar.
Last year, the Classic managed to capture an audience in excess of six
hundred persons. This year the show will be complimented with a guest posing
display by 10 times Ms. Olympia winner, Iris Kyle. It must also be noted that
Barbados has a strong Bodybuilding tradition and copped the prize for the most
successful competing country at the recently concluded 42nd
CACBBFC`in St. Maarten! Confirmation of my being slated to compete at this
event may be had by contacting the event organizers through their FB page here. Thank you.
US $1,100.00 will be needed to cover my expenses to compete at the 7th Darcy
Beckles Invitational Classic. The funds will cover travel, training,
competition attire and other necessities as shown below:
As a show of my appreciation I've also included fun perks to demonstrate
my gratitude for your investment in my journey. I'm so looking forward to
sharing these perks with you! My hope is that each perk will help you to begin
or continue your journey towards serenity, health and fitness! 
The Impact
I cannot represent Jamaica in Barbados without your support! As amateur
athletes in a country with a proud history of accomplishment in very many
sporting endeavors, it has proved impossible for me to find corporate or state
funding to represent Jamaica in Barbados. So now, I am turning to my friends,
family and you to help make this dream to grow within Bodybuilding and Fitness Competing a reality!
Beyond the impact of being recommended to represent my country, one of
the most heartwarming aspects of my journey thus far has been the way my
transformation has not only changed me, but also inspired others. This journey
has also proved to me how possible it is to take charge of your life and like
the phoenix, go through the fire and come out a much better version of yourself
than you would have ever thought possible!

Photo credit: Anthony Mullings
People have told me that my results have motivated them to recommit to,
embark upon or continue their individual health quests. It has
also created an extended family of sorts, united around the common cause
of being our best selves. My hope is that you will join this family and to
commit to living your best life now!
Risks & Challenges
My 41 lb weight loss has come through researching information around
injury prevention and paying keen attention to detail during my training. The
risks and obstacles I may face surround possible injury during training. To
mitigate against this, I will ensure I continue to maintain good training
standards.
Ways You Can Help Send Me to the CAC Championships!
· 
Donating using a credit card or Paypal via the
"contribution" button above
· 
Depositing a contribution to the First Global Bank
Savings Acct # 99085-8867037, Liguanea Branch. This is a Jamaican based bank.
· 
Depositing a contribution to Bank of America, please
contact me to obtain my BoA acct details. 
Of course, I am brutally aware that
everyone’s circumstances differ and some will just not be able to contribute.
In such instances, I would be much obliged if you could please still help
by: 

· 
Getting the word out about my campaign to
everyone in your offline and online networks (via social media and
emails)! 
· 
Using the Indiegogo share tools. Increased campaign
viewership could earn me a spot on Indiegogo's homepage!
· 
Letting me know of any questions or ideas you may have
about this campaign. Your feedback will be welcomed!
I am excited to welcome you along on this awesome journey and I thank
you for your support along the ride! I wish I could thank each and every person
who has offered me encouragement and motivation, it really takes a village! :)

story:
Brisbane Blaster Bits.

So... Why?

If you're a Nerfer then you'd know about the Stampede. I love the Stampede but it is getting on in years and the plastic the stock gears are made from will crack because of a high spring load and the age of the gears. What I want to do is give the Stampede a new lease on life in the form of upgrade gears made from a stronger polymer.


What Are The Gears Made Of?

The polymer I'm using is a patented formula owned by DuPont. It's the same polymer used in the gears for power windows in cars. Ever tried to hold a power window down while winding the window up? Can't do it, that's how much torque this polymer can handle.

But why not metal? Metal is more expensive and to make it cost effective means making the gears from a cast. Metal will also grind, filing your Stampede with metal dust that will increase wear on other components. Plastic doesn't grind and will slip against itself.

Forget Polycarbonate and Nylon66. This polymer is stronger than both of them!


What I Need & What's In It For You?

I'll just come out an say it, I need AU$30'000 to get this project off the ground. With this money, I can have the tools made, develop prototypes, carry out RnD, QC and testing.

What's in it for you? Each contribution of AU$30 will get you a set of Stampede gears (including the rack that pulls back the plunger tube) and my profound thanks. Not good enough you say? Well, how does a set of Roughcut gears sound? That's Right! Each contribution of $30 will get you a set of Stampede gears AND *Roughcut gears!

* once they've been developed


Risks & Challenges

If I can get the AU$30'000 then the only hurdle would be time.  Once I have the money we're looking at 2-3 months before I start shipping.

All I need are 1000 contributions of AU$30 and we can make rocket go now. We have 40 days to raise that money and any additional funds raised will go straight back into RnD for other products.


Other Ways You Can Help

Tell all your Nerfing friends about this please. Forums, Facebook etc. The more people that know about this then the easier it'll be to raise the money needed.


FAQ.

Q. Why not make them out of metal?

A. This has been covered

Q. when can I expect my gears?

A. Stampede gears should take about 3 months once money is in, I can't say for Roughcut gears though, but they will come.

Q. Why not Polycarb?

A. Polycarb is stronger than ABS plastic, but Nylon66 is stronger than Polycarb. This stuff is stronger than Nylon66

Q. But... polycarb?

A. No

Q. Will shipping cost anything?

A. For Australian contributors, no. Anyone over seas will need to pay for shipping but it won't be much as these are small parts.

Q. What if I contribute and the $30'000 isn't raised

A. Your contribution will be refunded

Q. When will you start production

A. I want to start production at the turn of the new year


Anything I've missed please email me: southbrisbanenerfclub@gmail.com

story:
Help for Amber

Amber is a single mother of 2 active teenagers.  She has struggled working multiple jobs, going to school (graduated in May!), dealing with car repairs, and many other things a single mother has to go through. A few months back, Amber was laid off from her primary job at a hospital but was offered an opportunity to keep working on a temporary/full-time basis in order for her to keep her benefits. Recently, the hospital offered her a new full-time position that she started 2 weeks ago.  

Amber was diagnosed with an aggressive form of breast cancer last month. Her physicians have acted quickly and have teamed up to provide a care plan to help her beat the disease.  Last week, she had a needed double mastectomy. She now has tubes coming out of her and has to sleep a lot. Next week, another surgery will be performed followed by an estimated 1.5 years of chemotherapy. A few days before her mastectomy, she received a letter from her insurance explaining that she would not be covered with financial assistance while she was healing and unable to work because Human Resources still had her as a "temp" & not transferred over to the full-time position that was offered. She will not be able to work for 2 months (not including time off for chemo) and her family and friends have been assisting with food and getting the kids around. Without the financial assistance from her employer's insurance she will not be able to pay bills, co-payments, and take care of her kids. 

Amber is the sweetest woman I have ever met and its painful to see this happen to her. I have been helping the best that I can but I travel for work and can not be there. Her mother has been doing most of the work helping Amber with her medical and daily needs as well as making sure the kids are taken care of.  I can see she is already starting to get burnt out. I am looking to help get Amber and the kids through the next month or two so she can get the treatment she needs and not put her in a worse financial situation that she is already in.

ANY contribution will help. It will go toward her co-payments, groceries, rents, bills, and things along those lines.

story:
Summary

Camp Corazones is an annual camp, now in its 20th year, for the kids & families affected by HIV/AIDS. Majority of the kids who attend this camp, come from poor financial background and travel costs to the camp (there is no fee to attend this residential camp) can be a major decision factor in kids and their families attending the camp. With the help of this campaign, we are hoping to give few scholarships to the kids & families and enable them to come to the camp. 

Some of the kids look forward to this camp year long as it gives them opportunity to get away from their family's daily struggles and unfortunately, the stigma associated with HIV/AIDS. As part of the camp, kids get to do fun activities for four days including rock climbing, science experiments, painting etc. Camp itself was started by Ms. Jewel Cabeza de Vaca in 1995 and since then it has provided camp environment, to affected Kids & families, that focuses and supports children and their families to bond, share meals, make new friends and peer connections.   

PS. Any donations to the camp are 100% tax deductible. In addition, there is no administrative fee and 100% of the donations will go towards the camp and travel grants.


What We Need & What You Get

Unfortunately we don't have enough money and we need at least one thousand dollars to help 20+ kids and their families travel from El Paso, TX to the camp in Santa Fe (over all camp strength this year is approximately 50 kids) . Most of these families are extremely poor and are already taking time off of their work so that their kids can attend the camp. This money will primarily be used for their travel costs. Any additional money will be used for the camp next year. I would like to emphasize that unlike many other charities there are no administrative costs with this camp and all of the money will go towards making the camp an awesome experience for the kids.  

And here are some perks for you being totally awesome:  

$10 - A mention on our website and e-tax receipt. 

$25 - An awesome thank you e-card from us and everything above. 

$50 - A handwritten thank you card from us, a picture from this year's camp and everything above. 

$100 - A Camp Corazones t-shirt and everything above. 

$250 - A special gift (possibly made by the kids during their Arts & Crafts session) and everything above. 


The Impact

The goals of the camp are:

To provide an annual 4-day summer camp at no cost to children between 5-13 years infected/affected with HIV/AIDS.

To provide healthy food and safe accommodations, supervision, camp activities designed for their optimum enjoyment and participation.

To provide a camp environment that focuses and supports children and their families to bond, share meals, make new friends and peer connections.

To provide trained volunteer camp counselors.  Provide two training sessions in May/June. Provide one counselor for every two children, plus Registered Nurses and Licensed Therapists.

To provide staff at camp to assist with the responsibilities and daily schedule of camp activities. To provide direction, supervision and support to volunteers worker.

To plan, organize, implement Camp Corazones staff meetings, volunteer recruitment, community outreach, partnerships, budget and funding resources.

To provide an opportunity for parents to join their children together, providing an opportunity for developing peer support, friendships and mutual interests, contacts and communication that will assist in learning and helping each other.

The camp offers activities and performances as well as opportunities to learn how to deal constructively with the daily challenges of being a child with AIDS or living with a HIV+ family member.

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Please get the word out and share. In order for these kids to attend the camp this year, it is a must that we raise this money.

story:
REMOTE MEDICAL PROGRAM OVERVIEW:

HOLA! My name is Mike and I am a US Marine Corps veteran. I have traveled to Afghanistan, Iraq, and throughout Africa for the US government providing instruction and assistance. Most recently providing instruction to African Union soldiers in combat and remote medicine. In Afghanistan, I assisted in civil infrastructure building to include the instalation of schools and medical clinics. In Iraq, I supported 3 large refugee camps on the border of Syria and Jordan while embedded with the Iraqi Police. The next adventure should be just as rewarding.

Please help me expand on my knowledge of wilderness medicine by assisting me in my journey to volunteer in a remote medical clinic in Ecuador. The assistance provided directly supports children and individuals who do not have access to hospitals or doctors. This program is being ran by the US National Outdoor Leadership School (NOLS) and Mingai, a non-profit in coordination with the Ecuador government in support of remote medicine.

The goal: $4000.00 strictly for travel, lodging, and additional medical equipment.

The Population effected:

The indigenous Kichwa from Sani Isla used to live from agriculture, fishing and hunting, but recently ecotourism offers new source of income, but they still suffer a lot of problems specially lack of medical care and access to hospital due to the remote location only reached by canoe. We’ll have to take a domestic flight to El Coca city and then travel 4 hours by canoe in Napo river to get to Sani Isla community.

The Relief Medic Volunteer Program is designed for individuals in assisting in emergency care where advanced hospital equipment and supplies are absent, and where disease and traumatic injuries are specific to third world conditions. This training and experience offers a unique opportunity to practice pre-hospital care training while using skills to help rural communities lacking medical resources.

These links can provide more information on the program:

http://www.mingai.org/index_ing.html

http://www.mingai.org/pdf/Sani-August-2013.pdf

 

** The above picture is with a little boy named Saddam in Afghanistan, he received a severe traumatic brain injury after being hit by an IED emplaced by the Taliban.  We worked to help Saddam and his family.

THANKS SO MUCH FOR ANY SUPPORT! I APPRECIATE IT SO MUCH!
