In Afghanistan, I assisted in civil infrastructure building to include the instalation of schools and medical clinics. In Iraq, I supported 3 large refugee camps on the border of Syria and Jordan while embedded with the Iraqi Police. The next adventure should be just as rewarding.Please help me expand on my knowledge of wilderness medicine by assisting me in my journey to volunteer in a remote medical clinic in Ecuador. The assistance provided directly supports children and individuals who do not have access to hospitals or doctors. This program is being ran by the US National Outdoor Leadership School (NOLS) and Mingai, a non-profit in coordination with the Ecuador government in support of remote medicine.The goal: $4000.00 strictly for travel, lodging, and additional medical equipment.The Population effected:The indigenous Kichwa from Sani Isla used to live from agriculture, fishing and hunting, but recently ecotourism offers new source of income, but they still suffer a lot of problems specially lack of medical care and access to hospital due to the remote location only reached by canoe. We’ll have to take a domestic flight to El Coca city and then travel 4 hours by canoe in Napo river to get to Sani Isla community.The Relief Medic Volunteer Program is designed for individuals in assisting in emergency care where advanced hospital equipment and supplies are absent, and where disease and traumatic injuries are specific to third world conditions. This training and experience offers a unique opportunity to practice pre-hospital care training while using skills to help rural communities lacking medical resources.These links can provide more information on the program:http://www.mingai.org/index_ing.htmlhttp://www.mingai.org/pdf/Sani-August-2013.pdf
 
** The above picture is with a little boy named Saddam in Afghanistan, he received a severe traumatic brain injury after being hit by an IED emplaced by the Taliban.  We worked to help Saddam and his family.
THANKS SO MUCH FOR ANY SUPPORT! I APPRECIATE IT SO MUCH!

story:
Short Summary

Hey there, My name is Dwight Haber, My story to you is one of love, and dedication to our pet. My family and I come from a low income family and have always struggled financially. I am currently a student interning for an IT consulting Company, and working 30+ hours a week, just to get by, I am up to my neck in student, and life debt, and my parents are under disability.

Recently, we found out that our Dog, Brandy, may have Cancer, and as the only gleam of hope that keeps us optimistic, I can already see the sadness in both my mother and father's eyes. We want to keep our lovely pooch with us as much as possible, so she can live the fullest life she possibly could. Shes 11, and we know she can stay with us for much longer. We're doing everything we possibly can to save her. Short of Bankruptcy.

The finances would be as such:

-$450 for tests and expenses
-$800 for the surgery
-$150 would help lessen the blow of the medication

We can use all that we can get! we're not greedy, we're greatful people settle with what we have. It took me a few solid days to convince my parents to let me do this.

    The Impact

    This would not only bring our pooch back to full health but it would restore joy within our household. We've all been quite gloomy at home, to the point where sometimes, I just can't be there. It hurts to be the weaker one than my parents, I know my time will come where I'll be financially stable, but my parents are older now, and this is the life they live. I want to see them happy again. More Importantly, I want Brandy to be as healthy as can be! she's such an amazing dog, loosing her right now would really put us all down a dark path, and we're doing everything we can to avoid that.

    Other Ways You Can Help

    Just moral support if you can't aid financially. Anything helps, at these times Brandy needs all the love and support that she can get, even though, she gets a tonne from us :) Thank you so so so much, Feel free to contact me personally and ask me any questions.

story:
God bless, my name is Arthur Lindquist and I am an "end stage renal failure" patient. I receive 6 hour dialysis treatments 3 nights per week at a Davita Dialysis facility. These treatments almost always leave me without energy, and with extreme muscle pains. (The feeling of getting the wind knocked out of you lasting for sometimes an hour is close to the feeling when my abdominal muscles decide to cramp). This leaves me unable to work and at the mercy of a small disability check each month. I recently had my Parathyroid glands removed so that my bones would stop causing agony from pain of losing calcium. I was also set back a lot by a tornado that left me without clothing and my apartment for a year (attached video) in April of 2013. I am so blessed to have my sister's who set up a raffle benefit in my honor which allowed me to purchase some clothing and pay my gas and electric bills off. My older sister also allowed me to stay in her small home along with 10 other people until I could get my apartment back.

This campaign was the idea of friends and family who want me to raise money to allow me to pay off old student loans so I can get back in school (Mechanical and Structural Engineering), also to get a reliable vehicle to get to and from my dialysis treatments. I am also in need of food, cleaning supplies, toiletries, furniture, clothing, vacuum, amongst other things. I am a man that can have too much pride at times, but I am DESPERATE.

 The funds collected during this campaign will go to myself, Arthur C Lindquist Jr, to help me in ALL the aspects of what it will take to accomplish these large and small goals. I also have a goal of a healthy kindney transplant my body sees as its own. I want to see that day come and I'm sure the 18 children from my multicultural family that consider me their UncleArt, and the rest of my friends and family want to see that day come too. These donations will allow me to buy healthier foods that align with the very specific diet I have to be on, yet can't afford alone.

I picked $100,000 as my goal and it even seems high to me, yet even just a fraction of it will help me to accomplish these different goals together. If the donation goal isn't met, all funds acquired will help as stepping stones as every dollar received will be well spent.


Even if you can't contribute, you can still help. Please Share my story using this site's tools, and those of other popular SHARE sites. 

 

P.S. YOU ARE A BLESSING JUST FOR READING THIS. MAY GOD BLESS YOU BACK 100 FOLD. 


Thank YOU

story:
Meet Jen Pellingra. She's 35 and has built a thriving massage therapy practice. She owns a house with her mom and enjoys her life. She contributes to the health and well being of her community both through her work by her contributions.

Jen has thyroid cancer, but she doesn't have insurance, and she needs help covering the cost of care.

As a licensed, practicing massage therapist, Jen Pellingra has dedicated her life to helping heal others. She works in a small chiropractic office in northern Westchester County, NY. She keeps her rates low so that her work is accesible to all.

In 2001, Jen's father, a disabled Vietnam veteran, died and left behind a massive pile of debt (over $200,000). Jen assumed responsibility for debt, took over the mortgage on her parents' home, and continued to serve her community.

Every year Jen Pellingra donates much of her time and almost $1000 annually in massage gift certificates to local fundraising efforts.

Jen has always put everyone else's needs above her own. Because the clinic where she works fights to provide affordable care for everyone in the community, Jen's job hasn't been able to provide her with insurance. And because she's been working to pay down her father's debts and take care of her mother, she hasn't had enough money to buy insurance for herself. She also makes too much for Medicare.

So, Jen's stuck between a rock and a hard place, and needs help to cover the cost of her care.

Fortunately, the prognosis for thyroid cancer is very positive, and treatment is fairly simple. First, Jen needs to have her thyroid gland removed. Doctors have also found a small spot on her lung, which they plan to remove as well. Once Jen's thyroid glad has been removed, she'll see the doctors for rounds of follow-up and testing, and will be put on medicine to replace the hormones that her thyroid will no longer be producing. After that, she'll need a round of radioiodine treatment to make sure the cancer is wiped cleanly from her body.

Sounds pretty easy, right? It would be if Jen had insurance. But, because she doesn't, the whole process is made much, much more difficult. Jen will have to have multiple exams and tests, she'll spend days in a hospital, and she'll be treated by a team of surgeons, anesthesiologists, radiologists, their assistants, nurses, and a host of other doctors.

"This has been a powerful experience" says Jen. "I've been learning to take more time for myself, to de-stress and to provide myself with all the things I recommend to clients and friends. I know that once I get this surgery I can get back to doing what I love doing. Now only better because I'm starting to take care of me."

Jen's family and friends have banded together in solidarity to help her beat this disease, but there's still more ground to cover. Please help Jen get healthy again. Help her get back to doing what she does best: helping others in the community she loves.

This is Jen. Thanks so much for helping and please browse the links below to see our campaign links and videos! Keeping things upbeat, positive and healing!!!!!

story:
About Me

My name is Alister Miller. I'm a 20 year old Digital Art student living in Maryland and studying at Towson University. I realized I was transgender around the age of 15 and, with the invaluable support of my family and friends, have been living as male since. I am taking hormone replacement therapy, and now it's time for the next and final step of my transition.


About My Goal

What does it mean to be transgender?

Transgender is an umbrella term used to refer to when an individual's biological sex does not match that of their gender. While it is often grouped with the LGBTQ* community, it's important to note that transgender is not a sexual orientation, and instead an expression of one's gender.

Female to male (FtM) trans* individuals oftentimes change their appearance in order to more accurately reflect their gender identity and to feel more comfortable in society. One of the most common change in appearance is compressing the breasts in order to create a male-looking chest. Even though there are 'safe' ways to chest-bind, some of the dangers of compressing the chest include rib bruising or fracturing, difficulty breathing, spinal and shoulder problems, and lack of circulation to the general area.

What is Top Surgery?

Top surgery allows for a presentable and convincing male appearance through the removal of the breasts for FtM individuals. Individuals who have had top surgery can live their lives much more comfortably without having to deal with chest binding.

The surgery takes 4-6 weeks of recovery time. Since I am a student, I can't afford to take off a month or more from my classes in order to recover. That's why I plan to schedule my date over the winter break, so that I will be healed by the time the spring semester begins.

What does my goal of $8,000 cover?

$8,000 covers the cost of surgery, hospital fees, surgery date deposit, roundtrip airline tickets for my mother and myself to the hospital in Florida, a hotel room for the week that I will be down there, food and taxi money. Any additional money that my campaign raises will go towards paying my monthly apartment rent while I recover from surgery.

$500 has been added to the overall goal to pay for indiegogo fees.


Contributor Perks

  • $1 Perk Tier


  • $5 Perk Tier


  • $10 Perk Tier


  • $20 Perk Tier (Limited Number Available!)


  • $30 Perk Tier


  • $50 Perk Tier ($65 for Mailed Print) (Limited Number Available!)

story:
Short Summary

Wallish Wonders Unrivaled Cookies was established in 1999 to offer a revolutionary twist on the ordinary cookie. Our gourmet product is the result of intense focus placed on quality and combination of ingredients to create the most uniquely delicious cookies unrivaled anywhere.

My dream has been to offer the world the equivalent of the best tasting cookie they can get their hands on. I am passionate that food be memorable and offer a component of health. That's where I live and breath. I have the highest regard for nutritionally rich and quality ingredients and it serves me well as the designer of an unrivaled version of the 67 year old traditional chocolate chip cookie.

My background is corporate business management and sales. Today I work as a holistic health and nutrition coach, certified since 2010. I'm deeply driven by making people happy, and enhancing their everyday experience. My mission around the unrivaled cookies is to ignite unyielding and lasting snacking pleasure and the surety of a natural encounter.

What We Need & What You Get

Where does my money go?

Building Build-out and Signage $5,500

Commercial Baking Equipment $12,500

Full Line Package Design, and Printing $4,800

Our plan is to use an unoccupied commercial space in the quaint neighborhood of Miller Beach, Indiana, and to build out a commercial cookie kitchen. I'm a new member to this community and am excited to bring the sweet smell of cookies and contribute to the continued revitalization of the already beautiful landscape which is Lake Street.

Your money will go directly towards our build out. We'll need to demolish interior walls, pull up carpet, tend to the floor underneath, power wash and treat the gorgeous tin ceiling, and frame the structural walls. There's always risk uncovering floors and removing walls in old buildings but we're expecting positive outcomes all along the way. Once the rubbish has been hauled away and upgrades have been completed, we can bring in the used kitchen equipment and build a bakery. Each commercial piece, carefully placed, brings ease to the baking and creative process. 

You can expedite this effort and allow Wallish Wonders to expand the production of  gourmet cookies, creating a brand for the growing retail markets with professional packaging. We'll soon be able to ship fresh cookies from our door to yours, grow our brand, and create a regional Midwestern foothold reaching more and more cookie lovers.

We'll use all that we raise to make a progressive impact on the project set forth. That's how it works.

Should we exceed our goal, those additional funds will be used to redesign and add online sales to our website, and to build an industry tradeshow booth for national exhibition. This increases our opportunity to be picked up by larger specialty retailers and magnify the brand - sharing the love of all things natural and delicious.

The Impact

"In the 6 months that I have know Elizabeth, I have formed several opinions about her company. Foremost would be the tenacity in which she pursues business ventures. She has an excellent and very unique product. She is very thorough in her research. She is fearless being a hands-on business owner. During the course of my career I have seen a lot of businesses both succeed and fail. I believe that Elizabeth Wallish has what is takes to become a very successful entrepreneur"

~ Brenda Gloor, Key Account Consultant, Westco-BakeMark

As Wallish Wonders achieves these goals, we'll be able to unfold our ultimate intention. That is to develop both savory and gluten-free cookie lineups with your health in mind that emulate the original unrivaled cookie recipes. So get ready, and join the campaign!

Other Ways You Can Help

Money isn't all that matters, so If you are unable to contribute for any reason, please share our story and this link with your friends and family. We appreciate you helping get the word out - and making some noise about the campaign. It's really simple, just use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that’s all there is to it.

Thanks for being such a HUGE part of our success!

Much love,

Elizabeth

story:
As a participant in the Buds to Blossoms Pediatric Massage Volunteer Program, I will be traveling to Vietnam in July. There I and my fellow volunteers will work at an AIDS orphanage providing gentle pediatric massage to foster children's health, well-being and development.

Although the infants and children we'll work with receive treatments which both help them recover and slows progression of the disease, some of them continue to have AIDS-related medical problems. They live in an orphanage where there are relatively few adult caregivers and volunteer help is crucial to meeting their needs.

Massage is of particular value to the children because its immune system-strengthening effect may improve their compromised health. Massage also promotes the children's well-being by bringing relief from pain and anxiety and helping meet their emotional and developmental needs for one-on-one nurturing attention and touch.

As a PhD student, the cost of the trip is an obstacle. To have the opportunity to be of service to these children, I need your help. Please support me in providing direct care to AIDS orphans by donating today.


Please also support Buds to Blossoms and the children by helping spread the word about this program. You can do that by sharing the link to the Buds to Blossoms website (www.budstoblossoms.org) on facebook and twitter and forwarding this information to your friends, family and coworkers.

Thank you so much for supporting me, Buds to Blossoms and the children we serve.

With gratitude,
Jonathan Whittle-Utter, Certified Massage Therapist
Buds to Blossoms Volunteer
www.budstoblossoms.org

story:
Short Summary

My name is Walt Drennan and I was diagnosed with Type 1 Diabetes over 13 years ago in 2000.  Type 1 diabetes is an autoimmune disease that causes the pancreas to stop making insulin which the human body needs in order to convert food into energy. 

The complications and struggles that come with Type 1 Diabetes are wide and varied: constant blood sugar checks, managing insulin because our pancrease just doesn't do it any more, counting carbs to know how much insulin is needed at any given time, the list goes on and on. BUT I have never been one to let my Type 1 keep me from doing awesome stuff. That's why I will by cycling with a team of 30 over 4000 miles from Baltimore, Maryland to Portland, Oregon with an organization called the 4k for Cancer. 

The 4k for Cancer is a non-profit that raises money for support, education, and college scholarships for young adult cancer patients and survivors. A large portion of the money my team and I raise will actually go towards a college scholarship that we will hand deliver to its recipient.

Now I know that Type 1 Diabetes and Young Adult Cancer aren't inherently linked but as the only Type 1 Diabetic on my cross country team I saw a really great opportunity to champion two very different and worthy causes. To instill hope in those struggling with cancer that they aren't alone in their fight while also showing the Type 1 Diabetics of the world that diabetes doesn't have to hold them back from taking on extreme adventures. 

What We Need & What You Get

As a member of the 4k for Cancer Portland team I am responsible for raising a minimum of $4,500 dollars. This money then goes towards support, education, and scholar ship programs for young adult cancer patients and survivors as well as the college scholarship that my team and I will be delivering along our cross country route. 

But since I am also a representative of the Type 1 Diabetic community I also thought that I would take the opportunity to raise money for Type 1 organizations that encourage young people and adults to remain active while managing their diabetes. That is why I will be donating exactly half of all the donations gained from this campaign to a Diabetes non-profit that works towards keeping Type 1 Diabetics active and healthy while managing their Diabetes. 

I'll be creating a campaign like this every month up until June and each month I'll choose a different Diabetes non-profit to gift that months donations to. In this way I'll not only be able to show the world how I'm not going to let my Type 1 Diabetes hold me back but I'll also be raising money for organizations that work to teach other young diabetics the exact same thing. 

By helping me, you become a part of my cross country journey and part of my inspiration for pedaling all the way to the West Coast. Those that make donations will receive a personalized postcard from me as I bike my way to Portland. I will also be writing their names on a poster board that I will bring with me on the trip and will take a photo with at every state line I cycle through.

The Impact

The effects and struggles of both Young Adult Cancer and Type 1 Diabetes are great. They both are a fight and a donation to my campaign will ensure that organizations that are dedicated to helping those afflicted with cancer or type 1 diabetes get the help and support that they need. 
Any donation you decide to make will be divided between my 4k for Cancer ride and the Riding On Insulin:
At present, 70,000 young adults are diagnosed with cancer each year, affecting not just those diagnosed but also their families, friends, and loved ones. It is the goal of the 4k for Cancer to make sure that none of these people have to face their battle with cancer alone. Through support, education, and college scholarship programs, the 4k for Cancer helps by improving the ability of young adults to manage their cancer experience and long-term cancer survival. 
Riding On Insulin empowers, activates and connects the global diabetes community through shared experience and action sports. In addition to establishing a comfortable environment, we strive to help families explore new passions, challenge the illness, and celebrate each other’s successes.
I firmly believe that while life with Type 1 Diabetes is rough, it is far from impossible. What better way to prove it than to ride my bike 4000+ across the country?  And if I can do it for a good cause, well that just makes it that much more meaningful. Help me show young Type 1 Diabetics everywhere that their diabetes doesn't have to hold them back. 
Other Ways You Can Help

Remember everyone: donations aren't the only way you can help me and my campagin.  You can also help me by spreading the word about my cause to your friends and family.  

You can also follow me along my journey as I get read to make my ride, by visiting my blog (which I will be writing both before and during my ride).  Support from the diabetes community would be so amazing to have as I take my Type 1 and a bike across the entire country!
story_txt:
Short SummaryMy name is Walt Drennan and I was diagnosed with Type 1 Diabetes over 13 years ago in 2000.  Type 1 diabetes is an autoimmune disease that causes the pancreas to stop making insulin which the human body needs in order to convert food into energy. The complications and struggles that come with Type 1 Diabetes are wide and varied: constant blood sugar checks, managing insulin because our pancrease just doesn't do it any more, counting carbs to know how much insulin is needed at any given time, the list goes on and on. BUT I have never been one to let my Type 1 keep me from doing awesome stuff. That's why I will by cycling with a team of 30 over 4000 miles from Baltimore, Maryland to Portland, Oregon with an organization called the 4k for Cancer. The 4k for Cancer is a non-profit that raises money for support, education, and college scholarships for young adult cancer patients and survivors. A large portion of the money my team and I raise will actually go towards a college scholarship that we will hand deliver to its recipient.Now I know that Type 1 Diabetes and Young Adult Cancer aren't inherently linked but as the only Type 1 Diabetic on my cross country team I saw a really great opportunity to champion two very different and worthy causes. To instill hope in those struggling with cancer that they aren't alone in their fight while also showing the Type 1 Diabetics of the world that diabetes doesn't have to hold them back from taking on extreme adventures. What We Need & What You GetAs a member of the 4k for Cancer Portland team I am responsible for raising a minimum of $4,500 dollars. This money then goes towards support, education, and scholar ship programs for young adult cancer patients and survivors as well as the college scholarship that my team and I will be delivering along our cross country route. But since I am also a representative of the Type 1 Diabetic community I also thought that I would take the opportunity to raise money for Type 1 organizations that encourage young people and adults to remain active while managing their diabetes. That is why I will be donating exactly half of all the donations gained from this campaign to a Diabetes non-profit that works towards keeping Type 1 Diabetics active and healthy while managing their Diabetes. I'll be creating a campaign like this every month up until June and each month I'll choose a different Diabetes non-profit to gift that months donations to. In this way I'll not only be able to show the world how I'm not going to let my Type 1 Diabetes hold me back but I'll also be raising money for organizations that work to teach other young diabetics the exact same thing. By helping me, you become a part of my cross country journey and part of my inspiration for pedaling all the way to the West Coast. Those that make donations will receive a personalized postcard from me as I bike my way to Portland. I will also be writing their names on a poster board that I will bring with me on the trip and will take a photo with at every state line I cycle through.The ImpactThe effects and struggles of both Young Adult Cancer and Type 1 Diabetes are great. They both are a fight and a donation to my campaign will ensure that organizations that are dedicated to helping those afflicted with cancer or type 1 diabetes get the help and support that they need. Any donation you decide to make will be divided between my 4k for Cancer ride and the Riding On Insulin:At
present, 70,000 young adults are diagnosed with cancer each year, affecting not
just those diagnosed but also their families, friends, and loved ones. It is
the goal of the 4k for Cancer to make sure that none of these people have to face
their battle with cancer alone. Through support, education, and college scholarship
programs, the 4k for Cancer helps by improving the ability of young adults to
manage their cancer experience and long-term cancer survival. Riding On Insulin empowers, activates and connects the global diabetes community through shared experience and action sports. In addition to establishing a comfortable environment, we strive to help families explore new passions, challenge the illness, and celebrate each other’s successes.I firmly believe that while life with Type 1 Diabetes is rough, it is far from impossible. What better way to prove it than to ride my bike 4000+ across the country?  And if I can do it for a good cause, well that just makes it that much more meaningful. Help me show young Type 1 Diabetics everywhere that their diabetes doesn't have to hold them back. 
Other Ways You Can Help
Remember everyone: donations aren't the only way you can help me and my campagin.  You can also help me by spreading the word about my cause to your friends and family.  You can also follow me along my journey as I get read to make my ride, by visiting my blog (which I will be writing both before and during my ride).  Support from the diabetes community would be so amazing to have as I take my Type 1 and a bike across the entire country!

story:
FIRST THE SOLUTION...A water filter that provides clean water for between 400 to 600 people at a cost of less then 30 cents a day - significantly less then a bottle of water.  This filter is designed for easy cleaning thorough a simple back-washing procedure that takes approximately 3 minutes twice a week.  With regular cleaning the filter lasts for 44 years or more.

How it works: A 600 hundred liter tank receives the water from a local source.  Contaminated water passes through 4 layers of sand and gravel to remove most of the turbidity.  Leaving the tank, the water passes through a 50 micron filter and then through a 0.1 micron hollow-fiber filter membrane.  This exacting filter has no electrical parts and provides 11 liters of bacteria free water per minute with only 7 pounds of pressure.

THE SPARK...

Although water is vital to all forms of life - only 7% of the earth's water is consumable...7%.  ONE in NINE people do not have access to clean water.  I.6 million children die per year because of unsafe water, poor sanitation and lack of hygiene.  In Huayllarqocha, NO ONE had access to clean water.  What to do?

We found a partner in Aqua Clara International who helped us install a water filter in the community that serves 400 to 600 hundred people.  The filter lasts for over 44 years, is easy to maintain, and has no electrical parts.  Less then 30 cents a day for 400 to 600 people - less then one bottle of water - clean water for a village for 44 years.

WHAT WE NEED

The fourteen indigenous communities surrounding Cusco need and want water filters.  75% children and elders have illness that come from drinking contaminated water.  We seek $28,000 to install the next three water filters. 

This money covers material costs, transportation, housing and tools.  Each village is trained in how to maintain the water filters.  Courses for adults and children include information about the importance of clean water, hygiene and sanitation will be taught during the installation process.   Follow-up visits will be made to all communities approximately eight months after installation to make sure the the filter is functioning correctly and is well maintained.  We will document the installation process, record how the water filters are functioning interview community members about use of the filter & change in health conditions. 

UPON REVIEW - IMPACT IN HUAYLLARQOCHA

In May of 2013 we installed the first water filter in the village of Huayllarqocha. This past March 2014 we visited the village once again to conduct an evaluation on the water filter.  We were particularly interested in reviewing the condition of the water filter, how the filter was being maintained, how many people were using the water filter regularly, and what if any change there were in the health issues that prompted the installation of the filter. 

We found the filter in perfect condition.  The community built a wall in the area surrounding the filter so that the livestock cannot get close to the water source.  The filter is cleaned regularly twice weekly.  Approximately 87% of the village residents use the water filter regularly for drinking and for cooking.  Incidences of the chronic diarrhea are beginning to decline.  

Huayllarqocha is a success story that can easily be replicated.  They are developing a business plan for testing, bottling and selling the clean water to tourists.  In addition to making a small business, Huayllarqocha is also taking a leadership role in teaching the next communities the value of clean water, how the filter works, and how to maintain the filter.  

Huayllarqocha has reached out to near-by communities – spreading the news about the value of clean water and what it means in terms of the health and well-being of the community.  As we move forward they are our most valued partner.  As an indigenous community with experience in using and integrating this filter into their community, they are invaluable teachers for others. Alliances are being formed between local government agencies and community groups.

Our Gifts of Gratitude

  • Magic water whistles

  • Hand-woven Andean water bottle holders

  • A collection of photos from the village

  • Handcrafted Omar La Rosa  flutes

  • Handcrafted Andean Antaras (pan pipe flute)

All money raised goes to putting in as many water filters, training about maintenance for the filter, learning how to clean water, hygiene and sanitation.  This is the first of many fund raising efforts - there are 14 indigenous villages surrounding Cusco.

The mission of the Kumpi Mayu Foundation is to bring clean water to all in need.  We are in the process of securing our tax exempt status.  We will send tax exempt receipts for all donations.

story:
Story behind iSense:

My wife and I have a son that is 3 years old now. He was often sick and had high temperature, as most kids have at that age, especially when he started going to kindergarten.

So, we had lots of sleepless nights just to check his temperature.  Unfortunately we had to wake him up just to check his temperature as well as we did not trust our contact and ear thermometer. Feeling very tired in the mornings, to say at least, we found a solution. And now we present it to you.

iSense is intelligent solution for addressing this problem.

You just strap it around your childs abdomen, switch the power on and connect to your android device with bluetooth.                (*EDIT#1 :as for some peoples concerns and comments about it being uncomfortable for children or them being exposed to danger of choking let me clarify: First you do not over tighten or leave it too loose, also you will of course dress your child on top of the sensor thus eliminating possibility of choking)(*EDIT#2 : for concerns about bluetooth radiation: iSense uses Bluetooth class2 bluetooth sensor with range of up to 10m, class2 devices have never been proven to have any adverse effect, some bogus claims have been coming from people who are trying to sell radiation (EMF) eliminating equipment, crystals, rings, necklaces, etc.)

Start the iSense application (free download will be available) on your device and set temperature for the alarm.(when a child has a fever we set it to 38,5°C so we know its time to give him antipyretic medicine to lower his temperature). You can choose the way it alarms you, either by sound or vibration so it makes sure you wake up. Besides this it has an advanced function of calling or sending SMS message to a chosen phone number – this has various advantages. Lets say you leave your child with a babysitter or send him to kindergarten you can always know if he gets high temperature – really smart isn’t it? Also you can monitor temperature in real time and see the temperature history graph curve. Take that temperature graph curve to your doctor to have a third hand in diagnosing sickness.

Also it can be used with anyone as it comes with two sized comfortable velcro bands (old people, extreme athletes, etc.)

Tired of looking around for batteries?  no problem as it comes with rechargeable battery that lasts 40+ hours. Just charge it through provided USB cable on any device with 5V standard USB port.

It all comes in a quality built plastic shell and with stable android app.

iSense has been on testing for more than 1 year to prove its stability and now it is ready for the market, however as it is only part of the complete system that includes your own android device we cannot take responsibility for malfunction on that account. Please also note that this is not professional medical device and as such should not be used.

What We Need 

We need $2000 to finalize the android application (professional graphic design to make it complete) and to design and manufacture packaging for distribution.

  • First batch of iSense is already manufactured and awaiting packaging so you can be assured it will find a way to you


What You Get

You will be the first to get iSense at prices to be never repeated. You will also get a device that is unique in its functions and helps in tough situations

If You believe in our product and want to help us get the word around the social networks and a word of mouth we will reward you:

  • If you refer 5 people that pledge $40 or more we will send you one iSense free of charge together with your selected perk, you have to be a backer yourself.

We believe that iSense can improve everyone's quality of life!!!

So spread the word around and lets make everyone's life easier!!!


Functions i specifications:

1. charge port   2. LCD display   3. On/Off switch   4. Temp. unit button

5. Unit Temperature   6. Connections status   7. Battery low alarm

- Bluetooth connection with android phone (v2.2 and higher)
- Realtime body temperature monitor
- History data curve for body temperature
- Alarm when body temperature reaches user set value
- Alarm by vibrating and ringing the phone
- Can make a alarm phone call or/and send SMS to another phone
- Comfortable wearing from babies to elderly people with velcro bandage
- ℃/℉ switchable temperature units
- Operating range: 35.0℃～43.0℃/95℉～109.4℉
- Relative precision: 0.1℃/0.18℉
- Rechargeable battery lasts 40 hours from fully charged


- Charge by USB cable from any 5V USB charger/laptop/computer etc.(USB cable supplied)

- Bluetooth specification: 2.1+EDR, class 2
- Effective distance 10m
- Free app download
Package includes:
- 1x iSense Thermometer
- 1x USB charging cable
- 2x velcro straps (S and L size)

story:
Do you or your partner snore or stop breathing at night?

Do you suffer from insomnia?

Do you sleepwalk?

Do you act out your dreams at night and wake up bruised?

Could you have narcolepsy?

We spend a third of our lives asleep - and yet very little is known about sleep itself or  the best ways of treating sleep disorders, like sleep apnoea in Down's Syndrome, managing sleep problems in adults and children with intellectual and physical disability and brain pathways involved in sleep-walking and other sleep disorders.

Sleep research is under threat because of increasing demands on funding resources, coupled with the economic downturn. 

The research unit in Edinburgh is working on many of aspects of sleep disorders. We are one of the most highly cited centres in the world in the field of sleep medicine and have been diagnosing and treating sleep disorders in adults for over 30 years. 

For a list of our achievments, please visit us on: http://www.ed.ac.uk/schools-departments/clinical-sciences/sleep-research-unit

Each year, less and less money is being given to research overall. In this economic climate, even the best, cutting-edge scientific and research proposals don’t get funded sometimes. So important projects that can immediately change people’s lives for the better either don’t get done or get cut short.

Projects in jeopardy are:

1.  Diagnosing and treating adults with Down's Syndrome who have sleep problems.

We have found that fewer than 1 in 100 people with Down's Syndrome get investigated and treated for this important problem even though 1 in 3 people with Down's Syndrome have sleep apnoea. Treatment could lead to improved daytime function, reduce sleepiness and improve performance.

2.  Teaching and outreach to parents of children with sleep problems, in the context of mental health issues or disability.

There are very few resources in the community to help parents and children with these issues and even fewer for adults with problems and we are working hard to find out the best way to deliver important educational strategies and support.

3.  Developing new ways of diagnosing sleep walking at night.

4.  Assessing brain imaging patterns in people with narcolepsy, sleep apnoea and other sleep problems using MRI.

Your support could help us achieve important treatment goals that could impact immediately on your health, or the health of a family member, loved one, friend or even the person who drives the bus or the train you take to work (you don’t want them falling asleep at the wheel)!

We have set a target, but every little helps!

What will my money be used for?

Funds will be used for:

1.  Patient outreach.

2.  Purchase of equipment for diagnosing sleep breathing problems (one portable piece of equipment costs around £6000)

3.  MRI testing to assess sleep pathways in the brain

Sleep disorders are very common. Up to 1 in 5 of us snores or has breathing pauses at night, with 1 in 20 of us having sleep apnoea. 3 out of 100 adults sleep-walk. We know that long-term shift workers are at increased risk of health problems and sleep apnoea can make dementia worse and possibly increase your chance of getting heart disease, stroke and cancer.

Not all sleep centres deal with the same topics, issues and problems that we do. Our focus is mainly clinical and our results have an immediate impact on people’s well-being – not just locally, but through spreading the word at conferences and writing papers that impact nationally and internationally so that our findings can be adopted by doctors and patients everywhere.

We collaborate with researchers in more basic scientific research fields such as genetics, inflammation and mouse-models which help to unlock exciting new avenues for helping sleep disorder sufferers.

What’s in it for me?

First - A BIG THANK YOU FOR READING THIS PAGE!

Our research could directly be targeting your sleep problem, a related problem or the problems of someone you know and care about!

Even the smallest donation helps and for those of you who can help a bit more, we extend a small token of appreciation. Results from our work will be available on our website and can be sent directly to all donors as requested.

If you are unable to contribute, please help us spread the word. Sleep is something we do every single day of our lives and bad sleep impacts on us all, individually and on society. Sleep research is important.

Share our campaign with your family and friends. For those of you who might live locally, come and see us at the Edinburgh International Science Festival on April 13th this year: http://www.sciencefestival.co.uk/whats-on/categories/talk/from-yawn-to-dawn

Thank you!

N.B. When about to hit paypal/credit card button the account name will appear as Renata Riha -  this is done for legal reasons. Rest assured all funds are accounted for and will be used for the stated research

conferences and writing papers that impact nationally and internationally so
that our findings can be adopted by doctors and patients everywhere.
We collaborate with researchers in more basic
scientific research fields such as genetics, inflammation and mouse-models
which help to unlock exciting new avenues for helping sleep disorder sufferers.

What’s in it for me?
First - A BIG THANK YOU FOR READING THIS PAGE!Our research could directly be targeting your sleep problem,
a related problem or the problems of someone you know and care about!
Even the smallest donation helps and for those of you who
can help a bit more, we extend a small token of appreciation. Results from our
work will be available on our website and can be sent directly to all donors as
requested. 
If you are unable to contribute, please help us spread the
word. Sleep is something we do every single day of our lives and bad sleep
impacts on us all, individually and on society. Sleep research is important.
Share our campaign with your family and friends. For those
of you who might live locally, come and see us at the Edinburgh International Science
Festival on April 13th this year: http://www.sciencefestival.co.uk/whats-on/categories/talk/from-yawn-to-dawn
Thank you!N.B. When about to hit paypal/credit card button the account name will 
appear as Renata Riha -  this is done for legal reasons. Rest 
assured all funds are accounted for and will be used for the stated research

story:
Summary

I am Mallory Carlson. In early August, 2013 I received my diploma for a Masters of Acupuncture from Northwestern Health Sciences University. My time since has been spent with my nose in the books, studying for boards – as well as gathering resources to start up my wellness practice this coming winter. As I also do Craniosacral Therapy, I look forward to incorporating both healing modalities in my practice. I believe immensely in the power of these therapies, and it is my goal to raise the funds to create the optimum healing potential in my office space.

For those of you who don't know much about these therapies, let me offer a concise explanation of each:

Acupuncture is an ancient form of healing which began in China around 3000 years ago. It involves the insertion of fine, solid filiform needles into the skin at specific points (acupoints) to achieve a therapeutic effect by restoring balance to the body. Qi (chi) is a basic concept in Traditional Chinese Medicine - it is the essential life energy within each person and throughout all of nature. It may also the thought of in terms of the function of the body; qi is the force that keeps the body systems running smoothly. When qi is out of balance in one way or another, this is when many problems can arise. Acupuncture is an effective and safe therapy which can be used to encourage qi back into harmony and return the body to a state of health.

What can acupuncture help with?

  • Allergies

  • Pain

  • Sleep Disorders

  • Gynecological Disorders

  • Gastrointestinal Disorders

  • Emotional Disorders

  • Respiratory Disorders

  • Circulatory Disorders

  • Immune Disorders

  • Eye, Ear, Nose and Throat Disorders

  • Addiction

  • Neurological Disorders

  • Dermatological Disorders

  • Diabetes

  • Weight Loss

  • Chemotherapy/Radiation Side Effects

Licensed Acupuncturists not only use needles for treatment, but other "accessory techniques" as well. Just a few examples of this include:

Cupping: Glass cups are place on the skin to create a suction effect. This stimulates blood and qi flow to the local area and can be used to treat conditions from neurological to muscular to visceral.

Auricular (Ear) Therapy: This is the use of small acupuncture needles or adhesive beads to stimulate specific points on the ear. There are many points on the ear which correspond to all of the different areas of the body. The needles are used only in the office during the treatment; the beads, however, are placed onto the ear points and retained for 2-3 days so that the patient may stimulate them for prolonged benefits.

Acupressure: For individuals who may be sensitive to needles, acupressure is an effective alternative. This is simply the stimulation of acupoints using the pressure of the practitioner's fingers.

Craniosacral Therapy (CST) is the gentle manipulation of the body to promote physical and emotional wellness, relieve pain, repair dysfunction and restore the natural position of bones and tissues. CST is a non-invasive therapy which focuses on the head, spinal column, sacrum and various joints of the body. Much of this therapy involves tuning into the body's own wisdom and then facilitating it in adjusting and healing itself. CST is beneficial for relief and management of many existing conditions - as well as preventative care to enhance resistance to disease.

What can CST help with?

  • Headaches/migraines

  • TMJ Syndrome

  • Neck/back pain

  • Motor-coordination imparements

  • Stress and Emotional issues

  • Eye problems

  • Brain and spinal cord disorders

  • Infant and childhood disorders

  • Chronic Fatigue Syndrome

  • Fibromyalgia

  • Post-Traumatic Stress Disorder

  • ADD/ADHD

  • Learning disabilities

  • Central Nervous System disorders

  • Orthopedic disorders

  • Sleeping problems

  • And much more

Why this is important:

The need for natural, safe and holistic medicine is immense. This type of healthcare caters to the whole self – body, heart, mind and spirit. The more prevalent this type of healthcare becomes in communities (especially smaller ones like my own), the more people will turn to it and discover the amazing benefits that practitioners like myself have to offer. Folks may become able to manage pain or emotional issues without the use of pharmaceuticals. Some people may find that better sleep is a very welcome side effect of their treatment for, say... allergies. There are many benefits that acupuncture and CST can bring about – and I am passionate about making my services available to the public. Your contributions will help make my dream of caring for people in a warm and compassionate, yet analytical and cerebral way.

What I need:

Your contributions will go to supplying my business with things like linens, office furniture, needles, cups, ear beads, rubbing alcohol (and other treatment supplies of necessity), helping with rent and other office expenses for the first month, initial purchase of insurance, the purchase of an iPad for accessible, clinical input of Electronic Medical Record data, and initial advertising/promotional endeavors.

What you get:

I have set up many opportunities at different dollar levels to receive coupons for services, or full services themselves. These are a deal! If you are not local, you are certainly welcome to donate your perk to someone who is closer and able to redeem it.

In the event that I do not reach my goal I will graciously use any contributions toward my business to the fullest that I am able.

Other ways you can help:

I fully realize that monetary contributions are not an option for all people. I appreciate your interest in my business and if you are one of those folks who is unable to help out financially at this time, I humbly ask that you help spread the word by sharing this Indiegogo campaign through whatever social networks you like to frequent – facebook, twitter, email, stop people on the street and talk about it! Make some noise! Get excited! Let people know how awesome holistic medicine is and encourage them to donate what they can, be it by funding or by spreading the word further.

Thank you so much! Your help means the world to me!

story:
Our Campaign Goal is to raise funds to build a new gym and academic center for the at-risk youth in our community. 


WHO WE ARE

Hurricane Boxing Gym is a 501(c)(3) non-profit organization which uses the sport of boxing to impact and transform local at-risk youth by encouraging integrity, discipline, respect, values, and morals. Our goal is to remind our junior fighters of their incredible value and worth to the future of their community and this country. 


WHY THE SPORT OF BOXING?

Owner and Founder Will Velez was himself an at-risk youth in the rough city of Newark New Jersey where he grew up. His father placed him in a boxing program at the age of nine. Boxing created a positive and invaluable experience for Will and he wants to provide the same for the kids and the people in his community. 


HOME OF CHAMPIONS

Boxing is not an easy sport, it takes a lot of dedication and hard work. This is why our members practice the sport and this is why they keep returning to our gym. Some of our participants come to the gym to meet their own exercise goals, and some of our members like to participate in amateur boxing tournaments. At Hurricane Boxing gym we encourage all participants to become champions in their own right. 


YOUTH CRIME PREVENTION

Boxing can get young people off the streets, out of trouble, engaged in education, and back on track. Everyone can benefit from participating in a sport, but it can make a particular difference to young people who are difficult to engage in other ways. At Hurricane we have created a physical outlet to underprivileged and troubled youth. Our program strives to enrich their mind, and change their misconceptions about life and society; which in turn can open up windows of opportunities for them. It is for these reasons why the gym continues to work on running a boxing program that we believe can be highly successful in reducing youth crime and help our troubled youth become successful productive adults.

The table below outlines the rising rate of Juvenile delinquency referrals in Hillsborough County since 2010. The rate of referrals increases drastically between the ages of 10 to 15.



I want to Help.. How can I get on board?

There are 3 ways YOU can help Hurricane Boxing Gym get funded:

  1. Donate: This is the most significant way of helping. You will be making sure that our goal becomes a reality. The only way we can thank you is with our hardwork. (...and PERKS)
  2. Share (word of mouth): Tell your friends, your neighbors, your classmates, and your co-workers, tell everyone you know about this great organization and its cause. Sharing the project with your friends and family is the best way to get other folks to pledge.
  3. Broadcast (social media): Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, Pinterest, and Tumblr. If you have them, you can use them to engage and highlight our project.


PERKS

Since we appreciate all of your help and support, we've picked out some perks for every amount that you pledge to help get the gym funded.

CATEGORY 1 AND 2 

We've partnered up with Black & Denim a Lifestyle Brand sourced and manufactured 100% in the USA. This apparel line is proud to be American Inspired, American made, and American owned. We've come up with an Ybor City inspired tee shirt to celebrate the classical age of Boxing. The graphic tee is unique to the Gym and is branded with our name in Bold Bright red and grey font. We hope you like it and encourage you to own one as a proud supporter of the gym. *Please Note*(When campaign is over you will receive an email survey asking you what size shirt you prefer)

                   

Black & Denim Apparel Company


CATEGORY 3 

"A PERFECT STORM"

           

We want you to become a member and see what our gym is all about. Our gym is open to all ages, young and old. If you make a pledge at this amount, we'd like to offer you a great deal that's hard to pass up. With this perk you will get our designer Hurricane tee shirt and a 6 month membership to the gym. There are only 30 of these memberships available so act fast if you want to grab one. *Please Note* (If you make a pledge in the month of March, your membership will start. If you make a pledge in the month of April, your membership will start on May 1st.)


CATEGORY 4 

"THE CONTENDER"

            

At this pledge level you have decided to enter the fight for a good cause. We want to offer you a chance to advertise your company or your organization at our gym. We will place your advertisement banner at our gym, on our website, and we'll rave about you on our social networks. We'd also like to show you our appreciation by providing you with one of our designer Hurricane tee shirts too. Thank you for your support.

CATEGORY 5

"THE CHAMP"

                                                         

You step into the ring and the crowd is yelling " You're The Greatest." No really, you are...If you pledge at this amount we would like everyone to see how much we appreciate your support. We will design special trunks for our young fighters to wear to their boxing matches that feature the logo of your company or organization. We'll place your advertisement banner on our website, and we'll rave about you on our social networks. We also want to invite you to a training session with our young fighters and to one of their matches too. In addition, we'd also like to show you our appreciation by providing you with one of our designer Hurricane tee shirts. 

Thank you so much for your support. 

                                      Please help us make this dream become a Reality. Donate Today. 


Hurricane Boxing Gym | 2326 E. 7th Ave. Tampa ( Ybor City ) Florida 33605 

813-270-4105

story:
English Version:

She is only 14 ... playing the violin and piano and has recently been diagnosed with Brain Tumor.

A girl always active, cheerful and optimistic.

Now Alexandra needs Emergency Surgery possible only outside of Moldova.

Alexandra's Parents  found specialists who agreed to help her in Turkey.

Alexandra emergency must go to Turkey, where she is expected by the end of this month.

With the help of local people, parents were able to collect 5400$ ...but she needs another 16000$ saving Her LIFE.

Her Parents, Marina and Theodore Guzun  appeal to all good people  to help them to Save Alexandra's Life, to see Alexandra smiling, dancing and playing the piano with both hands!

  Come together to help defeat disease Alexandra!

  Every dollar donated will approach Alexandra to Recovery!


Please distribute this post and invite your friends to get involved, bring happiness and save lives!


Contact Us:
+( 373) 79916163 (Teodor )
+( 373) 68509456 (Marina )

For a bank transfer, please find details below: 
Account number: 22520363690 (MDL, USD, EUR)
Bic.MOLDMD2X336 BC"Moldindconbank"
SA, fil. Kiev
Name: Teodor Guzun


_________________________________________________________________________

Romanian Version:

Ea are doar 14 ani...canta la vioara si pian iar recent  a fost diagnosticata cu Tumoare pe Creier. 
O fata mereu activa, vesela si optimista.
Acum Alexandra are nevoie URGENT de o operatie, posibila numai peste hotarele Moldovei.
Parintii Sandutei au gasit specialisti care au acceptat s-o ajute, in Turcia.
Alexandra trebuie sa plece de urgenta in Turcia, acolo unde este asteptata pana la sfarsitul acestei luni.   
Cu ajutorul oamenilor din localitate, parintii au reusit sa adune 5400$.
Doar ca e nevoie de inca  16000$, bani de care la moment Marina si Teodor Guzun nu dispun si fac apel catre toti oamenii de buna credinta să-i ajute s-o vada iar pe Alexandra zambind, dansand si cantand la pian cu ambele maini.
 Haideti impreuna sa o ajutam pe Alexandra sa Invinga Boala!

 Orice banut donat o va apropia pe Alexandra de medicii din Turcia!!!
Va rugam sa distribuiti acest post si sa invitati prietenii vostri sa se implice, pentru a aduce fericire si a salva vieti!
Contacteaza-ne:

+( 373) 79916163 (Teodor )
+( 373) 68509456 (Marina )

Pentru un transfer prin  banca: 
Nr. Cont:  22520363690 (MDL, USD, EUR)
MOLDMD2X336 BC"Moldindconbank"
SA, fil. Kiev

story:
Liver Cancer

    700,000 people are diagnosed with Liver Cancer each year. 600,000 of those people die, including my grandfather. Help donate! 100% of the money is going to the Liver Cancer Foundation. 

    Every single dollar is being donated to support Liver Cancer. I will send it directly into the hands of the American Cancer Society. To find out more, go to: www.cancer.org/donate

For even more information on Liver Cancer, watch the following video (Not made by me). 

    In February, my grandfather (Royce W.) was diagnosed with cancer. After two months, he passed away. This event inspired me, and hopefully you, to support Liver Cancer. 

    


Even if you can't donate, no worries! Share this campaign to others or go to www.cancer.org/donate to support!

   Thank you!

    Every single dollar is being donated to support Liver Cancer. I will send it directly into the hands of the American Cancer Society. To find out more, go to: www.cancer.org/donate

For even more information on Liver Cancer, watch the following video (Not made by me). 


    In February, my grandfather (Royce W.) was diagnosed with cancer. After two months, he passed away. This event inspired me, and hopefully you, to support Liver Cancer. 

    Even if you can't donate, no worries! Share this campaign to others or go to www.cancer.org/donate to support! 
   Thank you!

story:
I am a scientist interested in understanding the mechanisms through which cancer cells grow, move and invade body compartments causing death. During my training I traveled the world to obtain knowledge and develop techniques to investigate the function of a class of proteins called: Ion Channels. Traditionally, these proteins are considered essential to the function of the brain. Ion channels make cells of the brain operative. Nevertheless, our and others recent discoveries have revealed that ion channels can play a fundamental role in controlling cell proliferation of many tissues including cancer.

Sono uno scienziato interessato a capire i meccanismi attraverso cui le cellule del cancro crescono, si muovono ed invadono il corpo causandone la morte. Per i miei studi ho viaggiato nei laboratori del mondo per imparare tecniche ed acquisire le conoscenze per investigare la funzione di una classe specifica di proteine chiamate Canali Ionici. Queste proteine sono state spesso associate al funzionamento del cervello ma sia i miei recenti studi sia quelli dei mie colleghi hanno rivelato che i canali ionici giocano un ruiolo fondamentale per la crescite delle cellule del cancro.

With my group at Loyola University Chicago we are focusing on how we can manipulate ion channels to stop cell proliferation in cancer.  We have shown these ion channels to be critical regulators of cancer cell multiplication AND FDA approved drugs for these channels are already on the market.  We need to: 

1) take this research forward and develop data in support of clinical trials, and 

2) develop citizen advocates and supporters of this research to help us succeed.

Con il mio gruppo alla Loyola University Chicago stiamo studiando un metodo che implica la manipolazione farmacologica diei canali ionici per fermare la proliferazione delle cellule del cancro. Il nostro impegno si focalizza:

1) Sviluppare questa ricerca con lo scopo di iniziare studi sugli uomini

2) Sviluppare una coscienza nei cittadini del mondo per porare la nostra ricerca al successo.



In my laboratory we try to answer the following questions: 

- What are the "X" factors that comprise "on switches" for cancer cell growth? 
- How can we use this knowledge against the cancer?

Nel mio laboratorio ci siamo posti le seguentidomande: 
- Quali sono gli "X" factors che servono alle cellule del cancro per crescere?
- Come possiamo usare queste conoscenze contro il cancro?

Many types of cancers express a ion channels that are not present in tissue from which the cancer have been generated. This suggests that ion channels may be a "X" factor that contribute to cancer cell proliferation. 

Molti tipi di cancro esprimono canali ionici che non sono presenti nei tessuti che hanno generato queste cellule. Questo fatto suggerisce che i canali ionici possono essere uno deigli "X" factors che contribuiscono alla proliferazione dellecellule del cancro 



Can we turn ion channels activity against cancer?

Research in my laboratory has brought to light for the first time that chronic stimulation of a specific class of ion channel, (potassium ion channels) stops proliferation in cancer cell… indefinitely.  However, we face many speed bumps in prosecuting our science. Some see this as a radical idea, and there are barriers to re-purposing drugs from one purpose to another.  This is why we need to develop the science and the public advocacy.

(please click on this link see our work featured as Key Scientific Article on Global Medical Discovery)

and on FOX32 News Channel


Possiamo usare i canali ionici contro il cancro?
La ricerca nel mio laboratorio ha portato alla luce perla prima volta che la stimolazione cronica di una specifica classe di canali ionici arresta la proliferazione delle cellule cancerigene... indefinitivamente.
Molti vedono la nostra ricerca come uan idea radicale (clicca sul link della global medical discovery sopra). Altri pongono barriere per utilizare molecole che gia' esistono sul mercato che porterebbe inevitabilmente ad un ABBASSAMENTO dei costi della terapia. Questi sono i motivi per cui abbihamo bisogno di sviluppare con VOI tutti una coscienza che ci portera' a mogliorare le condizioni sia della ricerca sia della terapia. 
In summary, we found that breast cancer cells treated with drugs that stimulate potassium Ion Channels respond by suppressing the duplication program. Drugs that stimulate these channels are already available.  We just need to know how to deploy these drugs to stop the cancer! We are short manpower and it takes years to gather the grant funding to do this.  We are asking YOU to help us move this forward NOW for the benefit of cancer patients. 
Riassumendo, i nostri studi hanno portato alla conclusione che in cellule del cancro al seno (ed altri tipi di cancro) che vengono trattate con stimolatori di alcuni calai ionici smettono di proliferare. Queste molecule sono gia' presenti sul mercato e non dobbiamo re-inventarle. 
Ora abbiamo bisogno del tuo aiuto per poter reclutare scienziati che hanno capacita' tecniche  per poter approntare gli esperimenti necessari per portare questa ricerca avanti. Ti chiediamo di contribuire allan ostra ricerca e di aiutarci a muovere in avanti i nostri studi sul cancro. 

By using the attacker's power against it we will stop it!   

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Where we stand, what we want, what we ask...

We are proud of the results of our research in cancer biology but we haven’t cured cancer, and we cannot predict when this day will come. Nevertheless, our discovery has identified a new path that will allow us to march faster towards that day. We are very well aware that we are still facing a colossal challenge. Yet, we are confident that it is not an impossible task.

We started from an idea that became 

our project.  

Now we need your help

to make our project  become 

                   your project… everyones project

Dove siamo, cosa vogliamo, cosa chiediamo...

Siamo molto orgogliosi dei risultati della nostra ricerca sul cancro. Non abbiamo curato questa terribile malattia e non possiamo ancora dire quando questo accadra' ma le nostre scoperte hanno identificato una nuova via per muoverci piu' veloci verso questa meta. 

The immediate goal of this fund raise is to collect $50.000 or more that will be allocated for a scientist salary. Your contribution will help hiring a scientist with skills and knowledge that have prepared this individual to join our fight against cancer. We need this person to move forward battling cancer, now that we have identified an opportunity with real clinical possibility.

Lo scopo di questa raccoltra fondi  e' di raccogliere 50.000 dollari da destinare per l'assunzione di uno scienziato con la preparazione tecnico-scientifica adeguata  per eseguire appropriatamente igli esperimeti disegnati nel miolaboratorio. Noi abbiamo identificato la via da seguire, ora abbiamo bisogno di chi la percorre con noi. 

What this scientist will do?

Paradoxically, the efficacy of drugs used for cancer therapy is severely limited by their concentration-dependent toxicity that can become intolerable for the patient. 

- We want to reduce the side effects of anticancer drugs by combining them with ion channels stimulators. The hired scientist will test the effects of drugs-mix to establish the minimal and most efficient dose for each component in suppressing cancer cells growth. Results from this research will help to improve chemotherapy by rendering drug treatments less poisonous to the patients.

- Vogliamo ridurre gli effetti collaterali dell eterapie anticancro. Gli esperimeti condotti con l'aiuto della persona da assumere ci aiuteranno a stabilire la dose minima indispensabile delle molecole per ottenere gli effetti gia' osservati nei nostri studi. 

- We want to test the effects of ion channels activators on more cancers. The hired scientist will be involved in testing the effects of ion channel activators alone or in combination of other  anticancer drugs on different type of deadly tumors including pancreatic and brain cancers. Results from this work will expand our knowledge on manipulation of ion channels activity in cancer.

- Vogliamo studiare gli effetti degli stimolatori dei canali ionici su piu' tipi di cancro. Lo scienziato da assumere ci aiutera' a studiare gli effetti delle molecole combinate con altre drghe gia' esistenti sul mercato. I risultati di questi studi ci porteranno a capire come combinare diverse molecule per ferare la crescita delle cellule del cancro.  

- We want to cut down therapeutic expenses. Ion channels activators are already present on the drug market for treating conditions that are not cancer related. We plan to activate a therapeutic switching program by re-purposing ion channels activators. Results from this research will inevitably lead to a dramatic decrease of costs for therapies.

- Vogliamo ridurre i costi delle terapie. Le molecule che stiamo studiando sono gia' presenti sul mercato. Il nostr opiano di azione implica l'impegi di queste molecole combinate con stimolatori di canali ionici. I risultati di questi approcci porteranno ad un abbattimento radicale dei costi terapeutici. 

- We want you to play a role in the project 

A very important part of our job is to report our discoveries to the scientific community worldwide by publishing results from our studies in peer reviewed scientific journals. However, it is our opinion that the information flow cannot end here, especially if a research study concerns a disease that virtually affects everyone on the planet. We strongly believe that in the modern communication era a scientist is also called to describe his/her scientific results to a broader population. If you have decided to fund our battle against cancer it is because you believe in it. But your participation will not end here.

You have the right to know the details of our research and it is our duty to make it comprehensible to the public. Therefore, part of my group effort will be spent to keep a website in which our published data will open to discussion. You will be part of it. We don’t want you to be a passive recipient of complicated information about cancer. Already misconceptions and incorrect information have generated false hopes.  A cancer patient doesn't deserve that.

We want you become an expert and advocate for our research. We need your educated input and point of view. We need you to become a mediator in discussions between laypeople, government and scientists.

Fund our research and be part of it. Together we will re-purpose the future of cancer. 

Una parte importante del nostro lavoro e'  divulgare i risultati delle nostre ricerche al pubblico competente. Ma il cancro e' un problema di tutti, non solo di chi lo studia. Con il tuo contributo potremo realizzare una pagina web accessibile al pubblico vasto che cerchera' informazioni non necessariamente solo tecniche ma soprattutto  comprensibili.
Abbiamo assitito troppe volte a celebrazioni di approcci sedicenti curativi senza che questi abbiamo portato altro che fakse speranze. I pazienti di cancro non meritano questo. 
La tua partecipazione, il tuo sostegno rendera' gli studi sul cancro seguibili da tutti. Vogliamo che tu diventi esperto dei nostri studi. Vogliamo che tu diventi un mediatore tra cio' che gli esperti dicono con il loro linguaggio tecnico e cio' il pubblico necessita, merita e deve sapere. 

Contibuisci alla nostra ricerca con una donazione. Insieme ripenseremo  il futuro del cancro. 

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Research Material

What is cell proliferation and how can it be a problem...?

In a healthy tissue cells duplicate to replace other cells that have exhausted their functions. This is a very important mechanism to keep the integrity and function of any organ of a human body. Cell division results from activation of a very sophisticated signaling network, the software of a cell. Instead of on/off switches and wires, the cellular network is made of proteins and molecules that respond to external inputs (e.g. growth factors) as well as to internal instructions (e.g. DNA, RNA, and proteins) to execute programs that stimulate or arrest growth. Like musical instruments playing in a concert, activity of a protein or molecule is activated or suppressed in an harmonious and time-dependent manner to keep cell duplication under control and occurring only when really needed. 

Cancer cells escape the "off command". Cancer is ultimately the result of cells that uncontrollably multiply.  An expanding mass will ultimately occupy all the available space, disrupt organ integrity and impair their functions. Moreover, during their fast and furious proliferation some cancer cells can activate programs that will allow them to invade adjacent tissue and eventually migrate to distant sites in which they will continue to proliferate... indefinitely. The result is catastrophic. 

Despite the effort of a multitude of scientists and clinicians who are actively involved in fighting and or prevent cancer, death of millions of cancer patients occurs annually worldwide. A death that is too often occurs in otherwise young and healthy people poses a compelling drive for our search for new therapeutic drugs and/or new targets.

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
